Review: there were four movies that earned jamie lee curtis the title of scream queen in the early two of them were halloween movies but the other two prom night and terror train were the uninspired knockoffs that came directly after the success of halloween the same god am scared there is some guy in mask coming after me routine she did in john carpenters classic jamie lee copies here none of the urgency or suspense terror train takes place on where else train charted some premed students finishing their first four years of higher education most of them will not make it med school though and it is obvious from the foreshadowing done when the conductor complains wish hell they would put radio on that train the conductor character probably has the most lines of anyone even jamie lee from the beginning he is talking his head off he tells one of his coworkers think on this when is the last time someone built shopping mall next train station as if it makes any kind of sense and it only gets better as he engages himself in an argument about the benefits of railroad over recreational vehicles of course the loudmouth conductor is the first person find bloody body is then gone when he brings skeptical trainman back view it forgot mention the prologue it is party three years earlier the same group of students two of them play trick on geeky frat pledge promising him he is going get laid they send jamie lee up stand behind the bed and talk the geek as he comes in noticing form on the bed she says kiss me kenny and he kisses the body on the bed happens be cadaver oh my god they killed kenny you bastards it is sick trick and one jamie lee was not let in on she still has not forgiven the guy as they board the terror train you asshole you cannot have good time without hurting somebody the killing starts before the train even leaves the station since it is new years everyones wearing disguises convenient plot device we have seen before and someone stabs the guy in the groucho mask when no ones looking at least one of the characters says it is groucho mask when the killer dons it and steps aboard it looks like gene shalit who the way would make great killer in slasher movie speaking of weirdlooking dorks who still persist on the entertainment scene one of terror trains most famous gimmicks is the appearance of david copperfield as the magician who regails those aboard illusions set disco music then there is his greatest trick getting laid hair that looks like that for all its attempts at visual style and substance terror train is more lionel than amtrak more prom night than halloween and nothing really worth watching only diehard fans of jamie lee curtis and david copperfield if he truly has any fans should even attempt watch it and it makes me wonder if horror movie set in an rv could be much worse mean when was the last time someone built shopping mall next train station anyway terror train is definitely the cinematic equivalent of sleeper car

according hitchcock and various other filmmakers isolated motels diners gas stations and similar establishments in american southwest can be rather dangerous place for weary travellers at the beginning of eye of the storm german american thriller directed yuri zeltser one of such places becomes deadly for their owners who get murdered during the stick up ten years later their son steven played bradley gregg who was blinded during the incident still runs motel together his older brother ray played craig sheffer hardly anything happens there until alcoholic and abusive william gladstone played dennis hopper gets stranded there his attractive wife sandra played lara flynn boyle their unexpected presence creates the chain of the events that would end in bloodshed yuri zeltser author of this was obviously inspired hitchcocks psycho but he chose add some new and potentially interesting elements the original plot instead of norman bates we have two brothers one of them traumatised physically another mentally sexual tension between beautiful female patron and shy motel clerk is heightened the presence of alcoholic husband eye of the storm is impressive in visual sense photography karl walter lindenlaub providing lot of claustrophobic atmosphere the acting is fine hopper gregg and boyle are comfortable their roles but sheffer at times overacts his psycho routine unfortunately eye of the storm was supposed be intense psychological drama deteriorates into cheap and predictable slasher flick during melodramatic finale in the end this reminds us that original approach cannot prevent filmmakers from wasting too many opportunities special note the profiler fans ally walker appears in the beginning of the in the small role of killers girlfriend

if you have been following william fichtners career and there is absolutely no reason why you should have you might have noticed that he is played some rather similar roles over the years like sully in the perfect storm tough gruff and little bit scary or law in albino alligator tough gruff and little bit scarier or colonel william sharp in armageddon or dwayne engelman in strange days or even his brief appearance towards the beginning of pearl harbor as the abusive father of dannyhere is an actor who gravitates towards tough gruff hardhitting roles is why his performance in what is the worst that could happen is such shock such delight in the fichtner plays blonde haired meticulously dressed overtly effeminate dogloving detective as alex tardio fichtners performance borders on caricature but goes beyond it it borders on offensive but does not really manage it and it borders on clich stereotype but does not quite succumb that definition either in role so diametrically opposed what the actor has played before we should have seen it coming fichtner is not perfectyou can see him struggling little at times concentrating little too hard on the look as he swishes his hand through the air or nuzzles coiffed canine up close and personalbut he is pretty damned good and silly and without question the best thing in the in fact had it not been for fitchners sudden and bizarre appearance and his jarring screen presence thereafter would have walked out for what is the worst that could happen is mesmerizing in its awfulness poorly written haphazardly edited and totally unfunny yes it stars martin lawrence and danny devito so how could that be possible moviegoing experience fichtners performance does not exactly save the and it is not like am recommending what is the worst that could happen solely on the strength of the actors dramatic turnaround but his contributions do raise the films rating from no stars oneandahalf thumbs up fichtner then and thumbs downway way downto everyone else involved in this sorry mess movie so dull and pedestrian and nonsensical it does not even warrant discussion

note some may consider portions of the following text be spoilers be forewarned it is rather easy start tuning out after about twenty minutes of finn taylors first feature dream the fishes when the plodding tedious opening sequence finally pays off potentially provocative setup any hopeful expectations however are soon vanquished as the settles upon being an uninvolving mismatchedbuddy movie is rarely as funny as it aspires be nor nearly as affecting as it eventually strives be in the films latter half the films central characters are terry david arquette depressed lonely voyeur who claims be despondent since the death of his wife in an automobile accident and nick brad hunt carefree young street tough later revealed be terminally ill nick lives in the apartment building across from terry who spies on the trysts between nick and girlfriend liz kathryn erbe his trusty set of binoculars but the two young men first formally meet at the bay bridge where halfdrunk terry precariously teeters upon the edge unconvincingly vowing suicide nick casually asks for terrys wristwatch and eventually cons terry into trade the watch for bottle of pills of course terry finds that the pills do not end up having the presumed lethal effects and he angrily sets out find nick in order retrieve his watch learning of nicks condition he only has handful of weeks left terrys compassion kicks in and the two eventually come distinctly peculiar arrangement terry will agree bankroll the dying nicks lifelong fantasies and nick will fulfill terrys death wish killing him this is promising premise and mr taylors could have gone any number of ambitious ways from this point but he instead chooses capitalise upon the obvious inversion of the characters terry is repessed mournful character who wants die while nick is free spirit joie de vivre who is dying but wants live and takes the easy route out turning dream the fishes into typical lark where the two characters engage in series of generally dull exploits and where the straightlaced character learns enjoy and ppreciate life when hooked up quirky character this is bythenumbers plotting buddy movieroad movie redux however dream the fishes is most hampered not its uninspired storyline but the characters carry the story it helps in such have at least one of the protagonists be at least somewhat empathetic if not likeable unfortunately that is not the case here where both of the films leading characters are thorougly uninteresting and annoying giving the audience very little sympathise their respective plights and even less reason want follow their onscreen exploits far from romp this fatal flaw makes dream fishes more like chore endure than playful jaunt and undermines the attempts at emotional resonance in the latter stages of the as the two men begin bond mr taylors dialogue sporadically falls flat in dream the fishes while attempting capture quirky and clever tone it too often comes across instead as hopelessly contrived witness such lines as you should have asked something more interesting like do you enjoy the pain see that is provocative leaves room for further questions the enjoys few inspired moments the urn scene session of nude bowling the policeman joining in on terry and nicks acid trip but unfortunatetely these instances are few and far between and for the most part the humour in dream the fishes registers more as attempts rather than actual successes this occurs particularly often during the films opening sequence as terry is wrestling the bedridden nick for his watch in the hospital am realising that this is intended be funny although nary smile crept upon my lips is probably due the obvious fact that it is painfully clear the audience from the outset that terry is going be thwarted in his initial suicide attempts sapping any element of surprise or amusement from nicks scheme of tricking him this is not has the wherewithal kill off its leading star in the opening ten minutes the entire sequence is then clearly an exercise for character exposition attempts at humour terribly diminished utter predictability among the cast coming off best is david arquette the current master in the portrayal of meek squirming stammering freshfaced characters he would have been terrific as the lead for george huangs swimming sharks who gets apply his adeptness for timidity as terry mr taylor ambitiously employs an interesting visual technique where the portions of the set in an urban environment have been processed appear extremely grainy and heavily saturated as opposed bright crisp look for the smalltown scenes the charge of dream the fishess protagonists being wholly unempathetic is bit of an odd one coming from me seem have predilection for films unlikeable characters and indeed in many cases have been in the minority supporting films have been condemned as interminable due the difficult audienceunfriendly nature of their characters for dream the fishes though did find myself on the flip side of coin often hoping that the would quickly conclude and that the nick character would just hurry up and die

for his directoral debut gary oldman chose highly personal family drama about violent alcoholic husband and father and the various lives he affects but while the characters places and events may have special meaning the writerdirector the audience is left in the dark the center of this tale is the abusive raymond ray winstone and the focuses on him and the people who orbit around him he spends his days hanging out his friends at pubs and girlie bars then he returns home his pregnant wife valerie kathy burke and their fiveyearold daughter raymond demonstrates his violent tendencies and his paranoid delusions early on when he accuses valeries brother billy charlie creedmiles of stealing raymond then proceed beat and bite him bloody wreck but these are the least of billys problems billy is heroin addict on the downturn and it does not seem that he will last much longer billy and valeries mother janet laila morse is raymonds nemesis she disapproves of him and he of her but is powerless do anything about it she merely struggles on hoping her children will survive their respective torments if this description seems bleak have not told the half of it this is not cheery movie and most of the time it is downright depressing while at times it is interesting watch see just what makes raymond tick and why no one ever simply calls the cops on him in the end it is not quite worth it there are too many scenes randomly dot the picture little or no purpose take for example the extended sequence where one of billys scuzzy friends defends stray puppy the is filled these character moments that never really achieve anything granted there are few genuinely powerful and sickening moments in the but their expression seems be more of catharsis for the creator than us the actors do fine job particularly in the central roles the good thing about an actor turned writer is that oldman knows how write good scenes and the actors in nil mouth have some meat they can tear into the bad thing about an actor turned director is that there is no one restrain oldman from making poor choices good character drama should mean something those involved in making the and the audience oldman got it about half right

my first exposure the nightmare on elm street series of films was not this one but in fact the third installment it was the first gain national theatrical release did not see the first until much later so looking back the original did not hold lot of great memories for me since did not think too much of it when initially saw it watching it now for second time confirmed that it is an overrated horror that ultimately makes no sense whatsoever you all know the story now child murderer freddy krueger robert englund returns from the grave haunting the dreams of the children of those who burned him alive years before this first installment does an adequate job it is low budget but there is some absurd dialogue and conceptual problems the story plus the movies ending understandably the result of the studio wanting the end of the have hook for sequel renders the rest of the pointless and does anyone understand what happens nancys mother at the end of this do not get me wrong though it is not as if new generation of horror films have spurned me away from the classics most horror movies released today are just as inane as this is horror is difficult genre pull off credibly and nightmare on elm street just does not cut it nightmare on elm street is available on dvd from new line home video it is available both as single disc and as part of the nightmare on elm street collection box set the is presented in both pan and scan and it is original theatrical aspect ratio of although on the disc that comes in the box set only widescreen transfer is provided the has been digitally remastered and includes two options for audio mono mix and new dolby digital mix also included on the dvd is fulllength audio commentary track writerdirector wes craven stars john saxon and heather langenkamp and the films director of photography other extras include the jump nightmare feature am sure you can figure that one out the usual cast and crew bios are from the films original press release kit and notably leave out robert englund and johnny depp and the films original theatrical trailer some dvdrom features are also included but since do not have dvdrom capabilities cannot really get into that the commentary track is entertaining and informative but nothing spectacular the first thing of note is that it is the same commentary track that was on the special edition laserdisc from few years ago am not saying that is negative thing just pointing it out everyone seems enthusiastic about being there the possible exception of john saxon who just does not say much at all most of the time you will forget he is even there everyone else talks really quietly though for some reason as if because they are commenting on scary movie that they need stay as quiet as possible the bonus disc the boxed set called the nightmare series encyclopedia features about minutes worth of interviews relating the first of the series also included is the original theatrical trailer and two alternate endings the however you can only access one easily the other is hidden in what is called the labyrinth might possibly be the most annoying feature of dvd ever created basically it is an interactive game of sorts where you wander through different nightmare locations looking at objects give you access extra little snippets of footage interviews etc somewhere in the labyrinth is the second alternate ending the finding it though is both chore and bore r

in tim burton took the legendary comic book figure of batman and turned him into huge box office hit an atmospheric little that created an utterly distinct feeling somewhere between noir and the godfather was it deep nope however it was perfect entertainment and the audience ate it up it was natural that roger ebert trashed it writing that it was without the comic book uplift of the indiana jones and superman pictures was true if what you were looking for was the tale of heroic mans escadapes and adventures you were looking in the wrong place if those films were tom sawyer then batman was huckleberry finn some critics glenn lovell of the san jose mercury news and peter travers of rolling stone realized that it was something special mr lovell gave it and wrote that this is batman as batman should be mr travers called it one of the ten best films of the year the praise was deserved from start finish the was enthralling exciting and superb in every respect there was no doubt that there would be sequel directed burton the result was batman returns forgets that it wants be fun within the first five minutes the villains the hideous penguin and seductive catwoman take over and our epectations are always left unfulfilled when we wanted the penguin bite off batmans nose he simply gets mad and when we want catwoman slither over batmans body she gets pushed off building admire mr burton for trying do more then entertain but the result is mess nothing works out as planned it fails both entertain and enlighten hints are made the audience that this could be blast alas these are only hints there are do not misunderstand me several moments of cinematic genuis contained catwoman and batman understand eachother perfectly without word on the subject being said christopher lloyd is trapped the penguin within giant cage small basket is dropped into large river but nothing is drawn together and burton is unable make the work on any regular basis weak followup both career and sequel wise batman returns is sometimes dazzling but often dissapointing

and thought stigmata would be the worst religiouslyoriented thriller released this year turns out was wrong because while stigmata was merely boring and selfimportant end of days is completely inept on all fronts it is silly incomprehensible endlessly stupid mess for guy like me who grew up watching arnold schwarzenegger at his best it is extremely disconcerting see where the big man has ended up for the first time in recent memory an arnold action movie and batman robin does not count is no fun at all end of days is major stinker the movie opens in vatican city some catholic priests have observed an ancient prophecy says that girl will be born on that night that satan will have targeted for impregnation if he impregnates her between and midnight on december the world will be destroyed the pope orders protection of this girl though some priests believe she ought be killed in new york that very night girl is born fulfill the prophecy twenty years later we meet jericho cane schwarzenegger suicidal excop drinking problem now working as security guard for hire he is protecting local businessman gabriel byrne who is actually possessed the devil an assassination attempt on the businessman crazed former priest leads him the girl satan is after christine york robin tunney recognizing elements of his own murdered daughter in christine including ownership of the same music box apparently jericho swears protect her against the devil and the faction of priests looking kill her there are so many problems this it is hard know where begin but how about starting the concept casting arnold in role like this was mistake begin schwarzenegger is persona not an actor so putting him in role that contradicts his usual strong personality is bad idea arnold has neither the dramatic range nor the speaking ability pull off character tormented conflicting emotions in other words trying give him dimension was mistake harrison ford mel gibson or even bruce willis could have played this role they have all played noble and flawed heroes but not schwarzenegger there are several scenes that attempt establish jerichos character one has him contemplating suicide another crying over the loss of his wife and daughter and even one in the devil tries tempt him into revealing christines location offering him his old life back none of these scenes really work because arnie is not up the task the filmmakers would have been better off making jericho strong confident character like the terminator for example the likes of schwarzenegger has excelled in before this one is not at all believable the way arnold plays him the supporting cast tries their hardest and only gabriel byrne makes any impact at all as the prince of darkness he is suave and confident he acts like one would expect the devil act the problem is that the script has him doing things that make no sense more on that later and that undermines him as powerful villain byrne outperforms arnold in every scene they have together including the aforementioned temptation bit but this is problematic when it causes the audience start doing the unthinkable root for the devil byrnes speech about the bible being overrated actually starts make sense mainly because arnolds attempts at refuting it mostly of the tis not variety are feeble at best the only problem is arnold has win so in the end nobody really cares kevin pollack plays jerichos security guard sidekick and tries liven things up some comic asides but like most bad action movie sidekicks he disappears after about an hour robin tunney is not given much do except look scared in fact all of the supporting players are good actors but none save for byrne is given anything interesting do performances aside it would be really hard enjoy this no matter who starred in it this being an action blockbuster it is no surprise that the worst thing about it is the script starts off totally confusing and when some of it is explained and not much of it is it is utterly ridiculous why is the devil coming on new years eve because it is exactly years after the year of the devil is not it turns out some nutty priest accidentally read it upside down so the real year is so just add the beginning and you have got if you do not buy this explanation you are not alone it is convoluted and silly at the same time the method jericho locates christine york is equally ludicrous she is christine see and she lives in new york see and if that were not bad enough there is plenty of bothersome stuff in this that is not explained at all why can satan kill everyone he passes on the street but when it comes snuffing out one drunk excop he is powerless is he impervious only one kind of bullet how come he cannot control jericho or christine and how did those gregorian monks deal time zones in their prophecies clumsy attempt at joke is made about this but it is never actually explained usually this sort of thing would not matter in schwarzenegger flick mean do not get me started on the time paradoxes offered up the terminator movies but this time the plot inconsistencies stand out even more than usual because the action is rarely exciting there are several predictable horror clich present in end of days complete the old black cat hiding in cabinet bit not that we ever find out what the cat was doing in there it gets so formulaic that it is possible for those uninterested in being scared close their eyes at the precise moment boo will come their predictions will rarely be wrong the more grandiose action sequences are utterly charmless partially because we do not care about these characters due the scripts pathetic attempts at characterization and setup and also because they too do not make any sense there is scene where schwarzenegger gets thrown around room little old lady it is good for few chuckles but not much else supposedly we are believe she now has super strength virtue of being controlled satan but the script never sets that up so the scene is merely silly none of this is terribly exciting because all the action sequences are so badly framed that it is often hard tell why it is happening in the first place not mention that they are edited in fullon incomprehensible mtv quickcut style most of them had me scratching my head rather than saying wow cool end of days is not only silly and confusing but it is also distinctly unpleasant watch the devil apparently does not operate in the more subtle willconvincepeopletokilleachother fashion outlined in the bible but instead enjoys killing people gruesomely in broad daylight this does not only make him an awfully predictable sort but it also means that not single scene in end of days goes without unnecessarily graphic violence or the odd kinky sexual encounter yet another bit that had me scratching my head if violence is supposed be shocking it is not good idea throw so much of it into movie that the audience goes numb scenes are not connected through any reasonable means so lot of the time stuff gets blown up or people get killed and had no idea why reasons hell reasons let us just blow stuff up is not it cool nope not long shot this is thoroughly unwatchable it is dull interminable and unrelenting in its stupidity perhaps arnold needs make some movies james cameron revive his career because it is not happening hack peter hyams here end of days might have had camp value if only it did not top itself off an overly pious ending that nobodys going buy if the movie is going be serious the filmmakers should have come up decent script if it is going be campy arnold should not be taking himself so damn seriously did not actually see him put up on cross did and his character should not be such sad sack as it stands end of days is just bad movie and an awfully gloomy one at that

stephen please post if appropriate mafia crime is not funny business homer yen on particular night when found myself having some free time had chance either go sleep early or see mafia spoof of mafia and crime films such as the godfather goodfellas and casino at minutes in length thought that could enjoy few laughs before getting good nights sleep but my account think that my laffometer only registered few grins one giggle and maybe one chortle suppose that you could justify your time as homage the venerable star lloyd bridges who just recently passed away and whose last performance was in this mafia chronicles vincenzo cortinos lloyd bridges life separated from his family when he was young he escapes america and tries live an honest life but as fate would have it vincenzo grows up be powerful and klutzy crime lord following in his footsteps are his two sons joey billy burke and anthony jay mohr like all siblings in powerful crime families they squabble over power the future of the family fortune and women mafia is cowritten jim abrahams who also contributed some gutbusting funny spoofs such as airplane and the naked gun but these previous movies were funny because the jokes seemed more universally understood and there was more of manic silliness at work as write this also wonder how many people have actually seen the movies on this spoof is based crime movies in general contain lot of profanity and violence it is tough genre parody was kind of hoping that they could somehow spoof the profanity used in all of those crime movies maybe having all of the tough crime lords say please as they decide sector take over but this opportunity was never explored there were one or two moments that made me smile such as the scene where vincenzo is dancing his newly wed daughterinlaw gunman shoots him several times the impact of the bullets cause him make these wild contortions that force the wedding band change music styles keep up him from the samba disco the macarena think that just gave away the best part of the oh well that just means that you can go sleep little earlier

die hard is an altogether unfortunate fiasco inferior the original in every respect place the blame squarely on the shoulders of steven de souza and doug richardson who wrote the films pathetic screenplay every line of dialogue reeks of either smarmy sap or forced humor the plot is altogether implausible the convoluted story line involves band of terrorists who take over dulles airport and shut down the control tower leaving dozen planes stranded in the air waiting land the has zero credibility and all of the characters come off as cliched cardboard cutouts so much for the script how about the action well let us put it this way director renny harlin could learn few things from john mctiernan who directed the original as well as the hunt for red october and predatorall standouts for their hairraising suspense contrast harlin does not have clue when it comes choreographing action and consequently die hard never picks up steam die harder is impossible take seriously even for minute in fact the movie often seems deliberately campy and it almost reaches the threshold of being so bad it is good you do laugh but you laugh at the not it die hard should have never been cleared for takeoff

i admit it thought arnold schwarzenegger had knack for comedy when he made twins and true lies watching him in jingle all the way wondered why anyone ever thought he could carry such lame movie targeted at susceptible kids it was one thing scare the crap out of kids the pg kindergarten cop but parents who let small children see this movie will have explain themes of violence alcohol consumption burglary racism and child molestation and you know they will burst out in tears when arnold punches one of santas elves he later decks reindeer hey man why do not you just kick the easter bunny in the nuts while you are at it jingle all the way is formula crap that follows the if someone falls on his ass it must be funny school of thought arnold sinbad and phil hartman crash the ground more times in this movie than special olympics hockey team and the movie dredges up more cliche and less believability each successive scene what can you expect from movie whose entire premise is that two parents cannot find rare toy on christmas eve and will do anything get one arnold is of course one of the parents crack salesman who is never there for his son he races from the office his sons karate game only find out he missed it and his kid distrusts him because he is never around gee we have not seen that in movie before arnold the absentee father becomes convinced that the only way buy back his sons affection is get him turboman doll his wife rita wilson who will never be the breadwinner of the hanks household choosing roles like this told him get weeks ago so arnold sets out find turboman turns out be more rare than the tickle me elmo was when jingle all the way came out let me back up for minute here arnolds kid is totally obsessed this turboman character is unhealthy beyond belief watches the show eats the cereal sleeps on the freakin turboman sheets would try discourage any further obsession myself lest any kid seeing this movie think it is wonderful thing con your dad into racing out buy you any toy you want but nooooo the climax of jingle all the way has arnold dressed up as turboman in parade exonerating himself of all wrongdoing in the eyes of wife and son who do not recognize him until the last minute this is sad movie all the way through but it only gets worse after the opening scenes of arnold and mailman sinbad stampeding through store racing off the mall and hooking up santa jim belushi who runs bootleg toy factory most painful watch is scene at radio station where sinbad holds off the cops letter bomb after beating up the deejay an embarrassed martin mull who said he was giving away turboman doll capitalism has produced some pretty evil things chia pets but this ode excess and violent consumerism is one of the most shameful never mind the subplot perfect neighbor phil hartman trying seduce wilson while arnold is off shopping your cookies are incredible it is the main plot of the movie that sends the message that it is okay do whatever it takes get your hands on what you want maybe that is what christmas is like at the schwarzenegger house but not at mine

when the haunting arrived in theaters all kept hearing about was the overdone special effects and the fact that very often the unseen bumps in the night in horror are far scarier than those that you can put face courtesy of special effects while agree that this remake of the haunting goes bit overboard in the visual effects department do not think that they are completely blame for this movies failure it appears that some people have failed take into account that the original haunting had the unseen terrors and it was about as scary as dust bunny so special effects or not if the story is not the least bit scary you are not going end up very frightening movie the thing that interested me most about this movie was the caretaker of this building played bruce dern dern is always great and even though he may have had only about minutes of screen time he was still the most interesting element of the movie as sat through the seemingly endless albeit fairly impressive special effects kept wishing that this movie was about derns caretaker and not the one dimensional characters that populated the cast never good sign when bit player is the best part of the movie liam neeson plays scientist who is conducting experiments on fear he decides the best way get results is trick group of fairly unstable individuals spend few days in haunted mansion he tricks them into participating letting on that he is conducting an experiment on insomnia and he also fails mention that the mansion has reputation for strange goingson catherine zetajones lili taylor and owen wilson play his subjects like the original taylors character is the star of the movie but since she does not quite have the marquee power of liam neeson and ms zetajones their parts did seem be big larger than in the original and let us face it probably half the people who see this movie will do so because of zetajones will admit that would have never seen this thing if she were not in it but the real stars here is the special effects combined the fairly overdone sets they take over the movie as the supernatural elements of the house start interact our hapless insomnia patients there really is not much of story here just endless setups so director jan de bont can showcase all the nifty special effects that he got play and the special effects are great in many cases they are as good as you are likely see anywhere in other cases they are overdone and obviously thrown in just for the sake of hitting the cool shots quota at no point in the movie do any of these things ever come close being scary funny maybe but not scary then we have the set when first saw the house was very impressed the very cool gothic look about it but it only took short tour the characters around the place see that the set designers obviously had as much money burn as the visual effects people did and decided take the idiotically overdone route this included flooded hallway books as stepping stones and mirrored circular room that revolves what part did these rooms play in the story absolutely none they were just there take our minds off the fact that there was neither descent story nor single scare in the entire movie then we have the actors lili taylor has never been one of my favorites and when the fact that her character is mousy and pathetic is factored in she comes in around the average or slightly below mark have no idea why liam neeson took this role he basically reminded me of the ringmaster at an out of control circus his character was in charge of this farce but it quickly got away from him have no doubt that liam will want lock all prints of this movie in very secure vault along all copies of darkman zetajones was cast because she is too hot for words the fact that her character is bisexual is just icing on the cake all catherine has do in this movie is look good fortunately that is something she does very well while she does have fairly good size part it is obvious that her only purpose in the movie was as eyecandy it is too bad someone of her talents wasted them here any random supermodel pulled out of fashion show could have easily filled her role the haunting is the antithesis of another of horror movies the blair witch project the haunting had seemingly limitless effects budget while blair witch relies on piles of rocks for its scares both prove quite nicely that special effects are irrelevant horror if the story sucks it is all downhill from there my advice if you are looking for special effects go rent star wars if it is scares you want rent halloween either way it is probably in your best interests skip the haunting

plot set in the future courier has uploaded some data into hard drive that resides in his head and must now escape the bad guys who are after that very important information since he overloaded his hard drive he is also racing against the clock before the information seeps into his brain and kills him critique incoherent boring oneact drivel no suspense horribly unbelievable futuristic environment bad dialogue careerdefining bad acting keanu reeves and hilarious ending it is too bad because the premise of the was interesting but unfortunately for my friends and this movie turned out be just as bad as everyone had warned us it is one of those films that makes you start laughing halfway through when you realize that most of the actors in it suck the location shots are filmed in dark junkyard type areas they would like have us believe be futuristic whatever and all the sets look like well sets there is also absolutely no arc this story it basically starts off keanu uploading info into his brain and then bunch of folks chasing him from place place until laughable ending puts stop the former uneventful proceedings gibson should stick writing novels and xfiles episodes since his segue into the paranormal tv series was much more entertaining than any of this garbage some other hilarities of this include dolph lundgren as some futuristic jesus character whose supposed kick ass henry rollins as pumpedup cyberdoctor or something and icet as some kind of hobo dude paint all over his face do not ask the ending is the funniest some robot dolphin and stupid ghostlady from inside the computer doing some stuff that no one really cares about that point am ashamed say this was shot in my hometown of montreal canada but sadly enough for us all it was some of the cybertravelling special effects were okay hence the but overall it is one of those bad movies that is just funny watch and cringe at thankfully for keanu he redeemed his scifi career the matrix it is too bad that he has yet redeem his lack of acting talent little known facts about this and its stars as of director robert longo never directed another fullfeature hmmm now is not that odd writer william gibson immigrated from the us canada in after being rejected for the draft he lived in toronto at first but since has made vancouver his home his novel neuromancer and its sequels count zero and mona lisa overdrive are generally considered be the definitive works of the cyberpunk sciencefiction subgenre this garnered keanu reeves nomination in the worst actor category in the razzie awards

i am steven seagal fan only say this now because mufti splenetik is not my real name and because probably need explain why went into this expecting great things any proud seagal fan worth his beans will tell you that the seagal formula is something you can depend on seagal films can always be counted on for minimal dialogue heaps of expendable baddies extemely crunchable bones we will always hear when seagal does his limbtwisting thing rarely female colead in sight unless it is reallife modelwife who has not worked since weird science and usually the worst possible titles you can imagine not mention very straightforward plots generally allround bad dialogue and mr implacable leatherface himself in that same black outfit he is been in since nico doing his my hands are sharp nimble knives thing seagal the stoic sir petrified ponytail duke of dull in the glimmer man seagal breaks out of this formula he gets sidekick attempts banter and puts on new vest he is also put on quite lot of weight small potatoes you may say man should be able accessorize and banter if he wants but damnit if it as not broke why fix it more on this disappointed persons dashed expectations later as jack cole seagal is homicide detective questionable past while he and his partner played keenen ivory wayans are investigating series of ritual killings cole himself becomes suspect especially when background check run campbell reveals practically nothing on cole it turns out that cole is former trained government assassin you just cannot trust these homicide detectives someone whom victims used catch just glimpse of in the jungle before he pounced on them and hence well you know that glimmer man thing an increasingly fishy homicide investigation in the present soon leads the gradual uncovering of larger more threatening conspiracy that involves crooked businessman bob gunton coles former cia boss brian cox and deals involving chemical weapons the glimmer man plot is pretty standard stuff drawing as his other films elements from the hotter films of the year eg seen it is the other changes that disappoint for example although there is fair amount of violence in this movie there is also the disastrous pairing of seagal keenen ivory wayans probably the best known of the wayans tribe how many are there exactly from televisions in living colour wayans plays whiney straightman seagals beadadorned and brocadedraped cole keeping up his are you crazy part of the dialogue wasted zest as campbell wayans confines himself bemoaning his new partners eccentric habits but the chemistry between the two is minimal and seagals wooden comebacks make for painful watching cook in under seige seagal is now buddhist who speaks chinese and wears prayer beads and intricate silk jackets over his normal black ensemble he chants refuses fight unless truly provoked and introduces campbell powdered deer penis cure his allergies again benign if trite plot device except for the fact that these new character traits require seagal speak more than usual heck he has deliver punchlines and carry steady conversation someone other than himself for large part of the is that lot ask of the seague too much seagals best characteristic used be that he knew his purpose in this already complicated world of movies crunchily snap off bad guy appendages and do it silently and alone not for seagal the snappy oneliners of arnold and stallone nor the attempts show that he can act much less think no kindergarten cop no oscar just simple unadulterated deathblows that is really how it must have started likeminded fans who knew what they wanted streamed in watch the seague do his thing knowing that never in the seagal universe would they ever have see him do anything else we trusted him we got know him now betrayal do not know if can watch another seagal movie without that little niggling doubt that he is going try be funny again will try but it will not be easy if you have not watched the glimmer man yet you might want wait for the video come out it is easier just fast forward the dialogue parts and linger on the action sequences after all if we cannot depend on our fantasies what can we depend on the flying inkpot rating system wait for the tv broadcast little creaky but still better than staying at home gotcha pretty good bring friend amazing potent stuff perfection see it twice mufti spelenetik is still steven seagal fan everybody makes mistakes once in awhile

the th warrior comes at the end of as summer where we have already experienced man eating sharks deep blue sea man eating crocodiles lake placid and even man hunting witch the blair witch project now the th warrior presents tribe of flesh eating men who believe that they are bears the story if that is what you want call it follows ahmed ibn fahdlan antonio banderas an arabian poet who falls in love his kings wife and is banished from his home land he then travels the land of the vikings and becomes an ambassador them eventually the vikings are called upon protect the people of the village who are being hunted the flesh eating men thirteen warriors are chosen go on the mission and as you guessed it ahmed is chosen as the thirteenth he is not warrior and at first not well accepted the vikings but as the movie advances he will have prove himself both on and off the battlefield that is basically the entire plot there is also romantic subplot that has been so badly mishandled and one assumes drastically cut that you begin wonder why the filmmakers did not just edit out all of the scenes attaining that part of the story instead they chose leave just enough of those scenes in annoy the viewer the is basically non stop action and when it pauses and tries develop story it becomes laughing stock the battle scenes although well choreographed are not involving and not the least bit exciting we do not get know any of the characters and so we do not care who lives and who dies the wants be beowolf comes across more as failed actionadventure story aspiring epic proportions but not achieving it on any levels it was directed john mctiernan who is the thomas crown affair is also playing in theaters currently and it is not that mctiernan worked simultaneously on both films but that the th warrior was placed on the shelf for so long the studio just waiting for time dump it on audiences it belongs back on the shelf

when watch movie like mike nichols what planet are you from cannot help but feel like everyone is looking at me it is as if all the audience is gazing at the back of my head in the darkness eyes shooting daggers quietly blaming me for the fact that they paid hardearned money spend their time watching this this thing shift uncomfortably in my seat am reminded of how feel when see pair of second or thirdrate celebrities engaging in teleprompted funny conversation introduce the next blockbuster award it is not my fault know it is not my fault but dammit someones gotta be embarrassed because it does not look like anyone on the screen is ready take the blame am about give you list of names of people who are gonna make movie together garry shandling annette bening john goodman greg kinnear mike nichols do any of these names make you instantly shudder the answer would have come up before today is no this is quite list of talented individuals we have got here granted john goodman was in the flintstones and greg kinnear has turned in some lessthanlackluster leading man performances in certified failures like smile like yours but even so they have got proven power as excellent supporting players garry shandling has two television classics under his belt his ingenious little it is garry shandlings show and the larry sanders show and for gods sake mike nichols directed the graduate and annette bening is just walking away from american beauty so explain this this thing what planet are you from purports be comedy exploring the relationship between men and women satirizing the whole poppsychology marsvenus phenomenon but what this movie winds up being is collection of unfunny cringeinducing moments coupled uninsightful cringeinducing moments the end result is unsurprisingly an unfunny uninsightful cringeinducing thoroughly icky embarrassment garry shandling plays an alien from planet populated technologically advanced but emotionally vacant males they reproduce through cloning of course his leaders put select group of males through series of tests designed determine one is most fit fly off earth find female of the species and impregnate her they are taught how pretend that they are listening nodding and saying uhhuh and how compliment shoes imagine my delighted surprise when oh heavens all their carefully practiced tactics turn out fail miserably producing comedic results the lucky winner is fitted penis since theirs after generations of disuse have long since shrunk out of existence will restrain myself from mentioning the implausibility of such scenario since the population has stopped evolving due the fact that they are all just clones whoops too late the penis when aroused tends make humming noise the writers when frequently strapped for ideas tend turn this as source of comedy it is not funny the first time it is not funny the eighth time it is not funny the eighteenth time if anything it made me feel vaguely selfconscious garry meets up coworker at bank played greg kinnear who turns out be generic unlikable scumbag he is meant fill the part of unfortunate role model for shandlings alien character but he is so flatly drawn that even the writers quickly give up and toss him aside kinnears scumbagginess is demonstrated the fact that he claims other peoples work as his own worm his way into vice presidents position and goes aa meetings pick up chicks wow what magnificent bastard nearly every man in the movie in fact is played as the same sort of sexdriven slimeball when kinnears wife walks into the office there is not single guy who does not trip bump into wall or otherwise pratfall as if they would never seen woman before the few guys that are not particularly slimeballs such as john goodmans detective character are simply uncommunicative workaholics shandling meets up annette bening who will inevitably prove be the love he never knew existed at one of kinnears aa meetings shandlings mission is have baby and when he reveals his desires her bening instantly falls for him and the next day they get married yup the next day cuz ya see it turns out she wants baby too benings character perhaps was the most difficult watch especially after seeing her come apart at the seams so effectively in american beauty if her character here is supposed be representing the female of the species as whole then woe say the species she is unfathomably insecure and succumbs so easily all of shandlings lines and lies that it borders on tragic there is point where after thinking she may not be able bear children she learns that she is indeed pregnant when garry comes home after nearly cheating on her she strolls into the kitchen and sings high hopes you know the uplifting ant and the rubber tree plant song deliver the news and then says him now you cannot leave me we are supposed empathize shandlings discovery of the feeling of guilt but instead wanted weep for bening that she was placing her entire life and soul firmly in the lap of great big nothing and eventually shandling falls in love her for real suppose though am not sure exactly what prompted it what is the message derive from all this men are liars inherently empty creatures but if you hang around long enough well maybe something will click ha ha ha am thankful such broad cynicism is not frequently allowed run so rampant let us all join hands and pray that the planet these folks are from is not this one there is also subplot involving john goodman as an airline incident investigator that wades in the bog of stupidity goodman through series of astoundingly implausible realizations puts together the fact that shandling is being from another world magic vibrating penis it has all the makings for subplot of having shandling be discovered that thankfully never comes the inevitable hackneyed fruition instead it just dangles limply on the branch for while withers and falls away further proof that goodman should just stick doing coen brothers movies but let us not dwell on this any longer have already wasted plenty of your time and my own let us move on forget about what we have seen here and get on our lives and help us out let us end things on happy note congratuations go out annette bening winner of this weeks title award for delivering the awkward line of dialog containing the movies name

it seems like am reviewing cheeseball horror movies on monthly basis now scream revitalized genre the studios are now intent on burying into the ground againthe serial killers in these new slasher movies have nothing on sony and miramax in the relentless department still know what you did last summer is terrible in many respects but in the wake of the stupefyingly bad urban legend it is citizen hook jennifer lovehewitt reprises her role as buxom teenager julie jameswho apparently escaped certain doom at the end of the last movie waking up she lives in fear of ben willis the vengeful fishermanvictim of hit and run julie and her pals paranoid and beat she accepts free trip the bahamas from her friend karla norwood winner of the local radio stations th of july getaway giveaway bikiniready julie invites boyfriend ray prinze jr whoand heres the movies biggest mysteryturns her down but changes his mind and plans surprise her before takeoff until he gets roadside visit from captain hellliner himself that is unaware of this and feeling shunned julie goes on vacation anyway karla karlas boyfriend pfeiffer and will matthew settle real boynextdoor type who is sweet on julie make long story shorti cannot believe it took paragraph describe the setup for this gratuitous sequelthe trip is disaster not only is it storm season not only is the desk clerk the frighteners jeffrey combs jerk not only are the few island residents and our heroic vacationers getting picked off the resourceful willis onebyone but the karaoke machine is not working properly you think killing is hard try reprogramming laserdisc so that gloria gaynors will survive now contains the lyric still know what you did last summer all is not lostray is on his way save the day and helpful witch doctor is saying little prayers for julie and co this picture is really about breasts two of them julie like good horror heroine never does up her shirt the collar always wears white in the rain and keeps sexy underwear on in case of sudden desire tan based on the hormonal charge got out of the movie cannot imagine what it was doing the ten year old boy who sat next mehe gets jennifer lovehewitt and my generation got heather langenkamp lucky bastard did not like know what you did last summer and cannot say liked this continuation any more or less the pacing in both films is languidhow is it that so much time passes neither murder nor character development still know what you did last summer has better sense of humour than the first one though and at least it explains away williss random selection of victims do not think the hotel maid or the stoner dude had the slightest idea what julie did last summer director cannon judge dredd is competent filmmaker but not particularly imaginative oneif there is part three what on earth would they call it and the fun denouement suggests there will be heres my suggestion hire filmmaker flair someone who can really energize this stillborn seriessomeone who will not rely on so many shock notes and let that person run wild the camera aside if blandy sic must appear in the next one try keep the number of times she says baby minimum thanks in advance

we are back in blade runner territory this one conceptual artist robert longos vision of william gibsoninspired future where information is the commodity kill for front and center is johnny keanu reeves cybercourier who smuggles data via wetwired implant he is ready quit the biz and get portion of his longterm memory restored but first he has finish one last dangerous job the pressing problem in johnny mnemonic is that keanu reeves seems have forgotten how play an action hero since his stint on speed he is walking wood in forest of stiffs that includes henry rollins icet and dina meyer dolph lundgrens street preacher is in an acting category all its own without believable performance between them all we can do is sit back and watch the atmosphere is pretty good in places the vr sequences are way cool but the physical fxsuch as miniatures and mattesleave lot be desired watch out for those bad bluescreens we would not mind minute of johnny mnemonic if the action played better too bad the debut director is not very strong in this de partment his big finale is sloppy silly mess that runs twenty minutes too long is way past the time that most of our wet wired processors have already shut down bottom line yatf yet another tortured future skip it

ok admit iti find camp amusement the spice girls yes the same spice girls of the gimmicky individual identities they of the annoyingly infectious bubblegum pop hooks and cheesy unifying mantra of girl power but not even their guilty pleasure appeal is not enough carry their big screen debut junky mess would be more aptly named shite world than spice world the begins amusingly enough cheeky esque title sequence in the british quintet scary melanie brown baby emma bunton sporty melanie chisolm ginger geri halliwell and posh victoria adams are introduced one one much my surprise excited and only slightly mocking cheers from the press audience as they croon the silky ballad too much tune that would sound right at home in an actual james bond few minutes and an elton john cameo later comes an introductory tour of the numerous plotlines that run through the the spicy ones go on european publicity tour leading up their first live concert at londons royal albert hall producer george wendt and screenwriter mark mckinney pitch various ideas the girls manager clifford richard grant documentary crew follows the girls pregnant mate naoki mori of the group rapidly approaches her due date and tabloid publisher barry humphries attempts destroy the group the help of sneaky shutterbug richard obrien capped off live rendition of the girls bouncy hit say you will be there wealth of laughs and merriment is sure follow right wrong it is all downhill from there as spice world collapses into series of misfired comedy sketches must give the girls credit for their refreshing willingness make fun of themselves but writer kim fuller and director bob spiers can barely come up funny joke between them much less organized framework for all the wacky goingson spice world jumps from vignette vignette subplot subplot no direction and little sense at one minute having the girls meet aliens no joke and at another having them stage daring rescue of two young fans who fall into the water during boat ride while decent joke slips through the cracks here and thereduring dance bootcamp scene the girls sing the lyric we know how we got this farstrength and courage and wonderbra much of the material is not even funny on the chuckle level some gags are just plain pointless such as roger moores recurring role as the mysterious chief who dispenses cryptic metaphorheavy advice clifford the only reason why can think anyone would find that funny is the fact that moore once played james bond ha ha as weak as the script is think there is one insurmountable problem even attempting make spice girls movie and that is the girls themselves the point is not that they cannot act and for the record they really _cannot_ but that their individual personas works as gimmick over the span of fourminute music video are too thin survive outside of the truncated video bite mtv world posh who garnered the most enthusiastic cheers during the introductions comes off best default because her persona rich bitch most easily translates into character in babys persona young innocent lesser extent also works but the remaining girls identities are little harder flesh out there really is not much do sporty besides having her exercise every so often is _exactly_ what fuller and spiers do and after all what exactly entails being ginger or scary apparently just their wardrobes spice world manages pick up some steam in the late going following flashback performance of the spices signature hit wannabe the song is as grating as ever but the energy of the number gives the proceedings muchneeded shot in the arm setting the stage for wave of selfreferential humor stemmed from the screenwriters ideas the almost mirrors robert altmans the player in the way the snails into itself this section of the involving all manner of derringdo involving speeding bus is perhaps its most effective but it also points up how all the other storylines the publisher the documentary crew lack satisfactory payoff spice world is harmless entertainment suitable for the entire family and it will please the spice faithful but this sloppy enterprise surely will not win them any new fans is what the group sorely needs bolster its rapidly waning girl power in the states once the hype disappears spice world will likely serve as the the spices final hurrah in america

basically the girlfriendmoll of the stupid son eric roberts of cubanmiami kingpin rod steiger in an indecipherable accent is sometimes cuban sometimes brando sometimes scottish etc turns out sharon is actually using her boyfriend so she can kill him since he killed her parents when she was young so she calls sly leaves messages him sends him email etc about planting bomb kill roberts sly listens obsessively and while he works out naked yea also into his life though again comes woods who has been tipped off stone catch sly using the cops he tries set up traps none really work so when sly calls him he goes ballisitic on his ass over the phone getting so worked up saying his mustbeimprovised speeches that he seems pop the vein in his head wide open these are the most exciting scenes in the woods or make fun of steigers accent or see stones breasts again

the skulls is laughably bad thriller teenorientated doppelganger of the firm so blazingly ridiculous that it caused me drift into hypnotic stupor certain moments are so preposterous that nearly herniated myself in an attempt stifle laughter chuckled incessantly all the way home let me share the skulls is secret society conceived inside the walls of yale designed am sure mirror the actual skull bones from the same college luke mcnamara joshua jackson townie and local varsity rowing championship victor for the third consecutive year highlights the latest skull scouting report despite some anxiety and caution from others luke accepts entry into the organization soon after he finds himself surrounded beautiful women driving new car and marveling at the that somehow surfaced in his bank account yeah dude pretty good deal eh but luke soon learns that the membership is somewhat suffocating when circumstances become extreme there is no way he can leave the society except maybe as drooling vegetable the premise although lacking in originality certainly offers its share of potential intrigue and suspense unfortunately the skulls is neither intriguing nor suspenseful nor anything else you would associate fresh or exciting it is just another abysmal teen prototype that has the soundtrack the stars but not the script the skulls is so bad it attains certain level of entertainment value the screenplay jon pogue immediately becoming the basis for slew of unintentional howlers first off upon their initiation into the skulls each new member has have skull branded onto their arm afterward they are supplied wristwatch that conveniently covers up the scar will they never take this watch off and what if they forget it their bedside perhaps their secret society was being little too conspicuous when they decided brand new members like cattle on an area of the body that is easily exposed on top of this they are each given rulebook and key headquarters gee why not member tshirts but my favorite bit is this the voting committee for the skulls does not bother individual agree or disagree notions when making collective decisions they are given official skull paddles when flipped one side they indicate the member agrees the proposal facing the opposite way means disagreement would not they merely express themselves verbally hell no they have retrieve the paddles for proper vote and maybe afterward they can play pingpong am still chuckling about these ludicrous details but the humiliating dialogue is enough send one into arrest the cast meanwhile combines pinch of veteran talent dash of the dawsons creek crowd and fuses the two together ensuring that the embarrassment will be mutually shared union throughout but not entirely accomplished actors like craig nelson as skulls chairman judge litten mandrake and william peterson as fellow board member senator levritt are dealt pathetic villain caricatures and look suitably embarrassed handling them and then there is christopher mcdonald who has the capacity be fun exciting actor mcdonalds charisma is totally diminished here as he sleepwalks through another perfunctory bad guy role yes pogue makes it hattrick pray it was snatchthepaycheckandrun exercise for all these actors the young troupe of performers involved fair moderately better let us cut the talented canadian lad joshua jackson some slack for maintaining believability within the confines of his character paul walker the strapping quarterback from varsity blues is bland but passable as caleb mandrake the judges son walker preserves straight face even when dealt the silliest dialogue in the movie dad just killed guy in the ritual room some actual spark is generated leslie bibb who plays lukes longtime chum chloe and manages successfully pull off some convincing dramatics it really boils down the actors attempting puncture the surrounding plastic bubble of absurdity that cages them from minute one or maybe not minute one thanks decent setup from director rob cohen who films early sequences sense of atmosphere and style it makes you wonder why he did not flee indefinitely from the project because while enjoyable cheese like dragonheart and the moderate stallone thriller daylight are not superior cinema they belong on the afi top list when compared this degrading trash aside from unintentionally humoring the audience the skulls gets little accomplished the thrills and action are lazy and mechanical the story is stuffed ridiculous formulaic plotting that sheepishly overlooks the cool potential of secret underground society flick instead of gaining knowledge about the skulls as an organization we are thrust into lame video surveillance conspiracy that has developed barnacles from excessive usage we have seen it all before and better the skulls is feeble little circus of stupidity so miscalculated that while it would serve as clever pun term like boneheaded seems just too generous

it is difficult expect much from director whose greatest accomplishments date are handful of awardwinning tv commercials as is the case bubble boy director blair hayes that said hayess feature debut lives up expectations coming off mainly as equal parts offensive and moronic but occasionally bubble boy transcends its substandard roots glimmers of humor and scathing social commentary those moments of intelligence are delivered mostly the films two stars jake gyllenhall as the immunodeficient jimmy and swoosie kurtz as his overprotective hyper religious reaganloving mother gyllenhalls sweetnatured delivery of jimmys hilariously na ve narration serves as the backbone for an otherwise flimsy comingofage story jimmy is bubble boy kid born without immunity who could die if he comes in contact single germ plight explored more seriously in the john travolta tv movie boy in the plastic bubble and less so on seinfeld his mom homeschools jimmy filling his head wildly twisted conservative propaganda and antisexual messages until he is befriended chloe marley shelton the beautiful girl next door jimmy falls in love chloe but is afraid that his love will literally kill him as evidenced in scene when she drunkenly tries enter his bubble for kiss but when chloe decides marry her high school boyfriend jimmy builds bubble suit and embarks on hijinksaddled crosscountry voyage stop the wedding professing his love the offensive bits have little do jimmys rare handicap regardless of what the films protesters would have you believe but instead center on outrageous racial stereotypes including screaming chinese strip club owner and devout east indian hindi but even if you find stereotype humor funny it is hard muster more than giggle for these shallow gags they even manage bungle some potentially great moments group of carnival freaks but few of the harsh jabs manage work especially in the case of kurtz who very bluntly shows the dark hypocritical side of the religious right and wacky sendup of cult called bright shiny led the inimitable fabio unfortunately few giggles cannot make bubble boy the riotous offthewall comedy it so desperately wants be honestly it is mystery how on earth this movie was ever made and am not just saying that because it is so mediocre how odd for disney take gamble on an unknown director starring virtually unknown actors that does not seem appeal any particular demographic and has the potential offend so many and now that the studio is suffering through very public protest against the the parents of reallife bubble boy david philip vetter maybe disneys wondering the same thing hope the opening box office take makes it worthwhile

bats is this years camp flick the worlds worst dialogue cheesiest premise and stupidest editor this one should be heaven for those who enjoy films humorous in their inanity as for the rest of us well would say skip it but looking at the box office figures for this one it seems as though most of america is following that advice anyway follow their lead and you will spare yourself minutes of your life and bucks boot love alfred hitchcocks the birds almost as much as love the short story on it is based it saddens me even more then see that american treasure ripped off so blatantly wannabe horrorschlock such as bats when mysterious bat attacks occur in small texas town the authorities call in batologist dina meyer investigate it turns out that creepy scientist bob gunton has genetically enhanced couple bats that escaped from his lab making them smarter and more vicious why has he done this you ask because you see it is apparently scientists job make things little better even if that means the death of all mankind so the batologist her wisecracking sidekick and the town sheriff lou diamond phillips have kill all the bats and save the world of course that cannot happen before they wallow in some guamo bat shit for the uninitiated get up close and personal some truly repulsive flying mammals and survive some of the dumbest situations ever seen in professionally produced motion picture consider for example scene where two people are in bat cave the bats are all sleeping but the humans are afraid they might wake up before they can get out what do they do do they get the hell out of there as fast as they can nope they stand there for while transfixed the thousands of bats opening their eyes what keeps bats from being scary or creepy is the hyperactive editing in most of the attack scenes we do not even get see what is going on the screen becomes mush because the cuts are so quick all we know is that bats are attacking how they are attacking and what exactly is happening remains mystery little technical proficiency does wonders for horror movies and bats sure could use some of course director louis morneau tries liven things up some intentional humor but it is so conventional it does not really go anywhere most of the ocmic relief comes courtesy of the batologists wisecracking sidekick leon who takes every opportunity sputter ingenious lines like hate bats some of these are so bad that they take on double quality they may inspire smirk their very nature and roaring laugh because they are so inept hate characters who exist for the sole purpose of spouting lame oneliners playing such characters does not help actors careers still suppose that if you are looking for movie that is so bad it is good you could do worse than bats it does have tremendous amount of camp value am not recommending the movie because quite frankly it sucks and know that this might convince some people go out and see it more power them

starring shawnee smith donovan leitch ricky paull goldin kevin dillon billy beck the blob is the remake of the classic term that use very loosely define the original about really mean glob of goop that takes out anything that gets in its way now the original version has the virtue of cheesy special effects give it kind of nostalgic campy feel the fact that steve mcqueen was the star of the does not exactly hurt it either fast forward the late steve mcqueen is not in the remake this might have something do the fact that he had been pushing up daisies for years nor is there any heavy hitters in the lead role that is unless you count matt dillons brother kevin as heavy hitter the other thing that works against this new blob is that special effects technology has improved dramatically since the original the only things you need now have great special effects in movie are deep pockets it looks as if the produces of the new blob had couple of holes in their pockets the special effects in this movie are cheesy like the originals unlike the original they do not look campy they just look cheap one bright spot in the movie from purely sexist point of view is shawnee smith she is very attractive and can actually act is more than can say about some of her costars in terms of plot little ball of pink goop falls from the sky seems this goop was an experiment that was being housed up on satellite anyway the pink stuff has taste for humans the more people it absorbs the bigger it gets and it is not the friendliest goop on the block either anyway it attacks this little town and it is up the attractive local teenage population stop it not really but that is how it seems this version attempts recapture the camp of the original as have already said this new version of the blob comes off more as cheap badly acted and badly written than campy in the years since this was made none of the cast have gone on greatness although star shawnee smith had very tiny role in armageddon the reason that we have never heard of any of them again is quite simple they all stunk out loud although some of the films smaller roles are filled some actors that while not big stars are doubtless people that you will recognize from their supporting roles in other movies and tv shows it also appears that the producers of the blob tried compensate for the lack of special effects budget making the scenes in the blob makes meals of the townsfolk as gory as possible sadly it does not work very well if you want see big ball of goop terrorize town then would say that you should skip the remake and rent the original although that is not so hot either this newest version is seriously lacking in any redeeming qualities

has act as department liaison dinner honoring nelson after hearing what jackson thinks of him stone says take it you are not one of dellaplanes friends not unless they changed the definition jackson glowers and of course it turns out stone is mrs dellaplane faux pas jackson not everything is happy in motown people are being killed and dellaplane has evil plans for the awa it is all up jackson stop it and his only lead lies in vanity not his own wherever she left off prince in terms of exchanging sexual favors for career advancement she picks up in action jackson she plays the heroin addict and chanteuse in dellaplanes nightclub after singing one particularly sultry number for him she saunters over and complains expected standing ovation he responds you are getting one and it is damn when say watch this at your own risk serving the world for nearly th of century

if anyone had been able in forsee latenight cable show hosted gilbert gottfried showcasing some of the worst films of the they would agree c cab is the quintessential usa up all nite movie it is one of those childish rrated movies that kids would love but cannot see until it is edited for tv it is also one of those pointless almost plotless movies hardly any laughs and strike three it pairs mr gary busey heard gilbert say c cab had an allstar cast but am still hoping there was some degree of facetiousness in that statement when thirdbilling goes twominute appearance famed flashdancer irene cara as herself you cannot say damn thing about allstar casts likewise for token appearances marsha roz warfield paul rodriguez and politically incorrect host bill maher before he was somebody appearing in c cab pretty much had the opposite effect on everyone else especially irene am gonna live forever cara c cab is an ensemble comedy from joel schumacher who would go on direct batman forever about bunch of misfits who drive cabs you get the feeling if the police academy cadets had made different career choice this would be the result except here you have such interesting characters as the token white guy busey who wants get in tight the blacks now before they take over the world the token jive talker named tyrone charlie barnett who wears his hair in rollers and uses the word honkey as much as possible the tough guy the mohawk and gold chains mr a real stretch for him the aspiring musician waiting for his big break maher the mexican gigolo rodriguez the woman who actually wants drive cabs for living warfield and the guy who wants own cab company for living adam baldwin we have all seen dozens of bad comedies from the some are fun watch and some are actually funny this one is more or less neither you would think plenty of comedic sparks would fly from the assemblage of talent whatever but c cab more or less falls flat on continual basis culminating in the usual contrived finale as baldwin is kidnapped and the other cabbies have go rescue him it is shame no one was able rescue this movie from the depths of stale jokes and unoriginality c cab has rightly earned its position on usa up all nite

written alex cox tod davies terry gilliam and tony grisoni directed terry gilliam have always preferred mushrooms blotter acid dropping acid is like riding roller coaster blindfolded you have no idea
