because he is so utterly predictable and stereotypical common trait of this poor production bridget nicole parker and caitlyn angela featherstone who are both extremely sensuous young women looking for someone handle their desires on new years eve and tag along the party them they stumble across nameless bartender ben affleck who is the one truly perfect character in of imperfections he is nether sexually deprived nor uncertain about his future as he is in law school his lack of flaws is both boring unrealistic and painful watch as bridget and caitlyn make passes at him you are neither entertained nor humored the substandard comedy moving on there is val christina ricci and stephie gabby hoffman teenage girls fake identification and very different thoughts val is monicas cousin and true fan of the new york scene on the other hand stephie is convinced that she is vulnerable crime when the two venture out of their usual locations in search of the party that they just cannot find paradoxically it is punks that they meet at bar actually they attempt flee from their presence but are not successful who guide them through their fears and force level of relaxation upon their warped minds of all the insanely dull and uninteresting couples only one approaches level of decency in both acting and plot wisely the movies creators have put heavy emphasis on lucy courtney love and kevin paul rudd who are best friends and share the common bond of being dateless paul has just broken up long time steady ellie janeane garofalo and is starting come terms his loss when lucy informs him that ellie had been sleeping around during their relationship however the only complexity these two characters is that they seem want be more than friends and that is reiterated when they attempt sexual intercourse in bathroom stall on more than one occasion during this strange evening finally there are the two worst performances and worst subplot of the jack jay mohr and cindy kate hudson have been going out for short period of time and jack just learned that he took cindys virginity the night before while she attempts play this down and be her usual self he is predictably self loathing male as he attempts deal string of one night stands that includes the recently deflowered cindy very often when is as putrid as this production there will at least be decent quality of making reveal an occasional moment of glory however this has neither the quality of cinematography nor the moments of glory be highlighted instead what you get is collection of rough and inconsistent cuts bad continuity and inaccuracies first and most noticeable is that as the goes from one subplot another there is no apparent order that it follows and it is also weekened unnecessarily edgy edits from scene scene and shot shot at other times objects seem get up and move and hairstyles and costumes change from shot shot there are also at least scenes in taxi cab that go from start finish not in single one of them does anybody pay the driver and yet no matter how miserable this may be and no matter how poor the acting is all around there was ray of hope for these many bad plots perhaps if the makers had just decided concentrate on one or two or perhaps even three there might have been the time and opportunity for some character development or quality acting or even decent plot payoff at the end but it did not happen that way the cast of quality name actors was forced into roles that not even one of them could convert into mediocre performance and every story line crashed and burned quicker than it takes for the ball drop at midnight

s would remembered as the era of binary movie events in two movies dealing the same subject or be precise same high concept in summer that high concept was mad bomber action thriller in few weeks thrillride of the summer actionfest speed was followed rather action thriller blown away so disappointing that most of the people these days associate the title the thriller in nicole eggert did few nude scenes the movie begins in the prison in northern ireland where gaerity tommy lee jones ira terrorist the great talent make lethal explosive devices from almost any material escapes from prison he comes boston where he accidentally notices jimmy dove jeff bridges dedicated bomb disposal expert within boston police few people except gaerity know the doves violent past when he used be ira terrorist before becoming sick violence betraying gaerity and emigrating america where he changed the name and started using his experience for good purpose gaerity holds dove personally responsible for his captivity and begins the campaign of bombing terror directed specifically at doves colleagues friends and relatives dove who is just going retire and start family now must confront the mad bomber while speed does not even try bother plot and characters using them only as an excuse for long and spectacular action scenes blown away tries be more conventional and provide the action some back story and that is the main reason why it is inferior speed badly written plot and badly written characters are sometimes worse than no plot and no characters at all screenplay john bateer and john rice barely touches the complicated issues of northern ireland using the tragedy only as the cheap backstory for even cheaper drama the plot is of course full of implausibilities the main one is the fact that movie fails explain how the single individual no matter how brilliant he is can produce thousands of deadly devices and hold entire city at bay those questions same as in the case of speed could be forgotten while the action goes on but the pauses between action scenes are filled cliched and predictable situation that should provide some background the characters because of them movie seems little bit too long and boring at times the most annoying element of the however is tommy lee jones in the role of mad bomber his acting is so overthetop that potentially fascinating villain turns into pathetic caricature of himself this role is in painful contrast the strong performance given that same actor in fugitive the have few bright points though some of the action scenes are fine should be credited director stephen hopkins predator ii judgement night and forrest whitaker really shines in minor role of doves colleague but all in all blown away is that was justifiably shadowed its more famous yet hardly unforgettable competitor

do not get me wrong tend appreciate bessons naive unashamedly romantic worldview an artsy european sensibility gone thoroughly his leon is exciting and absurdly moving thanks mainly the interplay between jean reno and young natalie portman and the fifth element is goofy paean love luv that is even more of hoot on repeated viewings but his joan of arc is mess despite some stirring battle scenes and the mostly knockout presence of closecropped milla jovovich as the maiden herself jovovich bessons own personal muse through the making of his last two films though they have since separated is magnetic and energetic enough play credible joan as long as you believe joan was not just warrior but also fabulous supermodellevel babe and besson remains servicable action director though not an especially facile one leading her army against the seemingly impenetrable fortresses of the english joans struggle against great odds is undeniably stirring and besson helps you understand how the french could believe fervently that god is on her side bessons big mistake think is trying dramatize the interior life of his subject yes joan had visions but guarantee that whatever image sympathetic audience conjures in its collective mind will be more compelling than the blueeyed christ figure on display in bessons hallucinatory dream sequences the whole conceit turns into disaster right about the time dustin hoffman billed as the conscience shows up spouting platitudes and sending poor milla running around her cell babbling like ally mcbeal that is kind of shame since she does quite well up that point charging into battle banshee wail that suggests the eruption of sublimated bloodthirstiness that darkly attractive aspect of her character that she is as likely charismatic madwoman as the vessel of the lord is more or less betrayed the final reels in the conscience browbeats her over the killing she is overseen and joan starts look like little more than very confused young lady who is about take fall as the story winds down joan condemned horrible death fire besson is aiming for tragedy and psychological significance trouble is he is chosen lurid often jokey tone for the balance of the picture including some blithe cgi bloodshed in the battle scenes and it is impossible shake the feeling that this particular vision of the middle ages is great extent nothing more than puton this glib prefab version of such great story makes me all the more grateful for dreyers the passion of joan of arc whose dialogue is drawn from the actual transcripts of joans trial and stands as one of the most harrowing experiences in all of cinema compared that the messenger plays as crime against history directed luc besson written besson and andrew birkin cinematography thierry arbogast music eric serra starring milla jovovich franceusa theatrical aspect ratio

delicatessen directors marc carojeanpierre jeunet screenwriters gilles adrienmarc caro cinematographer darius khondji editor herve schneid cast dominique pinon louison marielaure dougnac julie clapet jeanclaude dreyfus clapetthe butcher karin viard mademoiselle plusse ticky holgado marcel tapioca annemarie pisani madame tapioca jacques mathou roger rufus robert kube howard vernon frog man edith ker granny boban janevski young rascal mikael todde young rascal chick ortega postman silvie laguna aurore interligator howard vernon frog man runtime miramaxconstellationugchatchette premiere france reviewed dennis schwartz black comedy set in the near future in boarding house run depraved butcher the comedy is played more in comic strip style for entertaining value than for deeper satire as it features mostly zany sophomoric sight gags and relies heavily on special effects the world has fallen on hard times and there are food shortages include no meat so the butcher serves up meat from human flesh customers who pay grain almost as valued commodity that is the big joke in the and the novelty of that cannibalism idea wears thin mighty fast as the characters are too absurd and sketched too thinly for us care about them this tasteless postapocalyptic french comedy is first feature for the codirectors marc carojeanpierre jeunet it failed reach my funny bone and instead left me mostly annoyed at its slight story and its dark projections for the future an excircus clown named louison dominique pinon the films toogoodtobetrue hero answers an ad for work as handyman for clapet jeanclaude dreyfus and the butcher and landlord offers him room and board in his house the butchers clumsy and nearsighted daughter julie marielaure dougnac falls in love the skinny weird looking clown and the two make some music together her playing the cello and him saw they are the innocents surrounded boarding house of misfits suffering from fear and watched over her overbearing father who has lured into his tenement the clown as he has his past innocent victims so that he can put his cleaver him and then sell him as meat he intends do as soon as the clown fixes up the tenement the entire takes place in the shabby tenement and the tenants are an odd lot of bizarre malcontents who do not trust each other there are two youngsters boban janevski mikael todde who do any kind of mischief they can frog man howard vernon who lives water on the floor so he can raise his frogs and snails that he eats two brothers mathou kube who create little cowmoo novelty toys man holgado who sells bullshit detector the butcher for his piece of meat slutty woman karin viard who lives the butcher and only wants his meat the aristocratic woman silvie laguna who tries numerous times commit suicide but is too inept do it right the tenants are too afraid come out at night because they know what the butcher is up so they are forced communicate each other through pipe that runs through the building in one scene they are all in musical harmony the lovemaking of the butcher and his gal as their bedsprings squeak there is also sexcrazed postman chick ortega who lusts for the butchers daughter and carries gun while delivering the mail there is also an underdeveloped subplot about band of incompetent underground veggie fanatics called trogolodistes who have been summoned rescue the clown and steal some grain the directors overloaded the too many eccentrics as the comedy seemed forced while the surreal look of the added no dramatic intensity delicatessen could have some appeal the cult crowd who like their meat sliced thin monty python fans and those who liked terry gilliams brazil similar in spirit

it is shame the execution of this concept falls very short of its premise the movie is lacking and most unsatisfying osmosis jones is crude gross disgusting and was directed the farrelly brothers the twisted siblings behind there is something about mary me myself and irene and couple of other movies in the humor is mostly targeted below the belt not that there is anything wrong scatology bet even cavemen appreciated bathroom humor such as it was it is merely that osmosis jones the farrellys humor is too juvenile too predictable you can almost foresee the puns just viewing the part of the inner anatomy sequence is drawn osmosis jones looks like one of those old health class movies gone psycho the trouble is the animation may please the very young but the jokes may be over their heads while the teenage audience may find it too tame for their tastes adults well let us just say most will find it unappetizing osmosis jones plays like minute infomercial for the eat healthy foods lobby the live action sequences revolve around frank bill murray who seems be the grungiest human being in the universe he continually looks as if he needs shave and shower frank much the consternation of his daughter is fastfood addict eating anything and everything that can kill you he works at zoo where the animals look cleaner and presumably smell better than he does franks body is invaded thrax lethal virus after frank eats hardboiled egg that had fallen the ground it is not gross enough that frank picks the egg up from the dirt and plops it into his mouth nope the farrellys pile it on first having frank wrestle chimp for the egg wresting it from the primates mouth like said the gross meter tips the scales on this one after ingesting the egg the movie begins its animated sequences here osmosis jones voiced chris rock renegade white blood cell is teamed drix voiced frasiers david hyde pierce hour painkiller cold capsule battle thrax smoothly voiced laurence fishburne basically what we have is cliched copbuddy movie rife all the clich of that genre and this is why osmosis jones does not click it merely falls back on tired familiar conventions instead of creating new and exciting situations the jokes and puns are lame osmosis searches out snitch former flu virus after pumping him for information drix tells osmosis funny he does not look fluish and the jokes do not rise above that level the live action scenes are no better frank is such slob so unappealing that it is difficult fathom how he ever married or even sired child he is almost bigger cartoon than the animated characters osmosis jones is movie that may be too violent for young children as thrax burns and dissolves blood cells right and left the animation is rather twodimensional and flat it lacks scope and depth it is an unappealing movie that will leave you scratching your head and maybe leaning toward shower after you walk out of the theater

has run out of interesting characters and plotdriven suspense thrillers that we must spend two hours watching will smith and gritty gene hackman exchange obtuse dialogue and run around dodging fireballs in enemy of the state that is exactly right few parts the net and few parts conspiracy theory enemy is about as exciting as watching smith talk cgi aliens in lame brained men in black will this guy ever get real role he has the bruce willis syndrome the plot is bascially smith playing lawyer getting into hot water some high government murderers who assassinated powerful political figure earlier in the movie when tape of the killing gets into his hands he inlists the help of an old conspirator hackman and at the end er you know enemy was one of the worst films of last year not only was it sloppy in telling its story and getting its facts straight the acting was mediocre when it should have been energy driven and did not like how smith always magically outsmarted the badies when all the other extra characters seeming more intelligent than smith somehow got run over truck enemy came out around the same time as the superior star trek insurrection know these two films are different in well everything but the fact that enemy outgrossed insurrection just baffels me somehow quality cannot overshadow quantity

vegas vacation is the fourth starring chevy chase and beverly dangelo as the heads of the hapless griswold family as the other three films their two children rusty and audrey are played revolving series of actors this time ethan embry and marisol nichols fill the roles also back is cousin eddie randy quaid the slob relative who seems bring problems wherever he goes in vegas vacation clark griswold chase decides take the family on vacation las vegas so that he and wife ellen dangelo can renew their wedding vows it is at this point when comedy is supposed ensue apparently the filmmakers thought that putting the griswolds into las vegas would be so funny on its own that they would not bother write any jokes into the script at least that is the way it looks when watching this turkey about half way through vegas vacation began have serious doubts as whether there would actually be single laugh in the entire since there had been none up that point the end of the movie had actually snickered couple of times and had smiled at couple of gags might add that none of the funny and use the term loosely moments came as result of anything chase dangelo or quaid were involved in they might as well have stayed home for as much as they contributed this the two best things in this movie were ethan embry and marisol nichols as the griswold kids who manage have couple of their own adventures rusty becomes vegas high roller providing most of the films best moments every time chase and quaid were involved in gag it just made it more and more apparent that they should have stopped this series after the third brings me the best moment of the the griswolds are driving down the highway and holiday road the theme from the original vacation begins play christie brinkley and her red ferrari also from the first movie drive it was cute moment but all it really did was remind me just how funny the first had been and just how far that this series has fallen too bad

burnt money is the perfect festival it will show once or twice and then no one thankfully will ever have hear from it again this from the seattle international festival emerging masters series is easily one of the years worst billed as gay bonnie and clyde this gritty from director marcelo pi eyro has its only highlight in welldesigned title sequence two gay lovers get involved in bank robbery that makes gang leader whose plan they screwed up angry this causes the gang leader send his boys out get the gay guys one of whom may not actually be gay hiding out in prostitutes apartment the two men must fight off police and gang members in very long showdown for the movies conclusion if caught they risk losing all the money and their love as an added emotional bonus one of the gay men is dying or something like that everything that happens is so quick and confusing was completely lost clarity is not exactly this movies striving virtue so it was little hard pick up not much could have really happened though the main events in this long twohour are explicit homosexual and heterosexual sex graphic drug use extreme violence and strong language lots of explicit material is never bad thing when there is reason but there is no purpose anything in this most of the sex and violence scenes come off as silly while the heavy drug use comes off as ridiculous and depressing it appears pi eyro who cowrote marcelo figueras from novel ricardo piglia purposefully adds more blood and lovemaking for his own amusement he makes the actors as sweaty and dirty as possible makes them snort cocaine gives them guns and condoms and lets them go burnt money is pointless the performances are bad it tries thrill and shock but only causes boredom god forbid it will ever get distributor another disappointing from this years socalled emerging masters series pass on

claire danes giovanni ribisi and omar epps make likable trio of protagonists but they are just about the only palatable element of the mod squad lamebrained bigscreen version of the tv show the story has all the originality of block of wood well it would if you could decipher it the characters are all blank slates and scott silvers perfunctory action sequences are as cliched as they come sheer force of talent the three actors wring marginal enjoyment from the proceedings whenever they are on screen but the mod squad is just secondrate action picture firstrate cast

the haunting so confusing that it forgets the true meaning of horror scare us if you have ever seen movie you probably have considering you are on this website you should know about all of the trivia they post before movie they have things like illustrations and you have guess the movie or facts about the but the one always like are the quot other namequot joke that try and rename particular for instance the one playing before the haunting had different titles for the small soldiers they had titles like little infantry and can get those fatigues in smaller size well after seeing the haunting had few particular names for it as well unfortunately can only post one of them otherwise would be getting some pretty angry emails from overprotective mothers that title would be the confusing ok that is pretty bad title but it fits this perfectly it basically serves up no purpose and combined dry dialogue and boring and confusing plot it completes the formula for cinematic bomb liam neeson once again gets wrapped up in without any depth but at least the phantom menace was exciting and had some depth the haunting is nothing but trash but unfortunately will still make boatload of money before rant and rave about how bad this is let me point out the few and stress the word few bright spots in this first the house is great looking it looks beautiful but this is also dark spot it looks so great that it is hard be frightened it this is something that rears its ugly head at all points of the things look so great that you are looking on in awe instead of being scared straight haunted house films have contain one element even be slightly successful and that is being eerie the hill house is not eerie it is beautiful but not the least bit frightening ever heard of lili taylor before this did not but am glad that do now she gives the only satisfactory performance in the despite the dry dialogue and boringconfusing concept she manages light up the screen every time she appears but unfortunately her costars are usually following right behind owen wilson who plays luke is the only other cast member even close giving an admirable performance other then taylor he is basically there for the comic relief and his character development is poor in all other areas all of the characters are desperately underdeveloped wilson had potential as luke but it seems they just needed him add few laughs liam neeson and catherine zetajones suffer from the dialogue and plot and should not have been in this their characters must suffer from wicked mood swings because in each scene they turn from ruthless compassionate scared brave and whatnot they just are not believable and this is the final nail in the hauntings coffin the plot is terrible the opening scene of the is very important but the director makes it too obvious getting closeups of all the things that will play major role in the end of the as sat through the kept wondering what this was trying accomplish nell lili taylors character goes from the hunted the savior it makes no sense and the director gives the audience no reasoning for the ridiculous changes that take place in the he forces the viewer make various assumptions and does not give any indepth information for instance the beginning of the gives us sense of why nell is getting involved in the program but we get zilch for the other four plus two of them get wiped out in the first ten minutes and the worst part most horror films have killings for some reason they kill off luke at the end of the no reason whatsoever just off his head literally overall the haunting is the epitome of bad movie bad plot confusing storyline and waste of good talent hopefully liam neeson can rebound and get into good and be used his full potential hopefully lili taylor will be recognized for doing such great job in such bad and hopefully other horror films such as the blair witch project and the haunting of hill house will not be as bad as this one

in director edward zwick began his career the powerful civil war drama glory but since then he has made continuous disappointments me at least legends of the fall and courage under fire those two films were not bad just not very good but zwicks latest the siege he has finally made one the siege is modernday actionthriller that focuses on terrorism that is sweeping through new york city investigating the matter is fbi agents anthony hubbard denzel washington and frank haddad tony shalhoub who are first hit the ordeal when city bus explodes several innocent people on it later bomb goes off in broadway theater killing even more they soon meet cia operative elise kraft annette bening who may very well hold the key the identity of the arab terrorist there are some movies that simply do not need be made and the siege may very well be one of them oh sure zwick thinks he is making meaningful action since he has added lots of exposition scenes in the audience is basically lectured on the horrors of terrorism but what he really has made is actually no more substantial than say die hard also starred bruce willis this time willis is horribly wasted as general of the s army who puts state of martial law over nyc during the climax whatever points the siege earnestly tried make were obviously lost in the translation from page screen or maybe zwick never really had anything serious say in the first place the role of the arab community is offensively stereotypical just as women were in the recent john caprenters vampires placing them all in the category of bad guys the siege contains three fine actorswashington bening and shalhoubbut washington is stuck character that contains not an ounce of even remote development bening has slightly more do and has an intriguing character work while shalhoub pretty much steals the show even though again he has no real character the climax of the siege washington giving sermon willis on the socalled message of the story felt like had wandered into sequel on deadly ground in steven seagal gave minute speech at the end about preserving the environment the siege is constantly heavyhanded not entertaining or insightful and just goes prove that not even the best actors can save that lacks satisfactory screenplay

i guess that if very wild bachelor party had gone really bad there would be broken furniture traces of smack and cocaine on the floor and dead prostitute in the bathroom guess that if movie had also gone really bad there might be the same elements present coincidence poor kyle meek looking jon favreau he is about marry his radiant fiancee laura cameron diaz but before he exchanges his vows he embarks las vegas his friends for one last blowout but this bachelor party has gone about as bad as it could possibly get the prostitute has met horrible though accidental death and drugs are everywhere the five friends agree that there is enough bad evidence here that will send them jail for very long time surprisingly calm robert boyd christian slater who looks like he was groomed make nefarious decisions ponders their dilemma for few minutes before deciding that the best thing do is bury the body in the desert where she will never be found although they stomach the gruesome deed of getting rid of the body also disturbingly involves dismantling the body using power saws in order stuff it into suitcases when they return from their trip guilt and paranoia begins set in slowly consumes some of the five friends one is adam daniel stern he grows increasingly agitated whenever people look at his van or whenever cop glances his way his blood pressure increases or that just may be because of his dysfunctional family another is michael who was actually responsible for her death he tries bury his feelings but the burden of guilt begins affect his judgment as well boyd is the doer of the group seemingly suffering from long psychosis when he feels as if his secret is about be exposed he is apt take extreme measures cover up his tracks kyle just hopes that his wedding will live up lauras demanding expectations then there is moore leland orser who speaks lines and walks around puzzled look on his face the problem this reprehensible movie is that it wants be cruel comedy but it presents things in manner that just are not funny drugs mutilation and killing your own friends is not something be laughed at as straight psychological drama could see how it might have worked as each one tried maneuver and overcome the weight of their own guilt in their own sometimessick ways but this movie insults us assuming that we could simply discard our values for hours if you do like this movie do not think that want know you did find slater convincing leader who sways his friends choose not the right thing but the smart play and diaz adds some brightness this as weddingneeding fiancee but her talents are essentially wasted here it is obvious that the maker is trying strike certain tone but the way that he chooses do it is tasteless do not make very bad decision seeing this

i had been looking forward this since heard about it early last year when matthew perry had just signed on am big fan of perrys subtle sense of humor and in addition think chris farleys onedge extreme acting was riot so naturally when the trailer for almost heroes hit theaters almost jumped up and down soda in hand the lights dimming was ready be blown away farleys final starring role and what was supposed be matthew perrys big breakthrough was ready be just amazed for this be among farleys best in spite of david spades absence was ready be laughing my head off the minute the credits ran sadly none of this came pass the humor is spotty at best good moments and laughable oneliners few and far between perry and farley have no chemistry the role that perry was cast in seems obviously written for spade for it is his type of humor and not at all what perry is associated and the movie tries be smart subject best left alone when it is farley flick the movie is major dissapointment only few scenes worth first look let alone second perry delivers not one humorous line the whole movie and not surprisingly the only reason the movie made the top ten grossing list opening week was because it was advertised farley and farleys classic humor is widespread too almost heroes almost works but misses the wagontrain quite longshot guys let us leave the exploring lewis and clark huh stick tommy boy and we will all be friends

the original babe gets my vote as the best family since the princess bride and it is sequel has been getting rave reviews from most internet critics both siskel and ebert sighting it more than month ago as one of the years finest films so naturally when entered the screening room that was be showing the movie and there was nary another viewer be found this notion left me puzzled it is rare thing for childrens movie be praised this highly so would not you think that every parent in the entire city would be flocking their kids see this supposedly magical piece of work tad bewildered but pleased not have worry about screaming kids and other disruptions that commonly go along family films sat back for minutes and watched intently and very open mind having great expectations for the looking back should have taken the hint and left right when entered the theater believe me wanted like babe pig in the city the plot seemed interesting enough after the events that took place in the original babe the sheeppig has become legitimate national phenomenon but after fateful encounter water well arthur hogget james cromwell who the movie could have used alot more of has been rendered bedridden for number of weeks and the farm begins go under financially the only solution that his wife magda szubanski going from delightfully charming downright annoying can come up is make an appearance their new celebrity pet at national fair think and use the money they earn pay off the bank set aside for the moment the fact that they could get more than enough cash from donations if they just made their case known the public problem is the fair is being held in the middle of the dreaded city completely foreign place both the pig and his companion setting the main plot in motion mrs hogget and babe travel the unnamed city and shack up sweet lady who just happens love help animals despite the law that you cannot keep them in hotels it is here that we meet an array of eccentric characters the most memorable being the family of chimps led steven wright here is where the took wrong turn up until this point had being having rather enjoyable experience the beginning featured some smart writing and funny situations involving the farm animals from the first one and even an inspired moment at the airport where mrs hogget is accused of smuggling drugs unfortunately the story wears thin as we are introduced new set of animals that reside at the hotel none of them being even onetenth as interesting as the characters from the previous babe the main topic of discussion surrounding babe pig in the city is the question of whether or not it is dark and disturbing for small children and believe it is at one point dog is hung from his neck and slowly starts drown at other times we are treated surrealistic flashbacks mrs hoggets full cavity search at the airport in fact the overall tone of the movie is rather bleak and depressing however that is as they say neither here nor there because kids will probably not like the movie anyway the animal characters and their plights were simply not intriguing enough sustain my interest for an hour and half let alone entertain child another problem found the was it is sudden change of pacing and tone near the end of the story if you are going make darker and more sinister sequel fine it may not be my cup of tea but at least it is noble ambition but go from the downbeat feel of the rest of the movie and all of sudden have slapstick finale mrs hogget swinging from walltowall of ballroom in elastic overalls it just did not feel right and was more painful watch than it was funny or entertaining and the same goes for the rest of the movie
