i wonder if budget is at all criterion for whether or not movie can be considered an exploitation flick take the professional for example it boasts extremely glossy cinematography couple of recognizable name actors and couple of fairly impressive explosions it is also basically about violence and cheap titilation and features central relationship between middleaged man and twelveyearold girl decidedly ambiguous sexual dimension the professional is all over the map and its pretensions of being about anything more than its most unpleasant elements simply make it all the more unpleasant the professional of the title is new york hit man named leon jean reno brutally efficient but also very isolated one day he is forced let someone into his life when girl from his apartment building knocks on his door her name is matilda natalie portman and the rest of her family has just been killed crooked and very wired e agent norman stansfield gary oldman after matildas father tried rip him off leon reluctantly takes matilda in then begins teach her his profession when she says that she wants avenge the murder of her young brother the two become closer makes them all the more vulnerable when stansfield learns that they know too much and sets out eliminate them both writerdirector luc besson has gone this route before his popular french import la femme nikita slick potboiler about female assassin there is no question that besson can make great looking the assistance of cinematographer thierry arbogast he has created chock full of moody closeups and evocative lighting but beneath the shiny wrapper there is not nearly as much going on as besson would like us believe the relationship between leon and matilda never clicks because neither one is given character develop leon is mostly collection of quirky traits all intended show us that for hired killer he is really not so bad guy he drinks lots of milk takes meticulous care of potted plant and enjoys gene kelly movies jean reno succeeds at giving leon haunted and desperate quality but he never makes an emotional connection matilda natalie portman is all wrong for part that called for much grittier quality but she does not have too much work either besson would have been better served spending more time trying bring his characters life and less on feeble attempts at humor are often embarrassing silly game between leon and matilda involving celebrity impersonations is completely out of place as is scene where matilda shocks hotel manager announcing that leon is her lover character is thoroughly sacrificed for cheap gag gary oldmans entire part is something of cheap gag wildeyed and way over the top but at least he is interesting watch there is not real person be found anywhere in the professional is not always problem in an action thriller except that this one is trying pass itself off as something more more disconcerting problem the professional is that it plays around the sexuality of twelveyearold in really distasteful way there were only two real choices for dealing that component of leon and matildas relationship confront it head on or ignore it entirely but besson flirts and teases the audience the idea that he is going show them forbidden love story while choosing simply focus his camera on portmans rear end and dress her in skimpy clothing this is say nothing of the questionable decision make it look like quality paternal time when leon is teaching child load mm pistol or the blood is spilled aplenty great deal of the time the professional is just plain sleazy and all the soft filters in the world cannot disguise that fact

one of these days will make good on my promise never rent another abel ferrara movie king of new york and body snatchers notwithstanding and bad lieutenant is only fit for single emotive viewing his exploitation flicks have fallen into rut of hoary arthouse trappings it is perfumedrenched cokeaddled visit the seedy pornography shop where beautiful models no hookers no courtesans usher you through the silk curtains ferraras only consistently smart move has been casting christopher walken over and over again since walken can make good movie great and loathsome movie durable whenever he is onscreen his minute scene in the addiction is the saving grace of that otherwise abysmal unwatchable and pretentious failure when he starts talking about his vampiric bowel movements or questions whether lili taylor has ever read naked lunch there is muchneeded dose of humor in an otherwise terminally unfunny affair you know those gothic club kids who are too cool smile and let you know they are actually having fun the addiction is that movie walken sadly does not appear in the blackout the central role of matty junkie star whose lightning paced life among the beautiful people is inevitably leading his destruction is played matthew modine who takes what he can get after cutthroat island much like the protagonists of michelangelo antonionis terminally bored cultural elite matty is involved in bitter pill relationship high fashioned model annie at least think she is model mattys lady is played french actress atrice dalle arrested twice for cocaine possession during filming of the blackout not that you needed know that but it lends credence the idea that ferraras entire oeuvre has been filmed in fucking blackout no kidding requiem for dream has nothing on the junkie presentations seen in ferraras movies and his controversial urban lifestyle matty and annie struggle over her decision have an abortion without consulting him no doubt he was off chasing the dragon in his despair matty indulges in chemical induced weekend of debauchery tooling around the streets of miami video filmmaker mickey wayne dennis hopper in full dirty ol man mold smacking models on the ass and telling them spread their legs wider toward the end of the night they pick up teenage waitress also named annie sarah lassez start shooting hastily improvised sexual scene then matty thankfully blacks out something happened that night haunts him throughout the rest of the movie and it is exactly what you think it was suffice say there is some confusion over whether he killed annie one or annie two or anyone at all the blackout is typical ferrara no plot speak of plenty of raunch and horribly vogue images of matthew modine downing bottle of jack daniels and beer while wrapping himself in seethrough curtain in his hotel room the sea the sea the beautiful sea cinematographer ken kelsch finds inconsistent glory in alternating gorgeous painterly sunsets docustyle sleaze and we are back dennis hopper leering at girls in bathing suits yeah yeah arrrghhh says mr hopper dirty old sod it is compulsive viewing in tacky sort of way leading ridiculous climax where modine seizes control of his destiny how is that for cryptic never fear ferrara finds time for some female full frontal nudity remind us what he is all about can picture it now take off yer clothes kid it is essential depict the inner maelstrom of my central protagonist and you are his visual id you are the soul the heart the bloodstream of the picture take it off take it all off ha ha ha friggin vampire yeah you ferrara final word about matthew modine he is actually fine actor when properly cast but there is something too squeakyclean in his demeanor he is ideally suited for sarcastic men in tightly controlled situations such as his private joker in full metal jacket or the timebomb nebbish in short cuts who is every bit as superb as julianne moore in that famous scene though no one seems notice him he was in that scene ed here he is asked let it all hang out sporting threeday stubble and oily bangs he throws around furniture like stanley kowalski but it is somehow lacking modine lacks the feral intensity of brando entirely miscast in ferraras flesh fair better luck next time matt someday you will be forgiven for cutthroat island was not really your fault in the first place maybe atom egoyan will find place for you somewhere and all will once again be well in your world

making your first feature as not easy assemble decent if not strong cast as writerdirector robert moresco has done one eyed king and you are already ahead of the game but rehash old plot lines tired dialogue and standard clich and wellintentioned effort such as this one could jeopardize your chance at second feature how many more movies do we need about rough neighborhood full of lifelong friends hopelessly turned crime or worse the enormous catalog of such movies might dissuade filmmaker from making yet another but here we have it again five irish kids in nycs hells kitchen make an overemotional pact over some stolen rings on an anonymous rooftop teary music and slow motion in the films first scene the kids grow up be fairly worthless adults unable or unwilling make their way out of the heat of the kitchen leading the clueless pack is william baldwin as goodhearted guy who watches out for his buddies and is in tight local mob head armand assante would like say that his character gets involved over his head in some sort of blah blah blah but all we seem get are little tastes of possible plot points he is concerned about buddy jason gedricks heroin abuse he sticks up for jim breuer after he impregnates baldwins characters sister he looks into who might be pushing the most moroniclooking counterfeit cash ever made genuinely funny touch but none of this ever really amounts anything it seems that morescos greater concern is provide that intangible slice of life that flavor of the neighborhood that everyones been trying evoke since scorseses early work so we get the drunk guys hugging and singing together at the local bar prove us that they really love each other do people actually do this we get lot of tough street talk usually mumbled for effect and whole lot of the fword whether it sounds like it fits or not we also get handful of good actors in small roles that seem lack purpose bruno kirby chazz palminteri you know guys you have seen in movies just like this one before assante is intelligent casting as the man that everyone fears and baldwins performance is adequate but most of the rest of the cast jump into the tough guy persona so thoroughly that it is almost funny moresco theater guy and sometimes tv writer including the series falcone obviously labored over this one as anyone might first child but the content is probably too personal as result the movies style is heavyhanded in need of considerable amount of toning down nearly every time an action the grown up gang recalls something they did as kids moresco reminds us boy does he remind us slow dissolves the earlier scene running in slow motion complete dialogue from the present just in case we do not comprehend the link the past moresco needs either trust his audiences intelligence or have more faith in his own presentation rather than beat us over the head it his next project should have little more personal distance and lot more subtlety if he actually gets that chance reviewed as part of our boston festival coverage feature story coming soon

whenever s government starts meddling into other countries affairs under the pretext of supporting human rights or preventing political religious or ethnic persecution the other side is ready use mantra that says look who is talking what have you done the indians however even the americans themselves are ready use that dark chapter of their own national history when it suits their purposes is just another example its revisionist westerns made in early those movies tried exploit the emerging wave of political correctness coinciding the th anniversary of columbus discovery of america one of such examples is geronimo an american legend western directed walter hill that deals one of the last conflicts between american natives and white settlers the hero of the is geronimo played wes studi leader of apaches fierce warrior tribe that used give hard time white settlers during the second half of th century when the movie begins in geronimo and his apaches made peace s government and try live peacefully in arizona reservation however broken promises injustice and violence against his people would make geronimo restless not more or so of his followers he escapes reservation and begins guerrilla campaign general crook gene hackman commander of s army forces respects geronimo and knows that even his force is not enough catch geronimo in the great spaces of the american southwest instead he turns people who are more experienced apaches lt charles gatewood jason patric and indian hunter al sieber robert duvall together young lt britton davis matt damon they would begin mission aimed at capturing geronimo geronimo an american legend like many movies made under the shadow of political correctness try tell the tale about oppressed minorities but instead the real subject is the bad conscience of the oppressors so the story about geronimo is told from the perspective of his enemies almost all of them happen be his greatest admirers and use every opportunity express how sorry they feel for having fight him and his people although such elements of john millius screenplay do indeed have some basis in history they harm the story of geronimo be honest walter hill does try make geronimo the real hero of the but the movie segments that deal the plight of apaches and the uprising are given too little time instead they turn out be nothing more than the back story for rather uninteresting adventure story of gatewood and his band make even worse hill has some real problems pacing and style and in the end we have impression that we are watching two films badly edited into one story about geronimo and story about his pursuers the movie should have been better if it turned geronimos life before and after his last uprising in many ways more interesting than the story about gatewood the difference between those segments could be observed through the different quality of acting wes studi cherokee actor who was so impressive as magua in the last of the mohicans was perfect choice for geronimo not only because he resembles geronimo but because he induces lot of passion in his role contrary him we have disinterested actors who sleepwalk through the roles of his white enemies while this could be expected from someone like jason patric it is shame when we have veterans like gene hackman or robert duvall even hills directing is bellow expectations battle scenes are too short and like in many of his late films force viewers ask what had happened the great action director of even his old associate music composer ry cooder disappoints the score that shifts between indian motives and classic on the other hand photography lloyd ahern ii the use of red lenses gives somewhat dreamy atmosphere ideal for this movie that was supposed be melancholic epic all in all compared some of the hollywoods examples of political correctness this is not so bad but we are left the unpleasant impression that it could have been better

aspiring broadway composer robert aaron williams secretly carries torch for his best friend struggling actor marc michael shawn lucas the problem is marc only has eyes for perfect the geeky insecure robert certainly is not meanwhile marcs spoiled hetero female roommate cynthia mara hobel spends her days lying about their apartment and harrassing magazine editor tina brown writerdirector victor mignattis very romantic comedy as the ad campaign states is supposed be pardon the pun gay ol romp but it is hard have much fun these annoying selfabsorbed characters and their shallow personal problems marc and cynthia have sitcomlevel domestic crises such as trying kill bugshow hilarious robert and marc go acting class how riveting the zaftig cynthia goes on eating binges how original but more than anything else the three whine constantly marc whines about his turbulent romance an apparent david hugh panaro the hunky musician from across the way robert whines about not being able find the right guy cynthia whines about having find job horrors the terrible trio whine their way happy ending that is wholly undeserved add in overly broad performances and some laughable lipsynching panaro and you are left one astonishing piece of cinematic damage

easely one of the worst films of the year the millenium just around the corner is playing our insecurities concerning the biggest event of this century this time it is arnold schwartzenegger against the powers of evil the result is somewhat predictable did not have high hopes about arnolds much anticipated return the big screen schwarzenegger fans will probably be pleased action lovers will not be bored and the catholic league will be angry everyone else will see end of days for what it is deliciously bad motion picture think of it as hollywoods own yk bug did you know that if you turn the three diabolical numbers you will get as in yes you better believe it satan is here on earth working on his latest project the end of days this time it is gabriel burne who gets the privilege play lucifer and although not al pacino he is fun behold he coolly strolls through manhattan in the borrowed body of an investment banker wreaking as they say havoc the way it works is he smirks and something explodes before the stroke of the new millennium he is got find and impregnate certain woman in order climb out from under heavenly curse as spelled out in the book of revelations only schwarzeneggers cop attached an antiterrorist unit can stop him films like this has one serious weakness logic no matter how you twist the plot you will find it incredibly stupid even for schwartzenegger movie the incredible fact is that such directors never learn after thousands of headless productions this theme has become one big clich here the devil looks more like sex addicted maniac that has just got out of mental institution he is walking around y blowing everything up and killing everyone that gets in meter radius all he wants is the girl that is somehow special but schwartzenegger is more clever than he looks he has hidden her in church where satan dare not enter so the evil one is forced seduce the good cop in order get the valuable information you can have your wife and daughter back can give you happiness that you can only dream of just give me the address indeed script like that you could make wonderful parody but unfortunately the director is taking this subject very seriously attempting create provoking an dramatic thriller and for you who have awaited arnold swartzeneggers comeback will not be very satisfied we have not seen him in while that is because he did not have worthy opponent he has battled nuclear terrorists on earth and power mad conspirators on mars he has taken on alien predators in the darkest reaches of the jungle and morphing cyberkillers that seemingly nothing can stop so after all those fights what is left for arnold schwarzenegger how about satan in my opinion he has never quite overcome his first role as the deadly robot in camerons terminator and that is schwartzeneggers strength muscles and no emotions here he tries achieve an artistic level moving towards the oscar this is called an adult turn if successful and flop if unsuccessful make wild guess his character has lost his wife and daughter and has serious drinking problems this requires at least some acting skills regrettably the only thing convincing about old arnold is his muscles the rest of the cast are struggling their so called characters the movie is otherwise technically impressive solid cinematography and fine lighting but the movie does not serve neither as serious thriller because of its stupidity nor as comic entertainment because of its serious tone the only real comic relief in this is when swartzenegger tries cry the action sequences are all recycled and the effects are everything but spectacular so really have hard time recommending this somebody unless you are diehard schwartzenegger fan stay away as for schwarzenegger he will be back

these days people have rather short attention span and hardly anything can satisfy them for the long run nostalgia is already wearing off and now people are becoming more and more interested in few years in the future early are going be regarded as next golden age of nostalgia however doubt that people are going be very nostalgic about the products of that period one of the reason would surely be films like national lampoons loaded weapon that in many ways symbolise the biggest problem of contemporary american industry lack of originality and ideas being made as some kind of parody on lethal weapon series this pairs two a policemen jack colt emilio estevez burnout alcoholic cop on the edge and wes luger samuel jackson bythebook policeman days away from retirement two of them following the murder of lugers ex partner must confront evil general mortars william shatner crime lord who is going flood the market cocaine stashed in wilderness girl cookies the authors of this films whose director gene quintano worked on such projects like third and fourth sequel of police academy lacked any original idea before they undertook the projects and that reflects in the lack plot characters and even original lines the plot or what goes for the plot in this movie is nothing more than series of gags that make laugh of some popular films made in previous few years apart from lethal weapon series this borrows its female lead from basic instinct the best gags are same as many other similar movies shown in the trailers the rest simply does not work only those who used watch lot of products in that period would laugh others would probably wince at the lameness of humour some would be entertained celebrity cameos that pop up every once in while but at the end spending hour and half in front of this disorganised mess of movie is simply not worth the effort the was sometimes criticised for being the parody of series that already had strong comic overtones the authors of lethal weapon returned the favour using the loaded weapon joke in their fourth sequel

paul verhoeven the dutch auteur who dragged his violent sexually aggressive aesthetic into american has never been what would consider thoughtful director though some of his films notably starship troopers have been lauded as artistic achievements but he is the kind of maker who is managed no matter what the budget make his films distinctive and even sometimes smuggle stimulating themes into the lavish high concepts on he toils starship troopers was essentially bmonster movie remake of his enthralling dutch war soldier of orange great that is nearly impossible find on video yet showgirls is everywhere in he cast troop of stunningly attractive mannequins the square jawed casper van dien and denise richards who may actually be silicone in what feels like an american propaganda picture set monotonous scenes of graphic carnage it is not completely successful but as failure it is certainly an interesting and mostly entertaining one my favorite verhoeven films were the ones he made before he hit our shores spetters dark near pornographic coming of age set within the subculture of drag racing and the aforementioned soldier of orange have not yet gotten around seeing the th man or turkish delight believe his best be robocop bleak superhero satire robotic hero that is as touching as schwarzeneggers in that movie was violent but not in the overdone cartoonish manner of more recent verhoeven pics its violence seemed be there for purpose namely create an atmosphere of unpredictable dread not simply titillate an attention deprived audience there is jawdropping scene within the first ten minutes of robocop wherein the lead villain toys cop before snuffing him he tortures the officer taking glee in his victims every fearful tic it is startling moment of barbaric maddening violence that effectively sets the tone for the that could be designated as splatter punknoir in hollow man kevin bacon brutally slays dog because it just will not shut up he impales coworker drowns another and so on but why his character is introduced as smug genius the kind who is always impeccably dressed and races sports car while generic rock tunes blare from his stereo for the world hear sort of like scheming uber villain from dallas or melrose place though once the character becomes invisible this has him pull shift into psychotic movie monster the kind who just will not die hollow mans protagonists are the completely bland but beautiful scientist linda elizabeth shue acting as if she were rebecca of sunnybrook farm and her lover hunk of beef scientist played josh brolin who is saddled the films worst lines have lost cohesion again they are typical aaron spelling couple goodlooking but as vacant as george bushs republican national convention speech e bush referring clinton so much promise but what end what end this actually got applause suddenly warren beatty does not look so absurd the rest of the films characters are all well past thirty though act like annoying high school party animals insulting one and other series of strained oneliners is it just me or have labored insults become big budget hollywoods new character developing technique ahh what cynical time we live in as the picture opens we meet cain kevin bacon an egocentric scientist working the crew of aforementioned irritating scientists on top secret so top secret the government has only provided them dilapidated warehouse in perform their extensive experimentations project the goal make invisibility possibility for what purpose is never hinted at they have performed several experiments on animals and have nearly solved the quandary causing caine in twist worthy of the films late show origins impulsively experiment on himself caine neglects let the pentagon in on his plans and somehow gets two of his coworkers lie for him so the rest of the crew will think the pentagon gave the go ahead our mad scientist is turned invisible after several fxheavy complications then he inexplicably it is hinted that the process of invisibility has made the animals into more savage creatures but this is never explored and if that was the case why the hell would anyone be stupid enough test this out on human begins raping assaulting and murdering anyone he pleases always lame wisecrack ready la freddy krueger it grows abundantly clear each new release that it is verhoevens films that have become hollow like the rest this one is cold heartless and full of contempt for humanity but in addition all that it lacks any trace of wit insight and makes no statement other than audiences will pay for anything these days it is an affront anyone looking for something stimulating on an intellectual level or even those hoping spend saturday night fun thrillaminute ride verhoeven has instead served up an utterly routine mad slasher flick nobody root for and no reason care the previews make hollow man look like an irresistible flick how can one not have good time at that utilizes state of the art fx illustrate an invisible man getting down and dirty his bad self couple weeks ago after seeing the trailer bunch of friends and got into long discussion of how invisible man flicks never go so far as have the invisible individual indulging in their newfound ability hollow man looked like the first do so and whoa in serious manner boot but oh yeah it is directed paul verhoven not atom egoyan or peter greenway verhoeven delivers the sleazy goods but not in watchable or thrillingly disturbing manner here it just feels icky and uncomfortable the director keeps his camera trained at his nubile actresses caressing their breasts his lens all while fauxpsycho music strains in the background it is plainly obvious that verhoeven is not exploring voyeurism like in the classic peeping tom but exploiting it and not even doing that very well it is funny that all the technology million can get you verhoven is stuck at trying figure out how show womans naked breast manipulated an invisible hand most vexing is that the invisibility aspect is used simply as gimmick in yet another slasher movie wherein characters do stupid things just so the villain can pop up for more attacks in fact it is largely irrelevant that bacon is invisible since the end most of his potential victims don inferred glasses that track his body heat as in every mad slasher we get the killers pov scene where he spies on his neighbor while she undresses triggered unpleasant memories of slumber party massacre and lots of scenes where people are unknowingly stalked the only provides one moment that found genuinely creepy it happens when lab assistant kim dickens who looks like she stepped out of playboy in the middle of chit chat an invisible bacon suddenly pauses are you looking at me she queries obviously haunted it is little moment in big nothing offer but ground breaking special effects set plot that should have run its course the apex of the mad slasher craze those special effects are so stunning they alone keep this from being as bad as urban legend or still know what you did last summer and they are the only reason check out hollow man preferably as midweek bargain rental you have been warned but you probably will not listen will you tis pity

fact that charles bronson represents one of the most important movie icons of the represents one of the biggest and almost tragic ironies of that decade tragedy lies in the fact that the icon status was earned less quality of his work in movies but the quantity most of those movies were produced cannon group company led israeli producers menahem golan and yoram globus those two men probably thought that they could be the next roger corman movie mentors of future legends unfortunately that did not happened and when cannon finally went bankrupt at the end of the decade behind it stood the huge pile of cinematic garbage that would require at least few centuries before it reaches the camp appeal sadly for bronson that garbage also contained numerous movies in that capable character actor and action hero of the tried raise their worth simply being the main lead and lowering his own reputation in process on the other hand bronson could take comfort in fact that those movies were extremely popular especially among the audience or times younger than bronson himself one of such movies that seriously marred bronsons reputation is death wish third sequel in the series began death wish in in the original movie bronson played paul kersey mildmannered new york architect who turns into deadly street vigilante after his family fell victim urban violence that movie was far from masterpiece yet in it the director michael winner was skillfully offering the cinematic remedy for very real disease of growing crime rates of the time on the same lines like siegel in dirty harry unfortunately six years later cannon group got rights the character of paul kersey and began destroying it pumping out sequels even the presence of its original director did not stop the rapid decline of the quality death wish begins when kersey comes visit an old friend living in the urban wasteland of east new york populated young criminals and people too old or too poor move out before the reunion kerseys friend falls victim the street gang led evil fraker played gavan oherlihy probably the only noteworthy role in the kersey decides avenge his death and slowly prepares for his crusade while the police inspector shriker ed lauter ants use him as secret weapon in his losing war against the urban crime bronson the main asset in this movie plays the character who is nothing more than an efficient killing machine although bronsons charisma does help in overcoming some implausibilities single man in his and armed single pistol manages wipe out dozens of opponents superior firepower the lack of emotions or bronsons own commitment could be seen in very few lines spoken in the movie authors were somewhat aware of that emotional shallowness so they added romantic interest for their hero public defender played deborah raffin and conveniently terminated in order give some more motives for kerseys crusade on the other hand emotions are much better played confronting lawabiding yet ethnically stereotyped citizens their daily nemesis of street punks ruthless enough exercise their reign of terror on the entire city blocks and stupid enough be killed in droves kersey unfortunately michael winner does not know how work out the plot and after torturing the viewers mostly uninteresting characters and cliched and formulaic situations ends this movie bang the big showdown at the end that turns east new york into the sarajevolike battle zone is probably the worst part of the movie because of the poor editing and the cheap sets and props that give away the low budget in short this movie could be recommended only the most fanatical charles bronson fans or for the people who are already desperate for nostalgia special note for trekkies marina sirtis the actress who played counsellor deanna troi in star trek the next generation could be spotted in small role of portorican wife

overblown remake of the robert wise of the same name based on shirley jacksons novel the haunting of hill house stars lili taylor as one of three lab rats that participate in supposed insomnia study being initiated liam neeson he is actually conducting study on the causes of fear and why the human mind is still affected it he drags the test subjects out foreboding mansion where all types of creepy cgi effects scare the cast and try the audiences patience know this question has been posed before but why do people keep remaking good movies the original was great psychological horror this new version is dull and very decidedly not scary in fact feel it is downright impossible make modern day pg horror movie that is scary unless you find obvious computer generated special effects frightening then there is nothing in this that will raise hackles nearly fell asleep twice during the and probably would have if they guy two rows behind me did not seem have such personal relationship the characters that he felt he needed discuss every decision they made them as the progressed it is sad see such an amazing cast wasted so badly owen wilson spends most of the wandering the halls of the house and the script does no justice his wonderful comic ability catherine zetajones always nice look at is given the woefully underwritten role of bisexual insomniac that gets run out of her bedroom perplexed every time some strange noise occurs liam neeson pops in from time time talk into his tape recorder and attempt convince the others that he has as much knowledge about what is going on as the rest of them do finally poor lili taylor the center of the gets the brunt of the cgi effects thrown at her while everyone else gets scream and try rescue her apparently subplot involving tryst between zetajones and taylors characters was filmed but removed that is too bad because it might have lent some better characterization the narrative this is jan de bonts second straight misfire speed cruise control being the first when is he going learn that bigger is not always necessarily better robert wise knew that when he made the original and the makes of the blair witch project also knew that one should not approach haunted house movie twister mindset if de bont and screenwriter david self had let our minds fill in the blanks as what was happening instead of showing us everything it would have served make the terrifying what our mind fashions on it is own can be thousand times more frightening than having having it completely led towards everything apparently yet another version of this story is being filmed under it is original title certainly hope that this newer rendition will not be hurt the insanity of jan de bonts version and that it will retain the psychological impact that the original release had pg

tarzan and the lost city is one of the most anemic movies come out in quite while not only it is poorly written badly acted and generally incompetent in all cinematic areas it is thoroughly uninspired and insipid unfortunately it is not bad in the way great colossal misfires like heavens gate or ishtar were bad instead it literally drips off the screen like movie nobody wanted be associated begs the question of why it was made in the first place all the good scripts lying around unproduced how does needless drek like this make its way the big screen of course tarzan is one of the most filmed characters in all of motion picture history he has appeared in over forty films have ranged from the very good greystoke the legend of tarzan lord of the apes down the really bad tarzan the ape man bo derek most of these films were just cheapie bmovies made in the thirties and forties starring exolympic athletes and lot of cutsie chimps therefore if another tarzan movie is be made one might assume that it would have something new offer different angle an original storyline anything set it apart from all the others greystoke added neverbeforeseen level of realism the pulpy tale and even tarzan the ape man at least had the misguided audacity sexualize the story as vehicle for bo dereks bare breasts tarzan and the lost city on the other hand has absolutely nothing offer but bunch of recycled storylines and bad dialogue the script bayard johnson and anderson black is about as formulaic and generic as they come comic books have better plots than this the movie is so bad in fact that it retains that ridiculous tarzan call that was so tirelessly mocked in last summers comedy george of the jungle did not the producers think leave that back in the old weissmuller pictures where it belongs the story starts the legend of tarzan already firmly established quick opening narration tells of tarzan casper van dien being found in the jungle after having been raised apes and his return england where he assumes his greystoke heritage when the movie starts in he is civilized english gentleman without an english accent and he is marry jane jane march in less than week however when wicked archeologistgraverobber named nigel ravens steve waddington begins hunting for the fabled lost city of opar one of africas last great secrets the witch doctor of an ancient african tribe summons tarzan back the jungle at first jane refuses go pouting about how it will interfere their wedding but after tarzan leaves she changes her mind and tracks him down therefore assuring lots of lame smooch scenes between her and her apeman once the gets going in its own sluggish way it delves into series of jungle adventures as tarzan jane and the natives attempt the thwart ravens and his crew from discovering the city most of the socalled adventures are cheesy predictable and unexciting no pace tension or action speak of there are sequences stolen from innumerable recent adventure movies ranging from raiders of the lost ark the goonies when the movie is running short on action it includes few greenpeacefriendly scenes of tarzan freeing caged animals releasing baby elephant from trap and throwing ivory tusks into the river the movie is also lacking even remote hint of reality for instance when tarzan who was raised in the jungle is bit cobra he does not even attempt suck the venom out like any semiexperienced weekend backpacker would do instead he ties tourniquet around his arm and stumbles off into the jungle no plan for survival of course one cannot help but notice how fundamentally misleading the title is not ruin the ending or anything but there is no lost city there is however lost pyramid suppose is all the resourcestrapped fx department could come up the special effects are not worthy of madefortv movie also brings up the question of why the treasure hunters had slog through numerous underground caverns get the lost pyramid when it is sitting right out in the middle of an open field strictly speaking tarzan and the lost city is not even bad enough have camp quality although casper van diens laughably stiff performance comes real close this movie proves what starship troopers only hinted at he cannot act but he sure looks wellgroomed even in the deepest heart of the african jungle van dien is much too much of prettyboy be an effective tarzan he is calvin klein model in loin cloth also wondered what the makeup department was thinking when it outfitted him that awful circa steve perry haircut waddington makes decent villain although he is like charmless version of belloq from raiders of the lost ark as jane the exmodel jane march has little do but smile and look pretty next tarzan she does fire off gun at the evil treasure hunters time or two but whenever snake comes into the picture she is reduced hysterical mess however amidst all this complaining do have one piece of good news tarzan and the lost city is so lacking in ideas both new and old that it is unable fill even an hour and half of celluloid so we can say this much for it at least it had the decency be short

everything in the phantom you have seen many times before and there is nothing new presented here wincer displays absolutely no skill in setting up an exciting action sequence billy zane is wooden as the hero kristy swanson is given very little do and does very little it treat williams looking like rhett butler but sounding like mickey mouse is one of the worst villains have ever seen in movie only catherine zeta jones as one of williams cohorts turns in good performance she has energy and spunk the movie needed much more of oh yeah the phantom also has secret identity but this is so poorly played out you will not even care about the only things can recommend are good performance jones and some colorful scenery however if youre looking for fun family movie go watch the underrated flipper this is not good movie

a life less ordinary while the extremely peculiar life less ordinary does live up its title more appropriate moniker would be movie more misguided for this confused confusing attempt at romantic comedy is most disarming disaster from the talented trainspotting team of director danny boyle producer andrew macdonald and screenwriter john hodge at the core of this strange is fairly basicand yes ordinarypremise after robert boyle regular ewan mcgregor an aspiring writer of trashy novels is fired from his janitorial job at the naville corporation he kidnaps navilles ian holm spoiled daughter celine cameron diaz and holds her for ransom the joke here is that celine is willing victimher father threatened cut her off financially so she wants revengeand that she soon becomes not only an accomplice but the brains behind the scheme teaching the inept robert thing or two about kidnapping and ultimately did not we see this one coming love so far so mediocre but mediocre is better than dreadful this is thanks in no small part the hodges contextual frame for the romance it turns out that god is displeased the divorce and romantic breakup rate on earth so the chief of heavens police gabriel dan hedaya dispatches two angels oreilly holly hunter and jackson delroy lindo earth hook up celine and robertor lose their angel status this conceit might have worked if the angel dimension played an integral role in the entire picture but it could have easily been cut without any clear loss the as it stands it is simply waste of time that distracts from the romance at hand not that there is much of romance begin try as diaz and mcgregor may celine and robert are too onenote become very endearing characters celine is rich bitch robert is dullard as such it is quite hard for the audience really connect these twothen again they never seem really connect each other when celine and robert start overtly act on their feelings it comes off more like something scripted than anything natural but am not exactly sure if boyle and companys point was romance honestly am not exactly sure what they were trying accomplish boyle juices up the visuals his characteristic razzmatazz but it remains just thatenergy not energy in service of story or even acting the cast seems lost especially hunter whose performance is so adrift as be baffling and then there are the many eccentricities splattered onto the some violent confrontations involving the angels who are not exactly angelicin fact they end up staging their own ransom scheme some mystical hokum in the climax and cutesy claymation epilogue watching much of life less ordinary is like being trapped in indie hipster hell stockpiling quirks in the name of cool instead the just gives quirky bad name my best guess as what the filmmakers wanted accomplish is an atmosphere of warped womantic yes misspelling intended whimsy comes through in only one scene an extended musical number where celine and robert sing beyond the sea at karaoke bar after verse or two the couple are magically dolled up in snazzy outfits and hairdos and engage in spirited dance routine on the counter the scene works not only because of its relative simplicity but also because it does not try too hard just relying on the innate charm of the leads allowing them build romantic rapport alas not nearly enough is built for this moment comes an abrupt end applaud any attempt bring something fresh and unique movie houses but sometimes even cleverness can reach overkill life less ordinary certainly delivers something different but the time the was over was clamoring for life more ordinary can accept failure everyone fails at something but cannot accept not trying it does not matter if you win as long as you give everything in your heart michael jordan

how could grated disney based on meg cabots novel the princess diaries be anything but cute harmless fun easy take all the cute harmless fun out of it and while you are at it make it borrrring that is what director garry marshall screenwriter gina wendkos and not be outdone producer whitney houston have done the grated disney the princess diaries you could not tell it from the audience though braintree mass of growing glowing prepubescent girls and the odd parental popcorn perched about their persons who positively cheered when the end credits rolled ah the had struck lovely nerve them but not fuddyduddy old me well might have cheered that the utter tripe was now well and truly over but that would have been too obvious too obvious is the least of the problems marshalls garry made couple of other princess movies pretty woman and runaway bride but this ones way without julia roberts so maybe that is its problem in addition being predictable as molasses the princess diaries has hardly got laugh in it it is comedy could bore the pants off an abyssinian for long long stretches and is so sloppily edited the principals refer scenes we have not even seen yet and probably never will except perhaps in the dvd edition marshall should take virtually all of the blame here since he is been at this for some time and should know when scene or two is not working and hardly any of the princess diaries works works alas implies cleverness and there is none of that here either newcomer anne hathaway stars as mia thermopolis bright but socially invisible san franciscan teen who learns that her single mom wacky artist played the likable caroline goodall had bit of fling some royal member of some miniscule european country nobody ever heard of the filmmakers go out of their way not call it serbia is pretty much what all miniscule european countries are called in the movies mark my words and now she mia is next in line rule genovia hence the headphonestiara combo in the print ads julie andrews the luminous factor cranked plays mias grandmother aka queen clarisse renaldi who shows up out of the royal blue and lends mia much advice and direction in the eating talking and looking like princess department although mias big makeover simply transforms her from ugly duckling ugly swan does queen julie lose her dignity for the sake of good laugh not really consuming corn dog is about the worst that it gets also on stereotypical hand are brainless jock an evil cheerleader dorkylooking best friend welcome the dollhouse heather matarazzo sensitive auto mechanicmusician and marshall mainstay hector elizondo as joe the driver imparting wit and wisdom from the front seat of mias chauffeurdriven limousine at every intersection nonanimated grated movie is rarity these days but the rating here reflects the fact that all the guts all the good stuff has been exorcised from the finished product lame labored and lamentable the princess diaries is recommended for eightandahalf year olds of the feminine persuasion only all others would do well avoid it like potholes the plague and the perfect storm

the corruptor is big silly mess of an action movie complete pointless plot turns and gratuitous violence it is not abhorrent or even blatantly unlikable but it does not make shred of sense and whose idea was it have the director of glengarry glen ross direct an action james foley knows lot about characters and acting and those are the strengths of the corruptor but the quiet scenes clash the ludicrous action nonsense and the result is less like movie and more like derailed train at least we have chow yunfat in the lead role chow plays nick chen chinatown cop he is good cop as the first few scenes establish and he is very familiar chinatown that is probably why the powersthatbe decide team him up rookie named danny wallace mark wahlberg nick and danny begin stepping on each others toes but finally end up liking each other once they both get chance save the other ones life what happens after that is kind of mystery me am fairly certain that the villains are all part of the fukienese dragons led young chinese psycho named bobby vu byron mann am also pretty sure that nick is on the payroll of henry lee ric young gangster dealing in prostitutes and other neat stuff am not quite sure why henry lee decides employ danny although this makes for some ridiculous albeit unpredictable plot twists along the way there is also an interesting subplot revolving around dannys father brian cox but it does not have much do the main story one of the problems as said is that the movie does not make any sense do not blame this entirely on foley because he is obviously good director am more inclined point my finger at robert puccis script does not seem be in tune the way normal people act one scene early on had me particularly annoyed nick confronts his boss because he is angry about his new white partner he is shouting and pointing his finger and stepping on the furniture and was thinking that would have fired him if he had done that me in addition the takes bite into racerelated issues and never develops them at all there are lot of scenes like this one and none of them are very coherent there is also considerable language barrier given that chow and some of the other actors have thick chinese accents the plot itself never straightens out am not sure who or what the fukienese dragons are or why henry lee is associated them or what they do as group the corruptor is an action movie and so all these weird plot developments are decorated loud and violent action sequences the sequences are not bad but they are not new how many car chases through chinatown have you seen on that note how many chinatown cop movies have you seen one too many would imagine foleys strength is clearly in characterization and he does pretty good job here the scenes between nick and danny are very good and actually got feel for their characters bond forms between them that holds parts of the together chow and wahlberg are both good actors chow is pro and can do this kind of stuff in his sleep wahlberg seems less at home in this atmosphere but he is still fun watch also liked the subplot involving dannys father brian coxs performance is powerful and his character makes compelling moral compass for danny but the ultimately fails mostly at the hands of insane incoherence and overlyfamiliar action scenes complicated plot can be successful but the story needs make sense when it is over the corruptor never manages make any sense it just keeps spinning out of control until finally there is nothing left hold on

return horror high wants be couple different types of movies at once the tells the story of lowbudget horror movie being filmed at the closeddown crippen high school where group of serial murders took place five years before but what the cast and crew do not know is that real killer maybe the same one that was never apprehended is going into action again on one level return horror high is slasher movie and it is at this level that it works the best on watching the was made in could not help but take notice that the killers costume was almost identital that of the ghostface in scream and scream on another level the wants be slapstick comedy and there are many hints of this throughout unfortunately most of these jokes fall flat and the last thing the wants be is behindthescenes look at an exploitation being made the only problem is that while much of it is supposed be from the movie itself being made no cameras are shown filming it thus making it far more confusing than it had be and top it all off the twist ending makes very little no sense whatsoever and so we are basically left feeling as if we wasted our time there are story developments that are beyond ludicrous and plot holes you could drive winnebago through if you see the or have seen it you will know what mean the premise of return horror high is admittedly pretty crafty and liked the atmosphere of the school is where the whole thing takes place but director froehlich judging from this movie is an incompetent director except for being able the seldom suspeneful scene well come think of it there is only one scene that is actually scary and it has do two actors being locked in room as the killer tries break in but other than that twominute distraction return horror high is certainly no great shake note look for george clooney in supporting role as one of the actors on the and strangely enough he is the first character get the ax literally

the art of woo attempts be one of those films like breakfast at tiffanys in the audience is rooting for some sweet vulnerable irresistible woman work out her problems and find happiness the problem is that helen lee who writes and directs seems have written alessa woo played sookyin lee as neither sweet nor vulnerable and she is quite resistible alessa is young woman who happens be brilliant art dealer in the toronto art scene this is some sort of alternate world art scene where people pay tens of thousands of dollars for paintings talented beginners and dealers in these paintings fly back and forth places like switzerland one of the most knowledgeable of the art dealers is alessa she also happens be the center of adulation of her friends and every party has suitors camped outside her window next door alessa moves struggling genius artist and native american ben crowchild adam beach he sees that behind the facade that there is really sad little girl within alessa who really will not be happy the rich art collector she is dating ben gets emotionally involved alessa as alessa so delicately puts it we were bosom buddies now we are fuck buddies but alessa will have decide whether she wants love ben or wealth her rich suitor the real problem the seems be helen lees inability decide what she wants be saying she undercuts nearly everything she wants us believe about alessa alessa is looking for financial security but she makes decisions about large sums of money for her clients this appears be high profile and wellpaid job we are supposed care about alessas feelings but she coldly refuses visit her own ailing father alessa cannot be portrayed as sweet and vulnerable if at an art auction she turns into our man flint this is charmless romantic comedy that bets everything it has on the appeal of its main character and comes up doublezero rate it on the scale and on the scale

capsule science fiction allegory at the millennium lethal contagious virus has hit taiwan officials have cut off water and other services the center of contagion life there devolves and degenerates man in an apartment has hole in his floor and it harasses his downstairs neighbor slow but harrowing be missed if possible low the taiwan virus is ravaging taiwan and the part of the city that is the center of the contagion has been evacuated of anyone who will go one apartment building still houses people woman formerly an office worker yang kueimei is tormented her upstairs neighbor lee kangsheng who has hole cut plumber in the floor and is using it as drain neighbor runs small failing grocery store make things more depressing it is constantly raining hard upstairs neighbor vomits through pours water etc small and almost entirely onesided war starts allegory about callousness and selfishness woman is living on pile of rolls of toilet tissue incongruous songs added show downstairs neighbors dreams these are the songs of popular taiwanese singer grace chang apartment is falling apart wallpaper is separating from walls plumbing is failing boredom shown long cuts in nothing happens lot of seems be used up this story might have been done much better as tenminute animated stars are considered be great dramatic actors one reviewer this seems longer at minutes most twohour films

seen december at m at the glenwood movieplex cinemas oneida ny theater myself for free free pass theater rating good seats sound and picture there are many philosophies as why we are so fascinated cartoons they provide method of total escapism in anything will work within their context from the outrageous slapstick of looney tunes the intensity of japanimation watching flubber really clinched this idea for me because it is just live action cartoon that presents itself as regular comedy it proves how painfully unfunny all those gags and slapstick would be in reality and how important it is actually have story the wastes no time in establishing its lighthearted cartoony atmosphere we meet medfield college chemistry professor phillip brainard williams the typical supposedly likable mad scientist within the first minutes we get at least half dozen jokes about how forgetful he is phillips memory loss seems less like cartoony gag and more like real case of alzhiemers disease is not this rather lowbrow comedy he starts teaching chemistry after walking in on nude figure drawing class an inappropriate joke for kids movie if ever saw one we learn he has stood his up fiancee sara harden twice at the altar simply because he is forgotten sara claims love him but says if he forgets the wedding again she will stop loving him sign of childish attitude the denies it has but even cartoons must have conflicts resolve and it is no surprise the major conflicts here are related christopher mcdonald does and even worse version of his usual villain shtick as wilson croft scientist who not only wants steal phillips ideas but his woman too what is worse is that sara actually seems interested in him wilson works for rival college that wants buy out medfield is going broke unless phillip can invent something save the day one of the first rules of filmmaking is make sure the title has something do the the flubber is played for gags after it is introduced but is all but forgotten about thereafter it is obvious phillip is going accidentally invent flubber flying rubber compound that yields tremendous energy and the promotions make the flubber look realistic and funny unfortunately the flubber like all the special effects in this looks very fake and unconvincing flubber also seems have intelligence and personality and the time it performs song and dance routine you give up wondering how life could spontaneously come an inanimate object most of the wanders aimlessly as it relies on the flubber make for the comedy since phillips absentmindedness is forgotten about and somehow push the story along but it is clear how weak this premise is from the getgo and the just gets worse all the jokes involve people getting hit fastmoving flubberpowered objects including bowling balls flying cars that do not fly well and basketball team capable of jumping feet into the air it is all presented complete logic and no one believes flubber exists even when they see it their own eyes during the basketball scene the coach for the rival team actually says think they might be cheating the referee replies there is no rules about jumping too high predictable does not begin describe the motions the goes through especially after the halfway point and it is not how terribly contrived the plot is it is the way it is broken down scenebyscene absolutely no transition not only that but all the actors here especially williams seem bored tears would say percent of all the scenes were shot bluescreen so it is almost forgivable when you realize they are talking nothing and interacting nothing it is safe say everything that could be bad about flubber is the only original element the has is the worlds first romance between machine and human but this aspect is quite twisted if you think about it and like the rest of the you will not
