for those interested in the true spirit of moviemaking or what is left of it in mainstream movie are star vehicles are terrible things as rule the ignore general principles of cinema because they are not made advance the media but rather advance the career of particular actor an actor might be chosen on the upandup give him exposure or he might be chosen on the way down hand him paycheck generally though the actor does not matter and soldier the latest from the beleaguered warner brothers exemplifies this the picture lacks pizazz the star for the vehicle in this case is kurt russell otherwise known as the man of thirty words or less russell plays todd human trained from birth in the ways of waging war and becoming emotionally distanced from the carnage he has wrought the movie lets us see this degenerate process but the time the real plot starts we are into todds later years he is about be replaced new breed of soldiers ones who instead of being trained from birth are genetically selected before birth the pride of this class caine jason scott lee will be our villain and you know he is the villain because he has staring contest our hero near the movies start between the two leads less than full typed page of dialogue is spoken and it is possible imagine script is ninety percent stage direction director paul anderson who helmed last years icy thriller event horizon does not show any inventiveness here and instead is content let the actions play out on screen ad nauseam todd upon being replaced is left die on garbage planet but in order stretch the running time out the villains return the garbage planet on routine patrol and set the stage for the final firefight events are predictable from the time that the setups are made and neither anderson nor scriptwriter david peoples attempts show any creativeness here the most annoying plot facet is the reason that the whole of the movie comes be todd fails show physical superiority against caine in fact not even todd and two of his companions can best the baddie but near the end of the movie he shows remarkable prowess automatic weaponry it is not as though todd undergoes any significant character changes throughout the plot of the story and so the plot has very canned feeling about it the best route through this disaster is take it lighthearted in spirit and treat it as parody of typical action fare like universal soldier strict interpretation however reveals an unmistakeable and unforgiveable lack of style class or substance and next year large percentage of the people who have seen this will have taped it off of network television

director doug ellins kissing fool released earlier this year is an aptly titled comedy about two plastic couples housed in an artificial story like sitcom jokes so lame that it would be impossible overlay laugh track on it the movie meanders along insulting the viewers intelligence in almost every frame the script james frey and the director is filled vapid actors who read meaningless lines you have heard before am not wearing any underwear the bimbo tells the famous sportscaster max in what she assumes will be surefire comeon line max chicagos biggest playboy decides get married after whirlwind love affair sam short for samantha max and sam possess two irritating personalities and they hold little chemistry for each other or the audience max is played without any style david schwimmer schwimmer whose acting talent is playing characters devoid of personality makes an unlikely lover his costar mili avital as sam is cut from the same cloth so they can be argued be matched pair after all people of the same intelligence are naturally drawn each other ditto for similar looks so why should not the personalitychallenged be attracted the implausible plot has max asking his best friend jay jason lee hit on sam as test jay is supposed try get her sleep him but stop short of the actual act max being promiscuous nature worries that his future bride may have the same need sleep around as he does the idea of flirting the beautiful sam makes jay so sick that he becomes unable eat or work neither the script nor the actors make this test believable the question is how do you know you are the wrong person so you can avoid wreaking havoc on major parts of your life jay asks in one of the unsuccessful attempts at adding some seriousness the finally there is the films attempt at physical comedy jays exgirlfriend natasha vanessa angel becomes infatuated jay again once she thinks he is going out someone else natasha rips jays shirt open after pushing him down onto the sofa as she throws her hair on his bare chest she demands he pull it this is supposed be funny most films have some saving grace some bit part was done especially well or some scene managed be funny even if the rest of the picture was not kissing fool on the other hand has nothing recommend it kissing fool runs it is rated for profanity and sexuality and would be acceptable for most teenagers

i am continually amazed at movies like this that some producer would waste an abundance of talent and money on script as abysmal as this one is mindboggeling but it seems happen lot nowadays wild wild west is beautifully filmed well acted and well directed piece of garbage and its insipid screenplay is completely at fault in short this movie is comedy without laughs so many jokes fall flat that it borderlines surreal the high production values keep it from being total fiasco but it is still pretty boring will smith stars as jim west an old western rb variation of the james bond character west is teamed up artemus gordon kevin kline and they are pretty much polar oppisites west prefers solve his problems an array of bullets gordon traditionally favors more pacifistic approach talk about deeply developed characters at any rate this leads the inevitable conflicts between methodologies none of are funny the year is several top scientists have been abducted and the suspected culprit is disgruntled former confederate general bloodbath mcgrath ted levine president grant sends west and gordon investigate there is evidence that mcgrath is attending some sort of confederate reunion in louisiana west and gordon show up and learn that mcgrath is actually working for dr arliss loveless kenneth branagh another disgruntled former confederate as it turns out loveless plans use the combined knowledge of the scientests create the ultimate super weapon he will use conquer the united states would go further the plot but there is not any point this films narrative is little more than jumbled unfunny mess only laughed at couple of jokes and then only lightly there is not one truly uprorously funny moment in this and that is pretty disasterous when you consider that it is primarily comedy as said the fault is totally that of the script when you consider their respective roles will smith and kevil kline do as good as they could have possibly done the leads could have been played samuel jackson and robert de niro and the still would have been awful no one and mean no one can make line like bye bye mr knife guy sound good still this has lot going for it visually the set design is fantastic maybe even oscar worthy the cinematogrophy michael ballhaus who was also behind camera in martin scorseses brilliant goodfellas is absolutely stunning he lends the much needed exciting comic bookish look will not fault barry sonnenfeld either he does fine job of directing the proceedings but like the rest of the people involved the there really is not anything that he can do correct its one major flaw despite being beautifully made wild wild west becomes quite boring after the halfway point the appeal of the visuals ends long before the does if wild wild west did not look so good it would be almost insufferable as it is it is somewhat tolerable but not very entertaining it hurts give such well made movie score this low but there is not anything much worse than an unfunny comedy

this talky terriblyplotted thriller stars alec baldwin as dave robicheaux an exnew orleans cop who gets ensnared in murder mystery after lightplane crashes into the bayou beside his fishing boat he and his wife annie kelly lynch rescue little salvadorian girl samantha lagpacan from the wreckage and that is when the trouble begins the other major players include local drug lord eric roberts his scheming wife teri hatcher soused stripper mary stuart masterson and shady dea agent vondie curtis hall everyone knows everyone else and it makes for collective that is curious but never compelling based on the book james lee burke heavens prisoners is so badly plotted that entire scenes seem be missing early on we have no idea of why dave and annie keep the child themselves nor how they eluded both the coast guard and the faa later dave is reunited drugabuser who appears seemingly clean and sober and without any explanation huh the whole movie is like this perhaps the result of some unkind cuts that happened during the eighteen months that the sat on the shelf whatever the reason somebody should tell director phil joanou final analysis recut this mess in its present form heavens prisoners runs only two hours plus change but it feels like four

spoiled rich kid kelley morse chris klein receives new mercedes for graduation present he and his buddies take it for joyride small nearby town where he proceeds torment the locals simply because he is rich and they are not he ends up provoking jasper josh hartnett into race and as result the local gas station and diner are destroyed when they crash into it kelley is sentenced rebuild the diner and has live jasper in spare room over his familys barn jaspers girlfriend sam leelee sobieski soon takes liking kelley however despite the fact that it was her familys diner that was destroyed and all kelley does is sit around sulk and smart off the townspeople but when she sees him sweaty and shirtless that is apparently all she needs lose her feelings for jasper whose only fault seems be perpetual case of hat hair so sobieski soon falls in love kelley especially after the day she follows him through the woods and hears him giving his graduation speech he was unable deliver because he caused the destruction of property and nearly killed dozens of people in the speech kelley quotes poem robert frost just so happens be sams favorite poem as well awwwww soon they are frolicking around in the fields and for some reason waste no time letting people in town especially jaspers best friend see them together kelley continues make an ass of himself in town especially when he shows up at the town dance drunk and steaming because sam went jasper kelley runs off and decides leave town sam catches up him at the bus station and he asks her come boston him jasper shows up and tearfully confesses sam just how much he loves her and sam without even breaking stride basically says see ya and takes off boston kelley here on earth goes in so many wrong directions from the start that the time its fairly decent ending comes around its completely worthless chris klein and leelee sobieski are two of my current favorite young performers and it is because of their presence that watched this in the first place however not long into the proceedings wanted just reach into the and strangle them both should not have such feelings towards people like but their characters are so infuriating that well trust me you will feel the same way even though both of the lead male characters are usually in the wrong kelley is hands down the more unlikable of the two simply because his jerkish actions are calculated he intends be jackass each and every time he does it jasper on the other hand only reacts kelleys provocations and afterwards comes across as being truly sorry for his impulsive actions but as in life nice guys finish last for the entire we watch sam fall in love the guy no one likes while the films only sympathetic character gets completely crushed then cancer subplot comes into play where things get even more infuriating if you can imagine that what things were not depressing enough for you mr screenwriter who greenlit this project who on earth thought this would entertain anyone perhaps if the had been structured where kelley perhaps felt some remorse after he caused the destruction of property and nearly killed dozens of people but even after he is destroyed these peoples lives he continues be snob them and ruins one more for good measure here on earth is available on dvd from fox home entertainment it contains the in its original theatrical aspect ratio of and is enhanced for televisions extras include jessica simpsons music video for where you are commercial for the films soundtrack the way is the only good thing about the the original theatrical trailer and five tv spots trailers for other fox releases anna and the king anywhere but here the beach drive me crazy ever after romeo juliet simply irresistible as well as that new fox promo touting their upcoming dvd releases that really enjoy the picture and sound quality on the disc are fine nothing that will challenge anyones audiovideo systems of course fans of this movie if any exist should enjoy the dvd release here on earth is not entertaining nor is it compelling no joy or entertainment value can be derived from any of the events of the it is merely waste of time money and talent

some movies prerelease buzz is so insistent on their high oscar potential that when they are finally released everyone just goes along it thus sometimes films unworthy of any award sans the razzie become oscar hopefuls and some even score nominations last year it was the thin red line this years winner is the hurricane pure unadulterated tripe that is all of sudden being received critical plaudits and votes in the office oscar pool acclaimed director norman jewisons biopic retreads all the conventions of courtroom movies without any of the fun and that is supposed be ok because see it is true story it is about rubin hurricane carter denzel washington legendary african american prizefighted who is unjustly convicted of triple homicide the help of ghastly racist detective dan hedaya who is had it in for the bigshot hurricane ever since he arrested him for stabbing white man knife in selfdefense but who cares right when rubin was only ten he is serve three life sentences no possibility of parole most of the takes place when he is in his th year in prison the rescue lesra martin vicellous reon shannon and his team of wannabe detectives lesra is an african american teenager taken in three welloff canadian white people hanna unger schreiber get an education lesra and his buddies go book sale where lesra picks out his very first book the sixteenth round rubins autobiography immediately thereafter schreibers character tells lesra sometimes we do not pick the books we read they pick us hmmm after few visits the prison they become convinced of rubins innocence and launch their own fullscale investigation even though two juries have convicted him they meticulously go through all the files and revisit all the old witnesses wonder if any of them might be cranky old women who slam the door in their faces and in the course of their relentlessy tedious sleuthing uncover obvious evidence confirming the hurricanes innocence that was either ignored or never seeked out during the first two proceedings of course we are already told that he is innocent movie like this is especially frustrating because we are not being shown everything significant that happened carter during this period in his life all too obviously we are getting the watered down version that would be ok except that the parts we are getting is milked for every single drop of melodrama that the filmmakers could possibly squeeze out of it it is almost cruel the melodrama is not of the entertaining kind either it is the hokey rammeddownyourthroat variety where every emotion is exaggerated the point of absurdity witness the villain ferociously grinding his teeth at the final trial or the constant pseudosaintliness of our four protagonists the hurricane is your basic courtroom movie except it is nofrills courtroom movie it is formula stripped the bare necessities you have your wrongly accused black man you have your melodramatic final courtroom scene but there is nothing else you would expect some sort of involving investigation but that is not necessary since we are implicitly informed of his innocence thus the whole middle portion of the movie is reduced the protagonist brooding brooding himself brooding other inmates brooding lesra brooding lesras canadian friends brooding in letters do not think will ever look at brooding the same way again it was not long before got tired of hearing the hurricanes exceedingly deep meditations on his condition wanted something happen as for washingtons performance in the title role figured would have address it sooner or later considering the amount of attention it is received he is top notch though still boring how is that possible well he does what jewison wanted him do perfectly unfortunately what jewison asked him do is load of crap what waste of great performer speaking of wastes why the hell did john hannah agree do this he is an extremely talented actor and love him dearly but what is he doing here call his character along schreibers and ungers stick figure would be gross understatement all three of them come off as veritable mother theresas as benevolent as dogooders come if they are play major part in this movie why not make them real people real feelings and emotions look if you are going make formula movie do not undermine the formula courtroom dramas can be fun but this is ridiculous not only is it trite it is boring

all feature directors who cut their teeth on music videos please raise your hands thank you for identifying yourselves now would you all please go away your influence has rank as one of the most annoying trends in filmmaking in the last decade and it shows no sign of abating any time soon it is not just the strobe light quality of your twentycutsperminute editing or the numbing overuse of popular music artists on the soundtracks makes me suspicious of any advertised featuring the music of no it is kind of cynicism you have perfected banking on the idea that no one will care about the lack of story if you include enough bells and whistles welcome the club scott kalvert your adaptation of the basketball diaries is loud and onedimensional serving only as the vehicle for performance leonardo dicaprio that is better in pieces than it is as whole dicaprio stars as jim carroll the new york poetsongwriter performer on whose autobiographical writings the is based as the opens jim is budding high school basketball star given petty thievery and getting drunk buddies mickey mark wahlberg pedro james madio and neutron patrick mcgaw one night jim graduates from inhalants cocaine and shortly thereafter heroin jims addiction the drug starts him on downhill spiral as he is kicked off the basketball team his coach bruno kirby kicked out of his home his mother lorraine bracco and drops out of school along mickey and pedro jim becomes victim of the street living from fix fix and sinking lower and lower the basketball diaries has been bouncing around as project for years but the sticking point has always been that jim carroll as character was too unsympathetic and too much loner screenwriter bryan goluboff created the three characters who act as carrolls posse resulting in jim carroll who is just as unsympathetic but now equally unsympathetic friends as the basketball diaries may be intended primarily as cautionary tale minute long just say no public service announcement but as drama it is monumentally ineffective because it is impossible care much about anyone in the movie jim is sort of jerk even before he becomes junkie but suppose that his pseudosensitive poetry and his devotion his terminally ill friend are intended balance that out perhaps we are expected see jim as one of those good kids who falls in the wrong crowd that every parent believes his or her troubled child be saw him simply as part of the bad crowd without character who changes in any appreciable way the basketball diaries rapidly degenerates into collection of crimes committed jim and his strungout cohorts all choreographed an oppressively loud soundtrack director scott kalvert does not have many scenes intrinsic dramatic impact work so he substitutes silly slowmotion photography selfconsciously funky camera angles and choppy editing on only one occasion when steady pan around room where jim is trying detox makes it appear that the walls are closing in are any of the gimmicks effective mostly they just draw attention how hollow the story is they also do not allow leonardo dicaprios performance be as strong as it could have been for every impressive moment like his desperate attempt get his mother give him money there is scene where kalvert pulls too much of the focus his own camera theatrics dicaprio is most effective when he is playing off other actors particularly fine sequence featuring ernie hudson as an exjunkie who tries help jim straighten out but kalvert will not let character interaction define this story he wants turn dicaprio into rock star shooting him in dramatic fashion but denying him the opportunity do much acting at isolate moments the basketball diaries is fine showcase for dicaprios talents far more frequently it looks like kalvert is trying imagine what long form velvet underground video might have looked like

depending on your degree of cinematic acumen last man standing is either a prohibitionera remake of akira kurosawas classic yojimbo a prohibitionera remake of sergio leones classic fistful of dollars a prohibitionera action drama completely original storyline new line is certainly counting on the fact that there are far more potential viewers in category than in the other two combined much as the recent remakes of diabolique and the vanishing counted on avoiding such comparisons the fact is that there is yet another way of looking at last man standing is as the first version of the story nods the _real_ source material the dashiell hammett novel _red harvest_ it also shows that kurosawa and leone knew better what do that material than hammett himself this time around the man no name is played bruce willis fellow shady history of an undefined nature who rolls into the texas border town of jericho one day on his way mexico all appearances jericho is well on its way becoming ghost town the few remaining inhabitants generally belonging one of two bootlegging operations fighting for control of liquor coming over the border one is headed an irishman named doyle david patrick kelly the other is run chicagoconnected italian mobster strozzi ned eisenberg calling himself john smith the man decides that there is money be made from the conflict and hires himself out as an enforcer doyles side but smiths allegiance is as uncertain as his name and he begins play the two sides against each other while trying stay one step ahead of both of them viewers familiar both previous incarnations of this story will find virtually nothing radically changed from plotting standpoint and that alone should make last man standing somewhat more respectable than other recent remakescumbastardizations there is the happily ineffectual lawman bruce dern the unhappily detained object of one of the bosses affections karina lombard the barkeep who becomes our antiheros only friend william sanderson suspicious lieutenants christopher walken and michael imperioli question the bosses trust in smith brutal beating and big fire director walter hill gives the proceedings his usual injection of steroids including pair of guns for willis have the ability propel an assailant backward sufficient thrust achieve escape velocity but at least he does not try turn the story into slasher or buddy picture what he _does_ do is nearly as big mistake and that is provide running voiceover narration willis rings of the standard hardboiled style of pulp detective fiction yes that narration is full of cliches but those are are not particularly troubling the problem is that both yojimbo and fistful of dollars succeeded largely on the inscrutability of their lead characters they were mystery the other characters in the and the audience their motives never entirely clear even after they have acted and that quality contributed their almost mythical status john smiths voice chattering on in the background and allowing us into his every thought he becomes more mundane just another tough guy trying stay alive it feels like hammett novel all right and hill can plead faithfulness his text for his choice but it simply does not work the narration allows the man no name take us into his confidence and the man no name takes _no one_ into his confidence even if you walk into last man standing as blank slate cannot imagine it being much more than heavily armed minor distraction willis tones down his macho swagger as the taciturn smith but there is still level on he always seems like he is counting on being tougher than everyone else rather than smarter than everyone else christopher walken plays doyles brutal henchman as slight variation on his gallery of softspoken psychos and there is not another single character whom makes even the slightest impression no compelling antagonist for smith there is no buildup towards the expected showdown and when it does come that showdown is over so quickly you wonder what all the fuss was about cinematographer lloyd ahern who also did the only noteworthy work on hills flop wild bill creates some nifty sunburned vistas but his work is only keep the eye distracted between the spurts of gunfire and the next bit of counterproductive narration sometimes when someone sees lackluster remake of revered original they will wonder what all the talk was about in the case of last man standing it is those who know the originals who will wonder what all that talking was about

okay bear me you all cause first off have get this off my chest what the hell is up that damn crab whew okay cause that same clip shown over and over again was beginning get on my nerves towards the end as cute as the crab maybe even know that you need more footage than that and that was not the only thing getting on my nerves the cutesy gimmicks saccharine sweet score soundtrack and the pretty young faces of sarah michelle gellar as amanda and sean patrick flannery as tom might have held some appeal during oh say the first minutes of the movie at first the movie moves along at quick interesting pace it is speedily established that something magical is about happen amanda when she encounters totally random fairy godfather type person on the street whose aforementioned crab follows her everywhere and just does not die ridiculous concept yes but at this point am willing accept it because am willing accept that this is how amandas life is changed how her powers are received later on the movie cannot seem decide whether these powers come from this fairy godfather or from amanda falling in tom and this is why the clips of the crab were annoying they were not just repetitive they were out of place and unnecessary the plot stumbles along at an uneven speed sometimes dwelling too long on particular development amanda suddenly becoming great chef her falling in love tom etc sometimes moving on too quickly for its own good some places the plot just does not make sense sometimes it is way too contrived the crab bit for example and sometimes too corny peaches emitting dry ice cannot beat that all in all the plot seemed fragmented unconnected not romantic at all and only funny in some places so okay do the magic powers come from the crab or the fairy godfather she can float now too and all of sudden instead of just making dry ice come out of peaches she can put her emotions into her food tom all of sudden just accepts amandas witchcraft in the end would people really dine in restaurant that resembles life after death in tupacs video what the hell is up that damn crab it is unfortunate because liked the basic premise of the movie until it became too fantastical and tiresome the seemed skirt around serious theme or at least theme for while but towards the end it resolved show us long flashback clips and minutes of people crying at their tables the humor was good in some places nolan gets the funniest bits including that incomprehensible totally random thing the dolls gellar and flannery are qualified actors and gellar has particular charm but much prefer her playing the saucy buffy or even annette in the upcoming cruel intentions than this sorry excuse for character it is almost funny sometimes see these two trying so hard make the dialogue sound better than it is or trying make the relationship seem more plausible the supporting character nolan was highlight though he reminded me bit of kevin in you have got mail see footnotes and as always typical of chick flick romantic comedy there is seemingly endless romantic soundtrack in the background cued up at all the right places this sort of got on the nerves after while too simply irresistible is not hard understand light funny in some places and generally disappointing because it cannot draw the line between romance and protracted sap between humor and tired slapstick and how could refrain from making pun simply irresistible is all too easy resist first viewing did anyone else think this was tad bit similar you have got mail or the shop around the corner business rivals fall in love female counterparts business is in danger of being shut down female as mother like figure guiding her the annoying hysterical exgirlfriends _really_ like sarah michelle gellars wardrobe

i went blair witch project book of shadows the highest of hopes the original released last summer was genuinely scary and terrifying hoped that this movie would live up its predecessor unfortunately my hopes were soon dashed as the movie opens the audience is shown pseudodocumentary clips of burkittsville maryland residents being interviewed about the sudden tourist influx their town as result of the original blair witch project movie it is mostly humorous selfaware poke at the media hype and hysteria surrounding the first during this segment we are introduced the protagonist young man who sells blair witchrelated memorabilia from his website the movie then cuts title that informs us that what we are about see occurred one year previously we see the same young man that was selling blair witch paraphernalia but now he is confined in mental institution the sort of one only finds in bad horror movies we see him having some sort of disgusting white goo unconvincingly forced down his nose while cigarettesmoking doctor luridly leers above him we see him throwing himself wildly around padded room we see him cowering naked in shower stall as fire hose is turned on him no explanation is provided for why he is in the mental institution in fact these scenes are barely referred again had sinking feeling during these opening scenes generally hospital scene that is set poor lighting filthy interiors and evil doctors is sure sign that you are in the throes of truly horrible movie the movie cuts again this time the present the young man whose name is jeffrey played jeffrey donovan as in the first movie the character names are identical the actors names although this movie admits up front that it is fictional so there is no reason for the practice this time around is rounding up group of people that he will be leading into the woods that weekend for the blair witch hunt is promotional gimmick he came up and sells on his website we meet tristen and steven young couple who are writing book about the blair witch experience steven is skeptic believing the whole thing be the result of mass hysteria tristen on the other hand believes that there may be some truth the rumors of supernatural occurrence she is wan and softspoken she complains that the radio is playing too loudly she also complains that she feels nauseated knew immediately that the character was pregnant and my intuition was confirmed few scenes later when kim psychomagically susses it out how did know because in bad movies nauseated women are always pregnant the fourth member of their party is erica wiccan flowing hair and wide eyes who wants prove that the blair witch was good witch not evil they pick up the fifth and final team member in cemetery kim is dressed completely in black has extreme gothstyle makeup on and occasionally displays seemingly psychic abilities but otherwise seems be the most intelligent and reasonable person out of the entire bunch presumably she wanted be picked up in the cemetery just for dramatic effect it is never explained the party of five heads off into the woods as promised they reach the crumbling ruins of the foundation of rustin parrs house and set up camp complete extensive video equipment record the nights events there is brief encounter rival blair witch tour group who had planned camp at that site as well but after few words are exchanged the rival group huffs off and makes camp elsewhere the movie veers off at this point spend many long long minutes showing the drinking party that ensues after the sun goes down sexual innuendoes are tossed around much hard liquor beer and pot is consumed and nothing much else happens this would be great point get up and go the bathroom if necessary the next day the team wakes up and discovers that their camera equipment has been completely trashed and that steven and tristens manuscript paper is fluttering down from the sky in shreds like snow the videotapes are missing but thanks psychic intuition from kim they discover the videotapes buried underneath the foundation of the house right where the original blair witch tapes were found ooh spooky the team goes back jeffreys house creepy old civil warera warehouse in the heart of the woods regroup and review the tapes they soon discover that the tapes mysteriously skip five hours of the night wacky hijinks ensue tristen starts having weird dreams in she is the blair witch everybody starts finding these weird runelike burn marks on their bodies steven and erica have some highly disturbing mutual hallucinations and everything pretty much goes hell in handbasket throughout the entire ordeal jeffrey and the others continue scrutinize the videotapes seem have some kind of weird images on them at about the point that the time jumps eventually tristen wanders in mutters something about reverse and from this they somehow realize that they have play the tapes backwards when they do this they discover what really happened during the five lost hours one of the things they see on the videotape is footage of themselves burying the videotapes okay if the videotapes were being buried then how were they recording themselves oh nevermind this movie was awful simply awful the characters are broadlydrawn caricatures that are never allowed any depth or development erica is the natureloving wiccan tristen is the weak and sympathetic woman steven is the overbearing asshole kim is the antisocial goth girl old tired cliches were used illustrate these caricatures how do we know tristen is weak and sympathetic because she is pregnant how do we know kim is an antisocial goth girl because she wears lot of eye makeup how do we know the local sheriff is bad guy because he has jagged teeth and talks like he is straight out of deliverance this is weak storytelling at its worst rather than taking the time flesh out the characters and make them truly sympathetic the writer chose give each one few stereotypical characteristics in an attempt use some cinematic shorthand and thereby skip straight the action it did not work on top of being poorly developed most of the characters were either seriously unlikable or patently stupid honey you just had miscarriage out in the woods and got medical attention at hospital that looks like it belongs in bad slasher movie let us get on plane home no am having these bizarre nightmares and seeing strange visions and want find out what is going on ok frankly the end of the movie was rooting for the witch also felt that there was simply too much blood gore in this the first movie worked never showing us the horror the witch was palpable presence in that movie but we never saw it we never saw anything in fact the horror was all offscreen and thus our imaginations worked overtime envision what it might possibly be this is the hallmark of truly creepy and disturbing horror movie blair witch dispensed such niceties and went straight for the grossout this was evident from the opening scenes of the mad doctors forcing white goo down jeffreys throat and continued throughout the as the audience is treated occasional confusing and disorienting footage of what appears be ritual massacre of some sort knives plunge into flesh bloody fingers trail off into the darkness and none of it is explained until the very end when it was too late for me care this movie did not stop showing us the gore either it went for broke and showed us everything the end of the movie there are no questions remaining about the missing five hours it is all explained in fact it is all shown onscreen in loving detail confess being someone who prefers horror movies in you never see the monster or see only brief glimpses mere suggestions of what the monster is it is not because find the monster so terrifying but because find the absence of the monster be infinitely more terrifying have seen interviews the director in he suggested that there is no monster that all of the evil was perpetrated only the human mind found this be miserably poor explanation if it was in fact the directors intent then he needs have some words the writer because it was not made clear at all know lot of people who like go parties and get drunk and stoned out of their minds none of them has ever gone on murderous rampage and then experienced mass hallucinations group of other people for the next week or so and if there was no witch then what about the vanishing tree the snowfall of manuscript paper hm blair witch book of shadows was horrible movie from the poorlywritten characters the implausible story the plot inconsistencies the grossout shots it was bad effort through and through

i am giving this stinker normally the worst that would ever rate movie would be but the total waste of time that is blazing saddles is compounded the fact that this movie is incredibly offensive helped me come the big goose egg am not sure what the hell mel brooks was thinking when he made this thing or if he was even thinking at all maybe in mels little mind horse being knocked unconscious because of punch the face is funny in mine it is not or maybe mel graduated from the spike lee school of filmmaking because only the selfrighteous lee uses the nword more often in his films than brooks did in this one at least lee has the smarts realize that nobody is going find that term amusing brooks bandies it about like he figures the audience will be rolling in the aisles every time they hear it wrong mel would call you boob mel but that insults breasts everywhere this idiotic attempt at comedy centers on the evil lieutenant governors harvey korman attempts clear out town so he can buy up the land cheap and sell it the railroad he sends his goons run the townsfolk out but the town appeals the governor mel brooks in one of many uninspired and unfunny roles send them new sheriff protect them the governor pawns the task off kormans character hedley lamarr can tell you are rolling off your chairs right now just thinking of all the humor in that name lamarr decides send the town black sheriff gasp in the hopes that the town will be so disgusted at the prospect of black man living among them that they will all just leave hold on have got stop while these gales of laughter pass it is just too funny racism passing as humor gosh why did not anybody ever think of that one before oh wait think somebody might have they are called the kkk am not calling brooks racist but am calling him an insensitive bastard who would not know what was funny if it hit him over the head but digress anyway the black sheriff rides into town amid flurry of townsfolk using the nword golly will the hilarity just never end he ends up joining forces drunk gene wilder who happens be the former fastest gun in the west together they save the day from evil not one person in this movie gives decent performance wilder looks like he is recovering from head injury for most of the movie and korman looks embarrassed be part of the movie ok he really did not but he should have the films star cleavon little goes along the black jokes as if they were discussing the time of day did not laugh once during this whole sorry experience admit starting snicker on couple of occasions actually the end started look as if it was going have some promise but alas it ended up being as crappy as the rest of the movie can say full confidence that blazing saddles has no redeeming qualities whatsoever mel brooks would be doing the world favor if he burned every last copy of this

days in the valley is more or less pulp fiction knock off it basically involves how bunch of quirky characters in the los angeles area end up having their lives become intertwined in some very unusual ways am not going into much greater detail than that since it would take forever explain and quite frankly am not willing spend any more time on it than the hours that have already wasted while it tries very hard be pulp fiction days in the valley falls way short this is quite condemnation considering the cast includes danny aiello james spader and jeff daniels while the story is not much and the dialogue and characters rate only marginally better days in the valley does have couple of bright spots james spaders character while not much better than the rest is at least fun watch in sick sort of way and we do get see nice cat fight between uber babes teri hatcher and charlize theron in her first role you know movie is not that good when the highlight is brawl between two women even if they are both gorgeous will give the writers some credit for the fairly clever ways in they managed intersect the lives of this group of characters that would have otherwise never interacted but marveling at that ingenuity is far cry from actually enjoying the result while some of the characters and their respective stories are fairly interesting they inevitably are brought down as they intersect the other half of the characters that really cared absolutely nothing about if were put number on it only about half of the story and half the characters in this movie were particularly interesting or otherwise enjoyable watch this is the sort of movie that only huge fan of one or more of the cast members should rent and even then prepare for disappointment not even charlize theron being naked would get me sit through this movie again or at least not all of it anyway

and starring master is jawdroppingly horrible one no redeeming value socially cinematically or otherwise comedically it has some potential but only in its standup comedy moments can turn on comedy central for master stars as fifty dollah beat that as mobster think who is trying start comedy clubact his little brother foolish eddie griffin but the two of them have deal an angry mob boss played andrew dice clay for the very first time entertaining stubborn club owner and family problems the latter in foolish is perfect example of roger eberts idiot plot if everyone here was not an idiot there would be no problem so what does foolish have offer beside bunch of idiotic character names not hell of lot as have mentioned master cannot act or write he acts like the rapper that he is the occasional despair that his script requires him exhibit is excruciatingly forced as are his warm and fuzzy scenes his little bro as for his script well suppose he delivers what one would expect from musical artist no previous screenwriting experience if you have not yet figured it out that is not saying much costar eddie griffin really the star of the show is quite different story the fact of the matter is that griffin whose most significant screen outing date is probably the mildly successful tv show malcolm and eddie on the fledgling upn network is an extremely talented comedian standup and otherwise he has much in common chris tucker rush hour money talks in how quickly and effortlessly his speech flows from his lips he spouts profanity impressive dexterity the extent that can be done and while hope that does not become his trademark it works in few scenes in this movie and indeed laughed at few standup scenes here but from featurelength movie expect more foolish provided me no reason care for these characters every scene has any potential for dramatic impact is effectively diffused either stupid joke in scene where tension escalates between the two brothers foolish blurts out towards his jewelrysporting sibling you lay one hand on me and this cemetary is going be gold rush or something even more idiotic such as foolish smashing his own car said bit too loudly for the occasion huh after getting slightly upset his wife believe me when say that there is nothing in foolish that warrants parting your hardearned you will get more laughs from watching minutes of comedy central or any virtually any sitcom if you do not have cable eddie griffin fans may enjoy this derivative although offensive yarn but everyone else should stay the hell away

synopsis novelist struggling his latest work buys weird brain protruding eyeball encased in jar the brain exerts its evil influence upon the novelist and his secretary while his wife disapproves meanwhile loan shark in need of shave tries leave his profession comments why is this movie called possessed the night it is hard speculate most of this takes place during the day and the only thing possessing anyone is an icky pulsating bubbling brain thingie in jar in case you have not picked up on this yet possessed the night is bottomofthebarrel thriller use the term thriller loosely here is really cheap and bad the plot sounds like cheesy pulp science fiction story from the actually serves one purpose exploit nude women as often as possible writing movie review for like this proves oddly challenging there is really not much say the acting is lousy although occasionally the attempts at acting are so absurd that they garner chuckle or two from the audience most humorous is frank sivero who plays murray the novelists agent he is so horrible in this role that one cannot help but be amused the plot sucks nearly half the is devoted loser loan shark who wants out of the profession even though he has only limited relevance the movie as whole the dialogue stinks loan shark for instance tells another how much he loves bimbos is something the audience really does not need know everything about possessed the night is second rate even the credits as the names of the notsotalented crew scrolled at the end joseph scales came up credited as being assistsant foley artist someone could have used an editor be honest the is basically an excuse flash frontal nudity and show some sex scenes playboy playmate shannon tweed after all is the star here suppose that if one wanted this sort of thing he would like this movie why did give this turkey two stars and not one as bad movie it is unintentionally funny enough keep someone passingly interested in the if you feel possessed see possessed the night however would recommend you exorcise this impulse and watch something else

okay okay maybe was not in the mood watch mindless action movie am the same person that liked lethal weapon iii even while admitting that it was not as good as the others howewer the latest segal picture did not look that bad and since none of my friends would go see woody allen movie even if paid them went see it expecting mild die hard rehash boy was wrong in the first half of the movie we are already assaulted segals acting he is not simply wooden he is like wall gratuitous violence an incredible plot sexist and even more gratuitous nudity and bad lines that obviously were meant as jokes the end it is obvious that hundreds of navy men are no match for thirty armed special forces soldiers not once in the movie did segal appear worried or undecided did not do much for increasing the unexistent suspense of course in movies like these there must be sidekick and love interest in these one we are given two for one package in the form of playboy model in the movie only functions as supposed comic relief the way of extremely stupid unfunny lines and have watering eyes and look away every time something bad happens in the movie oh of course she appears naked from the waist up and of course segal kisses her at the end after no development of their relationship they did not even seem be interested in each other have never seen so little chemistry between two people in movie often the villain saves the movie unfortunately the villains here are cartoonish stupid and unfunny unmenacing how many movies have psycho exspecial forces bad guys too many was able predict the action all throughout the movie including the moment where the sidekick saves the hero from certain death the scene where the bad guy can kill the hero but proceeds explain his plan him the scene where we are shown the heros superiors are stupid the scene where the bad guy loses his gun and has fight the hero hand hand etc simply said this is moviemaking the numbers boring and potentially offensive in going for the lowest common denominator of the audience my recommendation if you go see it bring watch you will be looking at it for most of the movie my rent die hard read book stare at the sky do not waste your time on this worthless piece of celluloid the real sad thing is that there are lot of movies out that would rather have seen once again dragged in my friends the way liked the movie halfheartedly they probably like wrestling too

in life eddie murphy and martin lawrence play two young men wrongfully convicted of murder and sentenced life in prison after about an hour of watching this movie you begin realize how their characters feel fortunately for audience members there is chance escape the nearest exit this undoubtedly is eddie murphys worst movie and that is an accomplishment remember the golden child harlem nights compared life they look like citizen kane life is long predictable foulmouthed and only intermittently funny its minute running time feels like years robert ramsey and matthew stones script basically consist of murphy and lawrence referring everyone around them as motherf or s you lose count how many times both those obnoxious offensive words are used and if that all it takes write script than any illiterate jackass can sit at word processor and compose movie but like life it will probably stink be honest the screening audience surrounding me in the theater yucked it up but these were the same people who howled at all the flatulence and fat jokes as well life is as sophisticated as belch it is crude and stereotypical years ago movies stereotypically portrayed blacks subservient secondclass people good for being only maids and servants for the most part the lot of blacks and other racial groups have improved but new more insidious stereotype is creeping into movies in many recent films through actors such as murphy and chris tuckers blacks are presented as fasttalking conniving scam artists or hiphop guncrazy sexcrazed youths both sets of caricatures are demeaning and the fault does not rest the actors they have eat too it is the people who write the scripts the studios who greenlight the projects and the audiences who accept these portrayals without protest lifes only redeeming virtue is the artistry of makeup legend rick baker who flawlessly ages murphy and lawrence into year olds otherwise life is an embarrassment blot on the resumes of those associated it see it at your own risk

those of you who frequently read my reviews are not likely be surprised the fact that have not read victor hugos novel les miserables do not know if lot of people have though imagine many are familiar the popular musical based on the novel have not even seen that going into this had almost no knowledge of the story or its characters even expected the be musical walking away from it am kind of glad had no prior experience the material writerdirector bille augusts version is straightforward beautifully told liam neeson stars as the miserable jean valjean in the beginning he has just been released from year prison sentence he is allowed stay in convent kindly priest despite his rude and destructive behavior the priests words of wisdom influence him and he makes vow change himself nine years later we are informed that he is now the mayor of town called vigo nobody knows his real name and that he is wanted for skipping his parole nine years ago conflicts arise when inspector javert geoffrey rush is assigned vigo valjean remembers javert as one of the prison guards who constantly beat him and javert remembers jean be convict javert is hellbent on upholding the law and he does everything in his power bring jean justice along the way valjean meets and falls in love peasant woman fantine uma thurman and vows take care of her daughter cosette played later claire danes les miserables is visually solid and often striking picture the production design anna asp is authentic and vast and the sets do not look like sets they look like real towns and villages gabriella pescuccis costumes are noticeably spectacular basil poledouris soundtrack is thick and usually wellplaced though it does get bit heavy at times many scenes in the have memorable photographic quality such as the climax takes place next dark river in the grey obscurity of early evening augusts keeps the story simple hear is good thing since the novel is so complex and easy follow he manages develop the main characters and most of the subplots adequately was also impressed that he did not go overboard flash and style is something so many directors seem be doing classic stories these days such as baz luhrmanns vicious tragedy william shakespeares romeo juliet this feels solid and whole and each scene has certain amount of importance and vigor that keeps the audience interested liam neeson is terrific in the main role neeson is the kind of actor who does solemn desperation extremely well and valjean is certainly man who clearly fits that adjective thurman in her small role is very good and proves that she has lot of range and can perform in very nonglamorous role such as this one rush is absolutely incredible as javert do not remember ever feeling so strongly about villain as do here he adds depth and complexity subtle glances and nuances and effortlessly makes each of his scenes intense cannot be as charitable for danes however though know she is talented actress here she tends overact when it might have been better underplay the character bit les miserables is as have said solid intelligent motion picture my only complaint is that it feels bit too easy and perhaps too staged each scene is grand and huge and exploding poledouris score but did not always want them be for the most part les miserables is not subtle or deep picture it is good movie and tells its story well but august tends handfeed us themes and scenes that would have worked better had they been more subtle however in this exciting and wellproduced few minor flaws are easily overlooked

this is stagy adapted from roger rueffs play hospitality suite its about three travelling salesmen attending an industrial convention whose chicago company has sent them wichita where the company has paid all their expenses for them rent hospitality suite on the th floor of the hotel where they aim score substantial account from the big kahuna someone named dick fuller who is the head of big industrial corporation he is someone they have never met before but they want sell him industrial lubricants and they want desperately land this new account it is their only reason for coming the convention the big kahuna revels in salesmentalk among the three white christian males two of them larry spacey and phil devito who are veteran salesmen having teamed together for the last twelve years while bob facinelli is young man who has just recently been hired the firm and works in the research department these three are virtually imprisoned in their small hospitality suite waiting meet the big kahuna as the focus of this claustrophobic is on their interactions in the hospitality suite the three salesmen have different things on their mind that is troubling them and different attitude their job and they are each going through internal changes that are profoundly altering their life the outstanding cast tries figure out in their own way what they are doing and why what comes into question is their opinions on life and death on god and morality and on how they make living these are tough questions and the truth seems be somewhere in their sales pitch their dialogue is acerbic witty and analytical following in the long tradition of salesmen films from death of salesman the tin men and glengarry glen ross as this tries get you see what there is about salesmanship that gets these men high in this case it is landing the big kahuna they each are trying see why he is on top and why they are chasing after him what makes this different than the others is its blatant religious message comparing orthodox religion what they do as both must sell their product and how after each ones psyche is stripped clean the other there is pause and some lesson about life has sunk in that is pertinent each the goal in the movie is not in literally landing the big kahuna but in finding out what bill of goods they sold themselves that made them be salesmen larry and phil have one way of doing things and have no qualms of incorporating sales pitch as part of their life bob thinks he is above the fray and he pitches every chance he can get about his belief in jesus christ his vacuous character and smug outlook on life are covered disarming smile and an eagerness for him prove in his actions the words of jesus he literally believes in bob is baptist who takes very nonquestioning and literal attitude about religion just look at another woman and lust after her is sin according the way he reads the bible when asked larry why he married his wife he seems puzzled and cannot even say because he loves her only that marriage is something sacred him the contrast in their personalities is stark larry is all business he simply wants close the sale he comes into the room pumped for the convention using his attack mode establish how serious he is about being salesman he criticizes phil for being so placid for getting such small suite for having the cheap food tray of carrot sticks rather than the one of stuffed shrimp and for being burnedout he tells him go on vacation get woman while phil is reflective on where all his best years have gone for him and is contemplating career change now that he is and is painfully divorcing his wife after having lived too lonely life on the road for too long he now finds himself suffering from some troubling dreams and questioning what he believes in he has always been charmer shaking everyones hand trying please his clients while trying make the sale larry is more aggressive as salesman he is always heart attack away from every big sale in contrast bob is only in his twenties and everything seems fresh him this is his first time for him on the road when dick fuller does not arrive at the party the salesmen throw larry becomes confrontational and asks phil if he spoke the man himself about the gathering when told that he spoke the secretary larry throws tantrum and is resigned going back their home office without the new account but when they start talking bob whom they forced act as the bartender they are surprised learn that fuller did indeed come but was wearing another mans name tag and that bob spent the entire evening consoling the tycoon over his recently deceased dog and then talking him about jesus bob then tells the boys about private party fuller is attending afterwards and that he invited bob attend larry and phil cannot fathom how bob did not make sales pitch but they soon take another tact and decide prep bob on how get fullers attention about their companys product as they sent him off meet fuller and will await his return in the hotel room these two sharp salesmen are reduced waiting for this smug kid come back and tell them he saved their ass the irony of their situation is played out in the darkness of the hotel room as they stay up late into the night trying make sense out of their lives these three performers were outstanding each understanding what their role called for each coming through marvelous performance the only problem the is that its more of play than cinematic experience but the insightful dialogue and refreshing dramatics give it an intelligent selling point and make it good product see

the coen brothers are back again this time homers odyssey as the backdrop in their tale of three fugitives from mississippi chain gang who trek across the south find secret treasure in brother where art thou right for the beginning of brother the coens grab your attention chain gang of prison inmates breaking rocks along the road in unison work song the camera flows around the hard toiling men giving visually exciting symmetry the scene that ends our three heroes ulysses everett mcgill george clooney delmar tim blake nelson and pete john turturro escaping across cotton field it is the beginning of journey that takes on different meanings and urgencies each member of the trio strong suite as always the coen brothers is the depth of character of the folks they create in their films their characters are goofy and comical like nicolas cage in raising arizona or dramatic as albert finney and john turturro in millers crossing and even mix of the two frances mcdormand in fargo in all cases and in brother too the characters populating their films are threedimensional people ulysses everett is handsome hairobsessed petty criminal silver tongue and not lot in the brains department but he seems like genius when compared the simple sweet delmar and the maladjusted pete who follow their self appointed leader promised treasure of million their odyssey takes on the mystical proportions of homers original material as they meet all manner of people along the way including those dangerous sirens who beckon them onto symbolically rocky shoals and cyclops who beats them and takes all their money there is magic too when delmar believes that pete was turned into horny toad the sirens the story meanders through the different vignettes of the boys adventures giving the flick choppy episodic feel that disrupts the overall flow some of the interludes are an epiphany though the trio becomes quartet when they pick up guitarplaying tommy johnson chris thomas king and visit radio station in the middle of nowhere run its blind owner stephen root they become the soggy bottom boys for the sightless radio station man and without their knowledge are recorded as they sing the traditional tune am man of constant sorrow it is wonderful moment of moviemaking and gives us in my mind the best movie song of the year contrasting this and other wonderful moments the sexy seduction the sirens comes mind are some pretentious bits that detract from the overall quality of brother in particular near the end is scene where ulysses delmar and pete crash ku klux klan rally save tommy from being lynched the scene is overblown and flashy and reeks of the wizard of oz they do not say lions and tigers and bears oh my and there is no dorothy but it is the land of oz we are seeing here the highs and lows of the story flow are tempered fine acting on several levels george clooney is funny charming little dumb and one of the handsomest actors in the business today he has the charm of s movie idol and is able put himself into silly situations dignity ulysses has an ongoing obsession his hair risking life and limb get particular brand of pomade and supply of hairnets his vanity will come plague him as it would any mystical herowanderer while clooney is the name draw for brother the show stealer is tim blake nelson as delmar the heretofore unknown nelson is terrific as the simple convict who at one point hears the word of the lord and joins members of church congregation in their mass baptism delmar is saved and dedicates his life doing good and provides richness his simple character that makes him shine the taciturn pete as played longtime coen collaborator turturro is the sullen member of the trio and gives them the necessary angst all together the tuneful triumvirate is mix of the three stooges and the three musketeers as they prove be buffoons albeit brave ones the colorful supporting cast is rampant homerian characters meet and get know along the way of the boys odyssey charles durning appears as incumbent governor pappy odaniel who keeps crossing paths them in his bid for reelection john goodman is wicked as the oneeyed bible salesman and con artist big dan teague michael badalucco is manic and outrageous as outlaw and bank robber extraordinary george babyface nelson stephen root is amusing as the blind dj reping one of the many references the sightless that abound in the in mystical ways holly hunter is wasted in the small role as ulysses estranged wife penny and the real reason for this adventure not secret treasure techs are as expected in coen brothers venture first class cinematographer roger deakins who has worked on five previous coen films captures the sultry atmosphere of the south the photography complements the lush period production and costume provided dennis gassner and mary zophres respectively once again roderick jaynes the alter ego of ethan and joel coen is on board as editor the high points outweigh the low through most of brother where art thou particular praise for the wonderful selection of period and traditional music give it b

contact pg there is moment late in robert zemeckiss contact where was reminded of why started writing movie reviews in the first place we see scientist dressed in silvery space suit walking tentatively across narrow walkway leading inside compact spherical space pod unaware of what awaits when the ball literally drops anticipation excitement anxiety fearthe audience experiences it all the emotional tension right the character nervously breathlessly eager see what lies ahead it is this sense of discovery the anticipation of and its accompanying exhilaration that makes this adaptation of the carl sagan novel such magical captivating entertainment jodie foster stars as dr ellie arroway brilliant astronomer who dedicates her entire life searching outer space for extraterrestrial radio signals and mean lifeafter losing her entire family when she was young the only thing occupying ellies world is this quest discover life beyond this earth after dealing much skepticism on the part of government officials and wealthy financiers ellie receives her vindication when she stumbles upon an incoming radio transmission from the distant star vega includes instructions on building an interstellar transport from this synopsis contact does not sound too different most films about alien contact but there is whole lot more this intelligent than the scifi hook the alien contact angle generates great amount of suspense and awe but perhaps more than anything else contact is character study of ellie whose obsession empirical scientific evidence has erased all belief in higher power the irony is that while admitting having no religious faith she holds onto her belief in extraterrestrial life such passion and conviction that it becomes in sense religion in its own right it would be easy for scripters james hart and michael goldenberg in trying paint positive image of the heroine champion her scientific beliefs over religious ones but they wisely eschew easy answers giving equal time both sides and in so doing depict ellie as not completely sane in the end there is no right or wrong nor is there one side that comes off more positive in the other even slightly sothere are just two very viable points of view each their own merits each their own faults the complex role of ellie is an actresss dream and foster virtual shooin for yet another best actress oscar nomination next year more than rises the challenge she conveys intelligence determination warmth and in gutsy move always on edge we root for ellie and feel for her but we also feel at times that she goes too far contact is clearly fosters vehicle but others are given their chance shine in smaller roles matthew mcconaughey who receives outrageously high billing for his smallish role holds his own as the religious counterpoint ellie spiritual scholar and government adviser palmer joss however his main storyline the tentative palmerellie romance is the films weakest subplot john hurt is effectively creepy as r hadden the wealthy eccentric who provides ellie her research funding angela bassett continues impress in her bit role as white house aide rachel constantine most memorable of all though are tom skerritt and james woods who play rival scientist dr david drumlin and national security adviser michael litz respectively both especially skerritt embody these asshole characters that the audience hissed just about every single one of their appearances zemeckis comes off of his threeyear break in top shape always known as director of effectsladen extravaganzas it comes as no surprise that contacts visual effects are quite stunning the central space journey is more than little reminiscent of the close of space odyssey but more advanced technology at his disposal zemeckiss voyage is even trippier than stanley kubricks yet more wondrously pure and zemeckis does not resist the urge use the alwaysinteresting incorporateactorsintoexistingfilmfootage effect is every bit as seamless here as it was in forrest gump effects however are confined only few scenes and clearly take back seat the drama emotion and pure wonder zemeckis proved be quite adept at in gump it says lot that in summer science fiction such as this it is not so much the effects that stay you as it is the drama and the issues that are raised the thoughtprovoking twohourplus contact is muchwelcome change of pace from summer nobrainers but the fact that it is smart does not mean that it also is not entertaining for all the interesting questions it asks the is still what it is being sold as journey the heart of the universe and what fascinating unforgettable journey it is

satirical films usually fall into one of two categories longterm satire where everything including the jokes is somehow related on large scale e dr strangelove situation satire in the comedy and themes are derived moment moment and scene scene e men in black what is unique about wag the dog is that it does not necessarily fit either of these descriptions and yet is both at the same time the result is clever comedy based on an original smart premise even if the focus does tend wander bit if there is anything that affects americans the most it is politics and showbusiness in this age of information and technology we have been so conditioned the media and the entertainment industry in our ways of perceiving things it is gotten the point that we are practically controlled it we need the media bring us the most uptodate news but we also need the escapism of counter all that thinking this starts off well quickly establishing these ideas and then presents an interesting scenario if politics the media coverage of politics and the entertainment industry are so closely related could not someone the power and authority manipulate one of the aspects manipulate them all that is the idea conrad brean de niro professional washington spin doctor comes up in order restore the presidents good name who has been accused of child molestation just weeks before the election brean along the presidents top advisor winifred ames heche fly california meet up hotshot movie producer stanley motss hoffman they pitch him an idea produce the image of war albania it is country no ones heard of so they people will buy it soon the wheels are in motion and the films riffing satire comes into play we are inundated the mind set as motss brings in number of experts help manage the situation such as folk singer visual and sound effects technicians and modern style expert known as the fad king leary the initial atmosphere is rich numerous pop culture references where everything somehow relates something on tv in the movies or in the news the characters dialogue is witty and funny although some of the actual jokes and gags seem rather sitcomesque for example one scene shows motss and breans production crew filming an actress portraying poor albanian refugee motss ordered kitten for the girl carry but instead wound up dozen different dogs since it is all computerenhanced anyway she ends up cradling bag of tostitos the kitten be inserted later this demonstrates the films ability take relatively ordinary situation and make it smart and funny just through the premise but then there is the gags and oneliners that although are humorous seem little gratuitious in the long run such as motss not being able remember the actresss name or whenever problem emerges always responding this is nothing the time the makes it the midpoint everything that is going happen in terms of plot happens the first act is quickly paced while the second act contains most of the jokes and is the core of the every ten minutes or so new problem crops up that motss and brean must deal and it is always fascinating see what they do and how they do it the screenplay provides good characterization and actually deals most of the problems headon in realistic manners however it does have tendency avoid things and shift its focus from the election campaign and false war smokescreen something bit off the subject as the third act rolls around the satirical nature becomes more concerned the situations and less so the big picture what had started off as brilliant somewhat harmless conspiracy fool the general public begins seem more like something that would happen in movie still the situation comedy is quite funny especially montage showing the entire country flinging old shoes into trees honor sgt willie schumann war hero motss and brean concocted truly great satire manages create for an entertaining story that makes you laugh at the time but think about afterwards and wag the dog at least succeeds in this respect however in retrospect it seems like so much more could have been done namely extending the running time and filling in the plot holes then again it is valiant effort

after sixteen years francis ford copolla has again returned his favorite project making the third installment in the godfathertrilogy this new has been underrated for no reason it is as intellectual and majestically made as copollas pervious films it is also more psychological pessimistic and more tragic than the first two the only regret is the unconvincing performance the newcomer sofia copolla and some unfinished developments of some characters the elegantly begins nino rotas recognizable musical score the beautiful skyscrapers of new york and michaels voice as he is writing letter his children the only wealth in this world is children more than all money and power on earth you are my treasure the year is and michael corleone has used the time since the ending of part ii make his fathers dream come true making the corleone family legitimate michael sold all his casinos and invests only in gambling constantly haunted the past his only reason live is his children the family has amassed unimaginable wealth and as the opens michael corleone al pacino is being invested great honor the church later that day at reception his daughter announces corleone family gift the church and the charities of sicily check in the amount of million but the corleones are about find as others have throughout history that you cannot buy forgiveness sure you can do business evil men inside the church for all men are fallible and capable of sin but god does not take payoffs the plot of the movie concocted coppola and mario puzo in screenplay inspired headlines brings the corleone family into the inner circles of corruption in the vatican there is moment in godfather iii where michael says all my life have been trying go up in society where everything was legal but the higher go the crookier it becomes visually this is as spectacular as the first two gordon willis rich cinematography carmine copollas beautiful composition and alex tavoularis wonderful art direction could not be better but copollas first two godfatherfilms were more famous for their deep intellectual plots tree dimensional characters and incredible acting than for their visual perfection the third installment has only the plot and visuals some characters could be much more developed and the acting although good never accomplishes reach the same height of the first two films the biggest miscasting is sofia copolla who is so unconvincing and unemotional that she manages ruin several scenes throughout the movie that could have been grander and more emotional the best performance comes unsurprisingly from al pacino who should have got nomination for best actor at the oscars andy garcia is powerful as sonnys son strong focused and loyal violence is natural him he suffers no pangs of conscience when he takes revenge on his familys behalf and in this he is supposed be strong in the uncomplicated way don vito corleone was however both kay diane keaton and connie talia shire are useless and characters like vito corleone and tom hagen are really missed the good part is that michael is again reunited old friends that you remember from the first and second films in the third michael has become almost like his father vito in the first and vincenzo resembles michael when he was much younger this parallel could be more interesting if vincenzos character was more developed many have pointed out that making the third was unnecessary disagree it is beautiful of great importance completing the tragic saga of the corleone family the first showed some horrible results of corleones life it showed michael making choice the second showed man damning himself for his choices and feeling the impact of changing times man desperately trying keep his balance focus family and sanity while everything is crashing all around him the third is terrifying conclusion result of michaels life the life he chose for himself is like quicksand one wrong step and you are doomed there is no turning back and no matter how hard you try get out of it free yourself no matter how powerful and wealthy you are you are helpless sinking deeper and deeper till it swallows you completely the beautifully directed last sequence is also the powerful climax of the when michael is sitting alone in his chair left everyone surrounded emptiness and memories of his friends and family members long dead here he dies alone miserable and unforgiven
