bruce willis is typecasted actor in die hard he played john mcclaine rough and tough chicago cop who gets caught in the wrong place at the wrong time again in pulp fiction as butch coolidge an overthehill boxer he steps on the wrong guys toes in luc bessons the fifth element willis plays korben dallas new york cabby who takes in the wrong passenger at the worst possible time stylish science fiction epic the fifth elements complex plot begins right away in the deserts of egypt think stargate in an enormous spacecraft lands above pyramid where the elements are stored and takes them away vowing return them when the evil comes back cut present day is our future the year is and new york is the city the only basic differences between bessons futuristic depiction and the real life new york is that the smog is thicker the buildings are higher and the traffic floats anyway the evil comes back as ball of fire wreak havoc on the fair citizens of the earth so back come the tortoiselike aliens return the elements earth in order defend themselves against the evil in the process however the ship is intercepted fighter pods and is destroyed before landing when officials arrive at the site all that remains is hand what can you do hand hey its the st century heredna reconstruction this hand turns out belong beautiful but mysterious woman named leeloo milla jovovich dazed and confused she escapes and attempting escape the police swan diving off of an enormous skyscraper and crashing through the roof of korbens floating cab it is love at first site as korben and leeloo elude the lazyasalways cops when leeloo begins mumbling about cornelius ian holm night falls on manhattan korben searches the yellow pages and delivers her the door of the good reverend the only man who knows of her background and duties now korben leeloo and cornelius must journey foreign planet board cruise ship special effects were spectacular here find the remaining four elements it is here where they discover that they have been followed the evil jeanbaptiste emmanuel zorg gary oldman murder in the first he too wants possession of the elements as do group of piglike warriors think the gamorreans in return of the jedi in spectacular ending time running out leeloo is faced problemwhy should she save people who live destroy each other the question is good one and one that could be pondered but enough of that when korben points out his love for her leeloo is inclined become the th element and save the world from total destruction the fifth element features good performances willis and holm an excellent portrayal of comedic villain who reminded me lot of jack nicholsons the joker in batman one of the masters of villainy oldman and heartfelt offering relative newcomer jovovich the supporting cast includes brion james tango cash tim tiny lester no holds barred luke perry buffy the vampire slayer and chris tucker friday added comedic effect the although bessons the fifth element can be criticized for the outlandish use of cliches it is solid motion picture definite point some other directors like anacondas luis llosa should take lesson from this guyusing ideas from epic motion pictures the right way ideas from star wars and stargate were utilized for the improvement of this scifi fan or not any movielover should see this wonderfully stylish motion picture

there must be some unwritten rule that states one gets enlightenment not in the way one expects get enlightenment but in the commitment given seeking wisdom even if it is foolish road one is on and it seems be leading nowhere in the exotic morocco of yearold english hippie mother julia winslet of two sweet young girls the yearold lucy carrie and the yearold bea bella has arrived for years stay the selfabsorbed mother oblivious how her daughters might be adjusting this foreign experience while she is searching for change of life from her unfaithful poet husband she is not officially married him and her cold oneroom london flat and is sort of looking for the eternal truth in the sunny climate of marrakech at least she says she is as she is making some attempt contact sufi sheikh there who has all the answers she has not planned things out too carefully having no money and the trip does not seem like it is much fun more like misadventure some romance local moroccan thrown in drugs worldwide youthful phenomena during this period where many westerners came morocco smoke the good hashish found there and live the good life cheaply and be in spot where they did not have worry about being hassled the local authorities even though drugs are illegal there but this is not shown as one of her reasons for being here in this the subject of drugs is never broached only hinted at in an offhanded but slurring way as the hippie commune is shown in negative light strumming on their guitars and bragging about the hits of acid they have taken even the ones coming here for spiritual reasons follow the mystical sufis seem lost following culture that is far different from where they were coming from the is based on the novel that contained the autobiographical experiences of sigmund freuds granddaughter esther freud who traveled here in the her mother and sister it is written the directors brother who has previously directed regeneration the playboys and trojan eddie the title of the comes from the squealing giggles that saying hideous kinky gives the little girls julia strapped for cash and not receiving needed check her husband often forgets send her she is prevented from seeing the greatest living sufi who is located in algeria so instead she meets an acrobat street performer in the bazaar bilal said taghmaoui he becomes her lover taking the place of her husband as father figure for the girls the girls readily accept him and there is no bigtodo made about their openly sexual relationship but the girls really do not know what make of the relationship it especially bothers bea who is embarrassed her mothers loose attitude and wants go home things go surprisingly sour when bilal takes them stay in his small village it seems only that bilals charm is matched his shiftlessness as he has wife who still lives there this scene did not make too much sense as why he would take them there knowing the situation unless the uneducated man was totally uneducated in the customs of his people also but doubt that the family is now stuck without money in backward area trying decide what do next as they hitch ride away from there truck driver who nearly kills them when he falls asleep the wheel lucy takes it all in stride and has good disposition for travel while bea just wants go school and learn something and be normal girl the beauty of marrakech is matched the terrific performance of kate winslet as the accurately encapsulates the timeless city and its bustling street scenes expansive views illustrious mosques and grand sunsets kate enacts the feel of what it was like be westerner living out the countercultural experiences while awaiting gather her sensibilities again and was fortunate enough be able go home the better off for her experiences as many dropout reluctantly had do after their stay ran out of money and purpose the background music from groups like america and jefferson airplane provided further nostalgia for this easy look at and easy grasp the only hope was that the two innocent girls would not be permanently harmed while on this sojourn venture that should be reserved only for those of college age or older who choose go there for themselves the familys travel is on the edge has julia waking up screaming from dreams that are bleakly haunting but when she gets up all there is is this splendid emptiness all around her and vacuous life that is starting bother her that marrakech is disarmingly gorgeous and that london is old hat her is starting wear thin in her thoughts it will dawn on her when bea takes ill as she reflects on what the sufi guru tells her whom she finally meets and is driven tears in his presence he is the guru who replaced the one she wanted see but who died before she got chance see him the new guru is grounded in reality something she is not grounded in and seems tell her what she could not comprehend from anyone else even comforting her telling her that her tears are memories gift from god the films weakness was the empty feeling got from watching the story unfold in its risk free tenor she was there basically be just escaping from her situation and how unappealing the love affair seemed between bilal and julia the storyline about helpless single parent detracted from the vibrant experiences many others of her same babyboom generation had during their trip morocco who were taken in the mystical culture of sufism teaching that has lot offer its followers contrary the impression the might give seemed pass her her knowledge of that trip is only surface deep at best she perhaps would have been better off not taking the kids along smoking some hashish and have been less assured of herself but have behaved more like hippie and she would not have been so uptight all the time and had some fun on her journey after all the mystical trip is the journey the films strength is in how all the characters are shown for what they are and no one is that good or that bad or judged too harshly for their shortcomings bilal is unreliable but is capable of generosity the little girls are precocious but they are lovable julia the cornerstone the is built on is mother who cares about the children but does not know how take care of them without unintentionally harming them she was trying escape from reality and that returning london she has another chance see if she can find the key this world or whatever world she is looking for and should no longer have nightmares about where she is at this is very freudian way look at things as this sudden realization that things are not right puts an an end her eastern hippie odyssey at least for the time being and after all is said and done who is say if the children are also not better off for surviving their experiences just like she probably was

did claus von bulow try kill his wife sunny in their newport mansion that is the question reversal of fortune asks you consider as it opens in hospital ward comatose sunny von bulow she is the main narrator of the in narrative trick that was extraordinarily risky for schroeder the dramatic trick works as sunny von bulow narrates compelling story of murder sex unhappiness and lawyers moral dilemma as he takes case he thinks he cannot win jeremy irons is claus von bulow in what is his finest role and one of the most devastingly evil performances in history he is as hated as any man alive as cold as cucumber his remorse for his wifes comatose condition is nonexistant and it is no wonder that even his children have difficulty accepting his version of what happened during christmas the background the case is such during christmas of sunny von bulow fell into deep coma from she recovered and awoke the same situation occured in only sunny never woke and probably never will when examined it was found that she had times the normal amount of insulin within her blood claus von bulow is then accused of attempted murder his stepson convicted and freed on bail he immediately hires alan dershowitz the renowed harvard law professor acquit him ron silver is magnificent as moral lawyer who cannot stand what has happened him we follow him through two very different cases the case of the johnson case where two innocent kids are standing on death row for crime they did not commit and von bulow who he still has not figured out dershowitz does not know what happened sunny and he is extremely hesitant take the case nevertheless he does based on certain things happen during the investigative process that deeply upset him together group of law students dershowitz concocts defense and ultimately get the verdict reversed silvers performance is one of handful of solid roles in this deep schroeder directs on many different levels multiple plot lines blend in wonderfully in the mind of alan dershowitz there are flaws at times the gets overly theatrical yet due glenn closes troubled and brutally honest performance as sunny von bulow the use of her comatose body as narrator works here fairly well the flashbacks are good but at times schroeder does not fill in the blanks the movie could have benefited the increased attention of certain developments during the and it could have used better ending the progressed wonderfully before ending suddenly without any intelligent conclusion the supporting characters are often neglected and dershowitzs team should have been allowed grow character wise but schroeder oversimplifies the story and the characters yet for all these flaws the is deeply engrossing because of irons as von bulow he is brutally evil antisemitic prejudiced arrogant protective he is rotten lying monster whose conviction may have been wrong legally but morally he was blame irons plays him cold perfection pathetic attempts gain moral support for his claims innocence he is an adulterous liar and cheat who in all likelihood committed the murder however the genius of reversal of fortune comes in its distinction between moral culpability and legal responsibility there is no doubt von bulow is responsible for his wifes death years of neglect and coldness however legally did he do the murder schroeder dares the viewer make up his own mind all the character flaws reversal of fortune is an engrossing puzzle because it is intelligent he wants the viewer make up his own mind schroeder taunts the viewer contradictory revelations and then mentions that the answer this compelling puzzle shall be revealed when we join sunny von bulow in death for all the failed dramatic theatrics this is one that works beautifully we do not know what happened that sense of legal ambiguousness along von bulows obvious moral guilt is why reversalf fortune works in the end von bulow is as sadistic as ever irons is haunting and that is why reversal of fortune is so good

driving miss daisy takes its sweet time tell small intimate story it is quiet slow deliberate but if you are patient it the movie offers innumerable rewards such as pair of selfassured performances morgan freeman and jessica tandy driving miss daisy is based on alfred uhrys pulitzerprize winning play of the same name first opened in new york four years ago the play has garnered international acclaim productions in chicago los angeles london vienna norway and the soviet union uhry himself wrote the screenplay for the adaptation of driving miss daisy he also penned the wonderful sleeper mystic pizza the like the play is set in atlanta georgia and it revolves around two people in their twilight years cranky something jewish widow who feels guilty about her wealth and something black man who becomes her chauffeur the movie relies on character rather than plot propel the action in fact the movie has no discernible plot in the traditional sense it does not present linear story in all the scenes flow together rather driving miss daisy is made up of the routine activities of everyday life shopping listening the radio visiting the cemetery eating fried chicken and so on the also incorporates into the story line actual events in atlantas history including the bombing of the temple the citys oldest jewish congregation and ceremony honoring the reverend dr martin luther king jr the story begins in daisy tandy crashing and wrecking her packard as she pulls out of her driveway the insurance company cancels her insurance and her son boolie decides hire her chauffeur freeman reprising his role from the play plays the chauffeur hoke the chronicles the warm friendship that slowly but surely blossoms between the chauffeur and his reluctant passenger driving miss daisy is movie about human nature aging prejudice and great many other things but more than anything it is about relationship one that spans years cars the advent of civil rights and one gravely important cent can of salmon daisy is strongwilled and set in her ways and from the outset she is utterly opposed the idea of having chauffeur initially she treats hoke contempt refusing let him drive her anywhere once she does get in the car daisy is the ultimate backseat driver make matters worse she is extremely selfconscious about what others might think if they were see her being escorted around town hired hand eventually however daisy is worn down hokes goodnatured charm and infectious cheer she softens and opens up him tandy plays the part of daisy exceedingly well but unfortunately this feisty cantankerous character is just smidgen too commonplace we have seen this woman countless times before in other incarnations from on golden pond cocoon nevertheless tandy manages put enough of personal stamp on the familiar character make it her own freeman as hoke on the other hand gives the more distinctive of the two performances there is something profoundly moving about the way hoke maintains his pride and dignity in society forbids him from using public rest rooms because of his skin color hoke is uneducated and illiterate but freeman always suggests that there is something more this man an inner strength beneath the simpleton exterior both freeman and tandy seem be in their element in full command of their natural charisma they flirt the camera and dominate scenes without overtly calling attention themselves they bring light touch their humorous banter and the movies gentle humor at the same time tandy and freeman provide more than few moments of truly poignant drama in his first dramatic role dan aykroyd is surprisingly chubby and unexpectedly effective as boolie tandys loving and patient son drama seems agree aykroyd taking break from comedy seems like good move for the actor especially when you consider the wretched comedies he has made recently ghostbusters ii the great outdoors my stepmother is an alien the only other significant characters in the are daisys housekeeper idella marvelously played esther rolle good times and boolies pretentious wife played patti lupone under the direction of bruce beresford crimes of the heart tender mercies driving miss daisy seems bit stagey now and again but fortunately beresford never forgets he is shooting movie and accordingly he offers plenty of striking cinematic touches such as gorgeous shots of flowers trees and tomatoes in adapting driving miss daisy from the stage the screen the filmmakers have achieved delicate subtlety uhry understands that what his characters do not say can be just as important as what they do say beresford wisely exercises restraint in the films dramatic moments the movie tugs at your heart but it never goes for the jugular the only sap in driving miss daisy is in the trees

when people are talking about good old times they actually want make some bad times look better nice example of such behaviour is contemporary attitude of popular media towards the for new generations superseventies are the lost golden age of chic fashion cult tv shows and sexual freedom unchecked aids for people who actually had live in that period it was the gloomy decade marked lost ideals of rampant inflation and unemployment international terrorism fuel crisis and loss of faith in almost anything that previous generation stood for feelings of despair and nihilism found its reflections in many films of that era martin scorseses taxi driver symbolises both the glory and despair of the seventies is most celebrated of them all the movies protagonist is travis bickle robert de niro year old former marine who takes the job of taxi driver in new york city because he cannot sleep at nights the job gets him exposed the dark side of apocalyptic megalopolis and travis gradually gets alienated from the rest of world the only bright spot in his life is betsy cybil sheperd attractive woman working in senator palantines presidential campaign their date ends as humiliating fiasco because travis makes fatal mistake inviting her porno movie theatre losing his only link better side of the world travis gradually descends into psychosis becoming convinced that his mission in life is battle scum on the street he purchases formidable arsenal of guns and begins physical preparations for the inevitable conflict that conflict finally comes when he takes personal interest in iris jodie foster year old prostitute who temporarily took refuge in his taxi as many great movies that got cult status through the years taxi driver became the object of many interpretations for some critics and scholars it is an exploration of universal subjects that date back dostoyevski loss of moral compass in bleak reality of dirty overpopulated industrial cities the story could have been set in th century same as in our times for others the movie uses raskolnikovlike figure in order portray burning problems of america its apparent inability deal the consequences of rapid social changes that occurred in previous decade brilliant performance of robert de niro in role of lifetime can give arguments for both sides his travis bickle has lot in common most of the average viewers of today many of us share his feelings of isolation loneliness and outrage towards crime drugs prostitution and senseless street violence his pathetic attempts establish some kind of human connection the people around him sometimes in most unusual circumstances like secret service agents pimps or job interviewers make him person too goofy be the hero and too pathetic be the classic villain however most of the average viewers are sensible enough recognise the tin line that separate concerned citizens or troubled souls from fanatical madmen but despite anything average viewer at the end actually cheers for travis his crusade against scum is something that average person wants but does not have stomachlack of brains do it while de niros travis might come in and out of particular times and places other persons that appear in the mostly played the character actors give it distinctively feel wizzard played peter boyle presents the only link americas better past but only because he is the oldest taxi driver in company and therefore everybody assumes that he knows stuff his obvious inadequacy in giving advice troubled travis illustrates the inability of pres generations find answers the problems of gloomy decade other characters on the other hand show the bad side of new age matthew sport keitel who befriended reallife pimps in other prepare for his role of lifetime is dressed like hippie iris found excuse for her escape the world of drugs and child prostitution in ideology of counterculture porno movies that should be the element of new times of sexual freedom are too much even for supposedly liberated betsy even the politicians like senator palantine are lost in postvietnam and postwatergate mess his broad and senseless messages that cover the lack of any serious program cannot fool even such idiots like travis the past is gone the present is bad and even the future seems bleak and the feeling of pessimism cannot be washed away even ironic happy end travis and his world found themselves in desperate situation and martin scorsese uses the best of his cinematic skills in order spill the gloom of schraders screenplay into the silver screen new york city in the night is portrayed as hell on earth and the red light and steam coming out of sewers give it surreal almost stygian atmosphere another important element of the atmosphere is score of great bernard herrman whose efficient use of jazz elements gives some melancholy that softens the brutality of motion picture one of the greatest ironies of taxi driver is the fact that the movie was same as his protagonist famous for the wrong reason instead of receiving cult status because of his artistic merits for many years it was tabloidfodder because of hinckley and his reallife reenactment of events in the movie now more than two decades later when some other life imitating art incidents get more attention we can finally enjoy taxi driver in all its artistic glory

note ordinarily moviereviews org will not give away any critical plot points of that could be interpreted as spoilers however being that music of the heart is based on true story and that moviereviews org feels the can not be properly credited without such revelations plot giveaways will appear in the following review if this bothers you please note the star rating of the and stop reading now what does it take play carnegie hall practice it takes two hours for music of the heart play carnegie hall both figuratively and literally like the children it portrays the movie starts from the dark realms of awful cinema and works its way up showstopping performance at the legendary concert hall roberta guaspari academy award winner meryl streep has two kids husband who left her and violins she bought from small shop in the mediterranean her life desperately needs jump start and gets one when she meets man who introduces her job as music teacher at an east harlem elementary school she soon finds her job is on the rocks as the men in her life continue rotate through revolving doors that is the patternlike plot of this production ultimately the chooses zerosum answer these problems and finds her music career at an alltime high when the men in her life finally vanish the first hour of music of the heart is rather painful robertas character lacks development and consequently seems be flat also lacking depth is the films bad guy narrowminded music teacher josh pais who rejects roberta out of principle the movie never explains exactly principle that is and conveniently comes and goes from the plot according when it might be dramatic have villain around the next minutes of the are mediocre they are highlighted one childs return robertas class coming after the great old scene where he explains be cannot be around anymore because my mom said and glowing concert not knowing the running time you may expect the credits role at this point but they do not instead the uses the next minutes finish its journey from bad mediocre excellent director wes craven known for his works of horror uses some old sentimental tricks get the audience tearing one romantic break up scene is highlighted the classic but last night and robertas two children also have textbook conflicts their single mother regarding their fathers absence the city of harlem plays strong role in the movie robertas mother is initially reluctant see her daughter move that part of town and the does nothing combat that stereotype the noise tracks for these scenes are dominated sirens predictably one of robertas students is gunned down and killed off screen one thing the does lack is subtlety the fact that little boy was playing we shall overcome on his violin after the aforementioned shooting was cute and discreet reference the fact that the entire orchestra begins play it over and over soon after is an overdone reference that shows how little credit he gives the audience of course in horror films the foreshadowing and betweentheline moments are meant be overdone so perhaps he too is just learning play the game even all its flaws music of the heart is beautiful that is not an excuse for the movies poor beginning but as watched the scenes in carnegie hall thought of some of the great acts that have taken that stage in december of comedian named andy kaufman put on show that will forever be remembered as one of the most original in theatre history the performance included deadon elvis impression robin williams in disguise and moment at the end when kaufman announced he would take the whole audience out for milk and cookies so how did this comic genius choose open the show of his life he had character named tony clifton take the stage for the sole purpose of irritating and angering the audience perhaps it is okay for music of the heart start off rusty because just as kaufman had santas favorite food this movie has an amazing finale

seen april at m at crossgates cinema guilderland y theater myself for free using my hoyts critics pass theater rating very good seats sound and picture do you realize that every time you encounter new person you have just become part of story everyone has their own life story both past and present and every time two or more interact they become part of each others story not necessarily an important or even significant part but part nevertheless that seems be the basic theory behind go where several characters chance encounters all effect each other in extreme ways in order test this theory screenwriter john august and director doug liman assemble cast of characters that would not usually be the types have an entire revolve around them such as teenage supermarket cashier bottomofthedrugfoodchain dealer and two struggling soap opera actors these types of characters might not sound all that original but consider that they will all be somehow effected strip club bouncer and his psychotic father midlevel drug dealer narc obsessed multilevelmarketing horny wedding guests zen lovemaker two shrimpscarfers and cute normal teenage girl round things out how they will all come together is the process the deals would imagine the concept the started out as the creators testing themselves see if they could actually pull it off and the outcome is terrific achievement in filmmaking and the craft of fiction in general the starts out as anything else little indication of what is come we meet ronna polley depressed los angeles checkout girl who does not seem have much desire do anything except work just pay her rent she is not very charming especially her customers but this is played mostly for laughs rather than characterization and it works maybe this is because she is not very afeminite character but she is far from masculine creative character indeed things start progress when ronna reluctantly agrees take the hours of the goofy hyperactive yet likable simon askew an english teen into vices for the sake of the experiences this agreement starts threepronged storyline as it allows simon go las vegas for the weekend his friends and in turn drags ronna and her friends into buying and selling an experimental drug the process of will not only bring ronna close being arrested but also death nearly the same can be said for two other characters zack mohr and adam wolf who we do not think much of when they first appear as supporting characters but later will become major players the films makeup another process used the filmmakers elaborate on the theory of how significant insignificant interaction might be once the pace is picked up the really begins show its mettle when the title screen ronna is flashed shortly after the aforementioned turning point scene it is clear this is not going employ the standard linear method of storytelling considering how good it is up until that point it is long overdue change of pace needed in movies today and so the begins take shape first following ronna and her friends on onenight adventure that begins drug deal instigated zack and adam who were actually looking for simon does not exactly go as planned but that is what keeps it all so interesting the second storyline starts at the same moment as ronnas story but this time the camera chooses follow simon instead simon and his three friends head vegas for night on the town and in the process experience things they never would have imagined the third arc about zack and adam again overlaps ronnas story telling much of the same story but from completely different angle we are shown things we never would have expected were going on while following ronna and many of the events that do happen ronna because of zack and adam are not even their fault they just happened be where they were when they were would really like dissect each of the three storylines and especially how the wraps up in the end but that would take up too much time and space and spoil everything for those who have not seen the perhaps the greatest element the is its constant surprises and unpredictability and not due plot twists or confusing screenplay just through great filmmaking still can list and analyze nearly everything the does so well direction trying piece together such complex story is no easy task and for rookie filmmaker such as liman it is great accomplishment he does not just depict story he wraps us up in it all pulling us into the fray so that we experience every high and low screenplay besides being chiseled detail and creative in general it is clear the script has been inspired many sources both obvious and subtle references yet it never screams ripoff tonemood where other films have failed bring the charm of the independents the mainstream this one is able create its own sense of the macabre it is not overlydark or twisted and the comedy is not so satirical for it be considered black comedy more like macabre light cinematographyart direction able photograph both the intense and the lighthearted in the same manner characterization for nearly every character introduced no matter what role they play in the big picture we are able get sense of who they are what they are thinking and how they came be in their situations even when their actions are surprising it never seems very out of synch performances every actor nails their role see above themetheory the does not seem be concerned conveying any kind of political or social messages instead it is more of philosophical experiment in fact it might not have meant do that intentionally but there definitely is something existential it all and think that go is just big comedy and adventure see also the big lebowski clerks jackie brown pulp fiction true romance also liman swingers

mars attacks jack nicholson glenn close annette bening martin short danny devito rod steiger pierce brosnan sarah jessica parker michael fox jim brown pam grier joe don baker natalie portman christina applegate lisa marie tom jones this is director tim burtons finest date many will compare this tale of martians who invade earth independence day but even though the stories are similar they really are two distinctly different films however as whole mars attacks is much more entertaining than id and loved id you really have be in the right frame of mind enjoy this it is completely wackedout and unlike anything you have ever seen once the silly tone of the is set it is easy just sit back and throw logic out the window because logic and comedy just do not mix the plot is simple martians invade the earth but it is different than any other invasion usually it is the evil aliens versus the heroic humans this time however it is the goofy aliens versus the equally goofy humans the martians who are all computer generated are just about the funniest things have seen in long time they look funny they move funny and their language is hilarious and about the special effects the effects in mars attacks are just about the most flawless ones have seen date the computer animation of the martians combined the goofy personalities they are given makes them seem real there are just couple of scenes that do not work mainly those involving sarah jessica parker and pierce brosnan on board an alien ship also glenn close overacts tremendously in her thankfully very limited screen time so much so that actually applauded silently when her character meets her demise but there are many big laughs in the as said if you are in the right mood could it have been funnier certainly was it funny enough yes was entertained absolutely on personal note would like thank whomever cast rod steiger my favorite actor in the as warcrazy general decker finally after many very small parts in direct video garbage and minor tv roles steiger is back on the big screen in real movie that many people will see while he is not given the type of role that you can give real performance in he does the job well and has some good lines of dialogue the preview audience saw the really seemed enjoy him

when was asked see this movie friend my initial reaction was not hugh grant was perhaps wrong be so harsh but after his insidious flirtation street hooker just could not picture him in any romantic lead what makes this movie wonderful experience is not the fact it stars hugh but because it stars julia and carries it brilliantly written script this writer richard curtis whose exceptional first work four weddings and funeral shows us that he is master in the domain of the romantic comedy splashes of drama thrown in between hugh and his hair is almost identical the character that made him famous in four weddings he plays an ordinary guy who is down and out on his luck unfortunately he is type cast in this role but fortunately it works well for him in this movie if only he would dither little less julia knows this role well the glamorous movie star who is searching for true love there are moments in this movie that you almost weep for her pain felt loneliness how sad it must be be so wealthy and beautiful but have no one share it the writer deals difficult issues of love and social class on various levels how differences in social standing can make it almost impossible for love grow in such harsh environment how the media can be as cruel as it can be attentive and how fulfilment in life and love can be found in forgiveness and sacrifice

you would think it would be easy spoof star trek but try spoofing it without cruelly mocking it that is bit more difficult the farfetched scifi series is after all enormously popular what its gigantic fan base and ongoing installments both on television and in movies if you are not nice it you lose galaxy quest is star trek what mel brookss spaceballs was star wars an affectionate riotously funny parody that freely takes jabs at various elements of its subject but never seems meanspirited or malintentioned the show is been cancelled but the journey is far from over that is the current tagline of galaxy quest star trek type show that is no longer produced but lives on forever in reruns it also lives on in conventions gatherings of the show is obsessive fans who never fail dress in galaxy quest costumes and ask absurdly logical questions about its delirious technobabble jason nesmith tim allen played commander peter quincy taggart on the show and is the only one of the cast who still gets excited about the gigs they have do the attitudes of the rest tommy webber daryl mitchell gwen demarco sigourney weaver fred kwan tony shalhoub and alexander dane alan rickman range from indifference utter contempt dane who played spocklike alien is especially disgusted considering himself above his demeaning job and stubbornly refusing recite his characters cheesy trademark line grabthars hammer you shall be avenged or something like that for his diehard fans one day nesmith is greeted an especially fanatical group of galaxy quest followers they are actually aliens from planet known as thermia they have mistaken the galaxy quest episodes for historical documentation of actual heroic space travel the next day the thermians whisk nesmith away spaceship help them defeat the evil sarris named in one of the films only meanspirited gags after village voice critic andrew sarris nesmith thinks it is only an elaborate gig and sort of blows it off but when he is transported or should say shot back earth in rather celestial manner he believes next thing the cast knows they are being dragged nesmith this spaceship of course they all think he is out of his mind and once he does convince them that there really is spaceship what they want do is get out of there as fast as the transporters will take them but after some persuading they stay on fight the icky sarris and find way provide peaceful existance for the flailing thermians was quite surprised how well this comedy came off as utterly brainless from its marketing campaign worked taking shots at both the obvious and notsoobvious elements of star trek and its fandom galaxy quest never goes for cheap laughs opting instead for broad but smart parody nothing is safe not the cliches not the fans not the absurd taglines but on the other hand everything is safe since galaxy quest treats its subject utter respect and sometimes even subtle admiration the highlight of the movie is tony shalhoubs fred k tech sergeant chen who when in character is the complete opposite of scotty from the original star trek while scotty who was the technician for the enterprise would constantly yell need more power down here captain chens cry for help is more the tune of the core like will not take it or something it is hoot but it does not stop there weaver whose character has the menial task of repeating everything the computer says and rickman his relentlessly holierthanthou attitude are not far behind galaxy quest succeeds as funny parody of star trek and while it is not masterpiece it tends falter in its more serious moments it is immensely entertaining fluff and excellent counterprogramming all the sober oscar contenders being released this holiday season grabthars hammer this is hell of movie

in my review of there is something about mary said something the effect of laughter is not everything now need make brief addendum my postulate laughter is not everything unless am watching jim abrahams see spoofs are easy me love movies and love movies that make fun of movies that love sometimes am the only one in the theater laughing sometimes laugh so hard that embarass myself because my laugh is so highpitched in comparison my speaking voice it cuts right through everyone elses laughter sometimes laugh so much that my cheekbones are sore the end of the abrahams latest mafia induced this kind of hysteria upon me it is gotten some mediocre reviews but hey am the guy who laughs at everything there may be lot of jokes that flop in this but there are far more that work and laughed so frequently that the failed jokes usually occurred as was recovering from the previous bout of giddy madness enjoy films like this because not one second of it is serious or thoughtprovoking most lighweight films that pose as comedies try do other things like develop characters shape stories and other such nonsense mafia has no pretentions about characters or story and it exists for no other reason than make people laugh the begins on the perfect high note mockery of the opening of casino our hero jay mohr is seen walking from casino and getting into his car subsequently explodes and sends him flying through the air against backdrop of flowing fire describe the story of mafia is absurd and pointless but will mention that it basically follows the framework of the godfather films lot of casino references inserted throughout along the way the parodies seem arbitrary and rarely victimize mob films pictures like the english patient forrest gump and jaws undergo severe and hilarious bashing movies like this rely on just few things but the most important element is direction abrahams has been down this path many times before hot shots top secret airplane and any other an exclamation point in the title and so hold most of the success of mafia his experience he takes just the right attitude in each scene and manages wring at least bit laughter out of even the most oddly placed references one inexplicable moment seems like it wants make fun of titanic but it never develops the actors are all energetic helps lot the tone of the mohr suicide kings paulie who is quickly becoming one of my favorite actors is so good here he looks like he is having so much fun that he is containing his laughter in every scene watch his face in the sequence the swimming pool he is probably the only performer in the cast who manages urge laughter without the help of the material lloyd bridges does decent imitation of brandos godfather while pamela gidley is deadon in fullblown mockery of sharon stone the hard thing about writing reviews for comedies is that am supposed give examples of things and be specific unfortunately was so constantly blindsided laughter during mafia that cannot remember lot of what made me laugh but that is good sign mafia is so funny that was not even given time apply any of the scenes memory laughed so hard that it shut off my brain know that does not sound particularly complimentary but when watching dumb comedy like this the first thing want do is shut off my brain finally that does this for me

showgirls is the second major outing for the production team of pual verhoeven director and joe eszterhas writer their last effort basic instinct played like the most sumptuous of classic hitchcock dash of raw sex and sensuality that made it come across hit like curryspiced tabasco sauce dish not everyones taste but certainly wellcrafted movie possibly that movies greatest strength was that the most important events happened offstage prior the movie during the movie and after the movie and that after bringing all the plotlines together neatly it left the viewer full knowledge of what would happen in the characters future so there was no need it there was actually about four hours worth of screen story there but eszterhas found ways get it all onscreen in two leading his audience into analyzing what was really going on and still holding their interest clever misdirection and false trails the major elements that made basic instinct work so well are present in showgirls we have attractive sympathetic but still highly repellent characters we have shows for the eyes and the ears plotlines that play on several levels we have beautifully delineated characters who are drawn from life and very believable and we have story of an innocent who may not be so innocent who is trying play straight trying improve her station in life who slips into behaving the way those around her do but recovers flourish and quits winner in this sense the movie is bit of departure for verhoeven who is not known for treating his characters well but nomi the part played elizabeth berkley definitely opts out of the game in positive way and we are left feeling good about her future this is not one of the great movies but it is far better than we would been led expect all the negative prerelease publicity verhoeven got his first oscar nomination in and in the last quartercentury has pushed farther and farther experimenting the sociallyacceptable limits moviemaking his most recent three movies robocop total recall and basic instinct have been progression of backdoor access american culture moving from the fantastic through the merely psychotic the underlying basic drives and now he is exploring the sleeze this movie may be the first movie ever made for the directors contract contained specific provision that he would not have deliver an rated movie verhoeven had cut several parts of basic instinct get an rating although his original version is available on video many reviewers have taken the politicallycorrect stance that any movie uses naked ladies as scenery is bad thing but they miss the fact that this movie is not about naked ladies it is about people in an environment where naked ladies are common and why such an environment should exist it is about the scum who use other people as powertrip toys and the need escape their power it is about world where sex is nothing and normal human values do not pertain and the lack of sexual excitement and passionate heat in even the most blatant scenes is something of an accomplishment an nc movie is not sexually exciting says great deal about the phoniness and emptiness of social stratum where sex has been robbed of any kind of beauty power or value the one scene in the movie that could have been good sex scene berkley and maclachlan in swimming pool is not exciting because then we already know his character is callous manipulator if anything it is rape scene victim who is been duped into cooperation you do not make movie about the history of black people in america without using few black actors you do not make movie about world war ii without few guns going off and few people getting killed and you do not make movie about las vegas showgirls without showing few las vegas showgirls and in an awful lot of vegas shows an awful lot of ladies wear very little clothing this is legitimate portrayal of rather seamy side of the entertainment industry in town where sex is simply negotiable commodity showgirls deglamorizes the las vegas show and sex industries great effectiveness nomi is played in very good performance elizabeth berkley who gives us solid picture of woman limited talents who is at the end of her rope desperate live life better than the one she is known she has nothing market except her body and her limited dancing ability and is trying desperately not be hooker trying be something better than she seems destined be when nomi realizes she is gone too far for too little she catches herself just in time save the most essential part of who she wants be gina rivera plays molly dressmaker and costumer who befriends nomi providing her what may be the one solid positive relationship in nomis entire life molly is the one who makes the difference and provides the role model and framework nomi needs verify the value system she will be using for the rest of her life and nomis feelings for molly are the spur that forces nomis decision gina gershon plays cristal an aging but still very attractive starring dancer reflexively competitive manipulator who is become villainess internalizing the ethos of the crooks and scum around her gershon plays cristal as cross between ava gardner and raquel welch fading talent made bitter selfawareness her character is very well drawn and performed in major scene in hospital room she acknowledges what she is and in essence passes the torch nomi the relationship between the two of them is the most honest one in the movie and provides part of the impetus nomi needs follow different path it is no accident that the three important parts in this movie are women of different stripe molly is an honest hardworking person who means well and nearly dies because she confuses the glitter and the image reality cristal is talented dancer who is compromised her ideals and sold herself be cooperating part of the system exchanging selfrespect for the species of stardom that can be had in las vegas nomi believes she can make it without selling herself succumbs degree and then realizes she can make it without selling herself and does not need las vegas or its brand of stardom the male parts in this movie are simply props they exist only demonstrate and explicate the cultural milieu against showgirls exist kyle maclachlan whose single best previous work was as an inhumanly emotionless cop in the hidden gives us nicely reptilian bit of pond scum on two legs camouflaged as nice guy glenn plummer plays dancer who is working as bellboy and provides bit of alternate perspective plummers character is the only one in the movie who is maintaining an interest in dance as performing art but even he is succumbed the cult of manipulation plummers character is the closest thing sympathetic male character in the whole movie some of jost vacanos cinematography is fantastic and one particular delineation of nomis character alteration nodialog scene using nothing but color changes in the lighting is utterly terrifying this movie is rated nc due language sexual situations full frontal nudity violence and probably the costuming as well do not see way this particular story could have been told well without it and regard it as legitimate exercise in moviemaking but do not go see it if you are not in tough mood the only person it is possible like in this movie ends up in an c on life support and there is probably not one character in this movie you would enjoy meeting in person

it has been three long years since quentin tarantino stunned the cinema world claiming the cannes festivals palme dor millionplus box office gross and an oscar nomination all for his sophomore outing pulp fiction since then the talented maker has been virtually invisible surfacing briefly as codirector of the wildly uneven four rooms and the screenwriter of the gory vampirefest from dusk till dawn in between he has moonlighted as an actor several decidedly unmemorable performances now much fanfare and anticipation tarantino has returned his third directorial effort jackie brown and while this motion picture adapted from elmore leonards novel rum punch offers solid entertainment those expecting another bravura outing from tarantino will leave theaters disappointed for the most part jackie brown is pretty ordinary crime movie the story starts out slowly develops into twisty affair doublecrosses and triplecrosses and the movie is littered occasional tarantino trademarks witty dialogue unexpected gunfire pop tunes and closeups of womens bare feet yet for all of that the production is something of letdown the sheer inyourface exuberance that marked reservoir dogs and especially pulp fiction is absent the mostlystraightforward chronology of jackie brown does not match up favorably the nonlinear style of tarantinos previous efforts an approach that added tension and edginess the narratives and there are not nearly as many deliciously offbeat conversations this time around there is samuel jackson monologue about guns jacksonchris tucker argument regarding the merits of hiding in car trunk and jacksonrobert de niro exchange that recalls some of the jacksontravolta material from pulp fiction but that is about it jackie browns lone innovation is its presentation of crucial sequence from three different perspectives this is not exactly an original technique it has been done numerous times before most famously in akira kurosawas rashomon and most recently in edward zwicks courage under fire however while in those two movies and others there was legitimate plot reason for the multiple pointsof view tarantinos sole purpose for using it appears be because it is unconventional had the scenes in question been shown from only one of the three vantages nothing would have been lost as result this aspect of the is little more than curiosity for the second picture in row tarantino is attempting revive the career of s icon this time around instead of john travolta it is blaxploitation queen pam grier foxy brown has become jackie brown in one of many nods the most famous segment of griers career tarantino uses s song accompany her first appearance during the opening credits there are also several instances during jackie brown when the director offers sly wink towards certain conventions of the blaxploitation genre although grier never does any buttkicking grier is jackie brown flight attendant who gets caught transporting drugs and money into the united states she is working for gun dealer ordell robbie samuel jackson but she keeps her mouth shut under questioning despite pressure from ray nicolet michael keaton federal official no longer sure whether or not he can trust jackie ordell arranges for bail bondsman max cherry robert forster tvs banyon post the necessary then plans shoot jackie if she proves disloyal jackie passes ordells test however and soon the two of them are plotting way smuggle of ordells money into the united states without tipping off the feds soon just about everyone is after that money including jackie max ray ordells perpetually oversexed and druggedout girlfriend melanie bridget fonda and his righthand man louis robert de niro unsurprisingly the most memorable performance is turned in samuel jackson but ordell is not nearly as invigorating or compelling character as jules from pulp fiction in addition looking fantastic pam grier is also quite good although hers is not an oscar caliber performance although she might get nomination robert forster and michael keaton are solid in their toughguyswhorarely smile roles bridget fonda is around for three discernible reasons look sexy in bikini provide little twisted comedy and satisfy tarantinos foot fetish robert de niro is criminally underused in part that could have been played equally well any grungy looking middleaged actor the clocks in at several minutes over the twoanda half hour mark is probably too long for the material but the plot is convoluted enough keep us guessing throughout although the payoff is letdown tarantino keeps things moving along nicely heavier dose of humor and less violence than in pulp fiction but on the whole this movie seems more like the work of one of his wannabes than something from the director himself when it comes recent caper films like the grifters and bound jackie brown is secondtier effort it is an entertaining diversion but not masterpiece and certainly not an oscar contender

one of the biggest cliches of any serial killer is also one of the most believable you know the one where the detective looks at wall of pictures and other police information and suddenly spots the clue reveals who the killer is sure it is been used over and over but for some reason it is always fun watch this cliche pretty much describes the level kiss the girls works on overused but always fun one of my personal rules about watching is not how original the is but how it goes around giving its story this rule applies highly kiss the girls there is something psychologically stimulating in wellcrafted serial killer movie and kiss the girls is certainly well made however the whole screams of unoriginality and so it relies on the power of its actors and the technical detail pull it through well not only are the actors capable of pulling it through but they add so much the that nearly every flaw is covered up unfortunately one of the most revealing and rather insulting choices the filmmakers one that seven lot like this one knew not make was put the name of the killer in the opening credits that may give the actor credit for the role but throughout the hidden in my mind was waiting for him appear on screen spoiled the mystery however credit must be given the director for suspending this knowledge through most of the plotwise kiss the girls shows almost no originality we are introduced detective alex cross morgan freeman forensic psychologist and immediately we are given the cliched scene establishing him as the hero he gets call about woman who has shot her husband and is now threatening kill herself obviously cross succeeds at getting the gun but this scene is quickly forgotten during the next scene at his house cross is told that his neice naomi gina ravera has been missing for four days this provides the motivation for cross find the killer but we are never given chance establish the relationship between the two and as result we cannot sympathize detective cross however what makes kiss the girls slightly original is the introduction of one of the abductees before she is abducted dr kate mctiernan ashley judd the actress of the judd family is smart athletic woman and because of these traits becomes target for casanovawhat the serial killer likes call himself because of these characterdeveloping scenes we care for mctiernan making the abduction scene all that more suspenseful after being abducted mctiernan wakes up and finds herself in cell somewhere in the woods remembering that the killer gave her certain rules she decides break one of them calling out when casanova comes punish her she breaks out and escapes jumping over waterfall after she is found she begins help cross find his neice from this moment on kiss the girls takes on the form of every other serial killer as the two leads search for the rest of the victims held captive many people will compare this seven another killer starring morgan freeman but presume that the similarities are intentional the screenplay david klass is adapted from the novel written james patterson and yet do not quite see how this story could have worked in novel form what makes kiss the girls so good is the acting and the technical and visual impressiveness the cinematography aaron schneider is reminiscient of seven and sometimes felt that many of the shots were trying too hard impress us sometimes simple shot is the best one however many of the shots are stunning and unlike seven most of them take place during the day in sunlight the scene when ashley judd is running through the forest is extremely well done in more than one way the camera work is terrific but the editing makes this scene work so well the chaotic and mtvtype cutting gives the audience sense of confusion and unawareness exactly what judds character is experiencing however the best aspect of kiss the girls is its actors morgan freeman is one of todays most powerful and believable actors detective cross is very good character for him although it is just similar one the character in seven because of freemans powerful presence he carries half the himself the other half is carried ashley judd one of todays most promising dramatic actresses in fact her performance is better than freemans if that is even possible her character is more original than freemans and she handles it wonderfully we finally have female character in movie like this who does more than just scream the supporting cast is highly underdeveloped but the cast members do as much as they can it cary elwes portrays cop in north carolina and unfortunately has scraps for character tony goldwyn fairs slightly better but we do not really get know his character either gina ravera gives good performance but again she is not in many of the scenes so as result of all these small supporting parts the weight of the lies on the two leads and they do phenomenal job some of the best acting of this genre and some of the best acting of the year two other essential aspects of the are quite good director gary fleder does good job of controlling his actors but the second half of the loses believability especially during the revelation of the killer he also does not handle the suspenseful scenes as better director would have losing lot of tension during many scenes however his credit he does manage terrific first half part of the blame falls on david klass am sure the book developed many of the lesser characters more but klass focuses on the two main parts while this may give the two leads more screentime many of the small characters are onedimensional and the killer when revealed is extremely implausible thanks the smart dialogue adapted from the novel kiss the girls always seems intelligent none of the conversations are laughable and all move the plot forward without seeming forced one of the biggest problems had the movie was the motive of the killer blame this mainly on the casting director because the killers motive is because of rejection from women or so assume from the opening monologue but the killer himself is very attractive one of my friends is shall we say big admirer of the killer kiss the girls is rated for terror violence language and suggested sex all the implausibilities of this and the mediocre second half kiss the girls somehow manages thoroughly entertain in fact had the urge see it again just for the performances the cinematography adds lot of mood the already creepy tone and the script is usually smart this is clearly one of those movies rely on the acting pull it through morgan freeman is possibly todays most convincing actor and ashley judd adds another notch on her acting belt must also say that loved the ending the showdown between good and evil was quite tense and the resolution of the scene makes almost anyone cheer perhaps it may not be possible but most of the is not anyway

i was originally going give the spanish prisoner two and half stars from my first viewing noticed that david mamets was intense and clever at times but boring and cliched at other times especially at the beginning from my second viewing however noticed that mamets script was actually masterpiece the spanish prisoner like the usual suspects or chinatown begs for the viewers complete attention miss scene or even small detail and you could miss the meaning of the entire also like the aforementioned films it rewards its viewer for paying attention delivering surprising and memorable ending mamet is success doing again what he once tackled in when he wrote and directed house of games like his past gem the spanish prisoner fools the audience as much or even more than the victim because we were deceived just like the victim we feel strong attachment the main character and consequently are more interested in the mamet has the talent of not completely ending gift wrapped but rather leaving some ambiguity towards the end the power that he has in forcing the viewer determine who the good guys and bad guys are once the is over without giving right answer is unique and ingenious the spanish prisoner will leave you seriously puzzled and intrigued after seeing the again noticed that the details mamet uses are so incredibly accurate it is frightening his direction is very subtle as he leaves so many clues explaining what is going on and who is who but it is still very difficult tell what exactly is happening even if you see all of them or think you see all of them the story follows young up and coming businessman joe ross campbell scott who has just created mysterious and lucrative process that everyone is trying get their hands on soon ross does not know who he can trust or who is after his process through his journey ross meets number of mysterious characters the rich and popular jimmy dell secretary who has huge crush on ross and ross boss mr klein played steve martin rebecca pidgeon and ben gazarra respectively the supporting cast is very solid especially martin who deserved an oscar nomination for his commanding and manipulative role the most interesting character in the though was campbell scotts joe ross the characters transformation from an ingenuous and polite rookie paranoid veteran is very apparent and justifiable david mamets script is so interesting because we know people do not actually talk like the characters in the yet we feel so connected some of them his beguiling style could fool any viewer up for the challenge this is must see for those interested in solving complex puzzle of movie

an unhappy italian housewife lonely waiter goofy masseuse lots of love and gorgeous scenery all come together in bread and tulips proves charming despite its covering of predictable wellworn material the story concerns the aforementioned housewife rosalba barletta licia maglietta who accidentally becomes separated from her immediate family while on vacation instead of waiting for ride home rosalba opts not go home her italian town but instead hitchhike venice upon arriving she tells her selfcentered husband mimmo an excellent antonio catania that she will be home in few days of course that does not happen as rosalba quickly gains level of independence that has been unattainable in her past life of scrubbing floors and buying groceries in what seems like days she moves in lonely suicidal waiter fernando bruno ganz gets job as florist learns the accordion and befriends her neighbor wacky holistic masseuse named grazia marina massironi rosalba who is first seen wearing gaudy stretch pants outfit starts wearing sexy dresses and getting closer fernando can think of at least five other american movies including fried green tomatoes and an unmarried woman that are more than similar bread and tulips but maglietta and ganz who act restraint and care help bread and tulips from becoming tired retread ganz plays the suicidal waiter role solemn sometimes playful dignity that is joy watch while maglietta never overreacts her growing comfort the outside world throughout the movie maglietta has an easygoing confident demeanor makes it very easy root for her and her growing attraction for ganzs character the gorgeous scenery of moonlit town squares and sparkling rivers provides perfect love story backdrop you just might want ask the attractive stranger in the seat behind you for coffee after the lights come up director and cowriter silvio soldini must get credit for sprinkling the movie effective goofy humor the cheap mimmo desperate find his wife after all he needs his shirts ironed and his mistress will not do it hires job applicant giuseppe battiston at his bathroom supply firm do the job the reason mimmo discovers that the prospective plumber loves detective stories the novice detectives various misfortunes including him saying goodbye his weepy mother are very funny unfortunately there are flaws that somewhat spoil bread and tulips cheery tone rosalba is bothered several surreal dreams during her time in venice bring the movie halt it is like putting gunfight in nora ephron movie several details in fernandos life also never get proper closure including his suicidal tendencies early in the movie he nearly hangs himself before rosalba knocks on his apartment door after that fernandos step towards death is never made reference probably because soldini wanted include lukewarm underdeveloped subplot about fernandos stormy past it seems more like desperate attempt pump up the drama in plot that does not need any but there are not lot of overwhelming negatives in bread and tulips the movie is fun and romantic beautiful scenery and characters whose lives we would like live if we had the nerve or if our passports were not missing

after the terminally bleak reservoir dogs and the brutally violent pulp fiction jackie brown seems like something of lighthearted departure for quentin tarantino it is more of hohum heist story characters that speak the tarantino language luckily his showcase of actors convert every morsel of possible enjoyment onto the screen and jackie brown has no trouble entertaining the average viewer the story introduces us streetwise black woman named jackie brown pam grier flight attendant who smuggles money and drugs from one destination another she works for bottomofthebarrel airline and receives minimal salary but one day she is picked up pair of federal officials including michael keaton as the toughnosed ray nicolet and found handsome load of cash and small bag of smuggled dope jackie is working for weapons dealer named ordell samuel jackson who pays her bail money but suspects her of tipping off the feds about their operation soon jackie and ordell are plotting way smuggle through them under nicolet us nose the help of ordells oaf of partner robert de niro and druggedout lady friend bridget fonda also entering the picture is bailbondsman named max cherry robert forster who takes liking jackie and agrees at one point make the situation even more complicated how will not say the big dropoff is undoubtedly the high point of jackie brown in numerous doublecrosses take place and many clothing store bags filled cash switch hands it is unfortunate that tarantino takes his sweet time getting there and does not offer anything extremely compelling while doing so there are as always amusing exchanges between characters the funniest repartee is between de niro and fonda as he becomes annoyed her constant bickering while making fun of his iq or lack thereof the most interesting relationship is between max and jackie year old white bail bondsman and year old black flight attendant believable chemistry you have got commend the acting jackie brown is seriously draggedout exercise enlivened such fine acting the clocks in at lengthy hours minutes tarantinos talky style manages hold your attention heavily but there are more than few dramatic lapses and crucial lulls in the storyline also fans of the director should be prepared for lighter side appear jackie brown has four major shootings and two of those take place mostly offscreen so do not be expecting typical tarantino bloodbath you can expect frequent foul language mostly coming way of ordell who much the dismay of spike lee uses the n word as part of his regular vocabulary the acting is the glue that holds everything together grier making sudden comeback from her reign in the is more than adequate for the title character in fact she is flatout great another comeback comes from former tv star robert forster who does grand job as max cherry and is perfectly cast in doing so michael keaton makes his presence felt albeit in small but dignified moments and de niro is ideal in playing the lughead who goes over the edge speaking of that bridget fonda has relatively little do as ordells bikiniclad beach babe and yet she manages look fairly occupied there is not single sign of misplaced dialogue or snubbed line throughout the entire movie is lifesaver for mr tarantino the story barely holds together in the meantime and we merely get small tremor whenever there should be defeaning earthquake but oh well jackie brown manages be an enjoyable detour from quentin tarantino even if it is lacking the glaring and original bite of his previous work let us just hope that the director has not gone soft on us

upon taking seat at the theater and surveying the crowd soon realized that was the only person under forty in the premises am twentytwo but have been accused of looking sixteen yet as the began any consciousness of setting shifted the home of five closeknit yet troubled sisters director pat oconnor inventing the abbots circle of friends weaves quiet yet affecting tale of loss need and the bonds between five sisters the family is ruled kate meryl streep an unconsciously strict schoolteacher who is completely conscious of the deterioration of her family there is very little background given the viewer as we are thrust into tense but loving home squabbles take place one after the other caused years and years of history perhaps one of the best things about this is its naturalness no situation is overwrought and characters react as real people do real problems this probably is result of the being from stage play the play was in turn is based on time in the life of the playwright what seems be an underlying theme are the pagan rituals and dances of peoples both in lughnasa and africa in fact dance seems be the glue that holds the family together and most expressively shows their closeness legs tap and bodies sway even in the midst of impending disaster only after the music stops and the characters stand breathing heavily do we sense any trouble in the quiet after the music we muse that it is sad that music has cease and families falter the movie is framed scene of michael mundy the narrator of the movie as young child flying kite he trips over bump and loses hold of his string and the kite floats off farther into the distance drawn on the white diamond of the kite is face that looks at once pained and at another glance mischievous the mundy family itself follows similar fate that of the kite and kates hold of the family is not strong enough hold off the winds of change as michael stands staring at his kite fly away we hear the adult michael looking back at the season that his world changed forever the movie is not overpowering but it gives us beautiful window into the life love and trouble of household of lonely women note this is the first movie review have ever written any responses on it would be greatly appreciated

in may of just years after steven spielbergs success jaws and years after francis coppolas the godfather risky ambitious young director named george lucas went for the same unpredictable box office success little did he know that star wars would become the greatest science fiction epic in the history of in january of this year lucas rereleased star wars on its th anniversary in this new remastered version the added effects range from leathery desert beasts inserted into already existing shots an awkward new scene in hans solo bargains his way out of jam computergenerated jabba the hutt do not do much but call attention themselves other than these the is exactly the same why pay see it in the theaters you might ask simply because when this movie was released most of us were few years short of being born we should all get up and go the movies for the experience especially if you have not seen it the plot is basic but in the same way complex it has many themes but the one rotates around luke skywalker mark hamill and his quest become jedi knight his mission begins when droid named rd plays back secret message recorded the beautiful princess leia carrie fisher tells him contact the mysterious obiwan kanoby alec guiness he and kanoby then joined two intergalactic renegades hans solo harrison ford and chewbacca and skywalkers two droids and cpo the voice of anthony edwards wage war upon the corrupt empire commanded an evil general peter cushing and the traitorous darth vader the voice of james earl jones skywalker defeats the evil empire rising out of himself embrace something larger the force the is obviously quite starstudded but how was lucas know that ford would become one of the most sought after men in and jones voice would appear so many more times in the future it just happened work out for him the magic of star wars lies in the way that skywalkers triumph is symbolized the audiences sense of becoming something larger than life itselfa universe of fans young and old recreating movie atmosphere that will impress generations forever

strange days chronicles the last two days of in los angeles as the locals gear up for the new millenium lenny nero ralph fiennes goes about his business of peddling erotic memory clips he pines for his exgirlfriend faith juliette lewis not noticing that another friend mace angela bassett really cares for him this features good performances impressive filmmaking technique and breathtaking crowd scenes director kathryn bigelow knows her stuff and does not hesitate use it but as whole this is an unsatisfying movie the problem is that the writers james cameron and jay cocks were too ambitious aiming for social relevance thrills and drama not that ambitious filmmaking should be discouraged just that when it fails achieve its goals it fails badly and obviously the just ends up preachy unexciting and uninvolving

there is thin line between satire and controversy and mike nichols the birdcage wolf has directed sharp and very honest look at us presidential election based on the book written anonymous actually former newsweek writer joe klein john travolta plays governor jack stanton but he does not actually play stanton he plays bill clinton just the same as emma thompson no doubt plays the first lady and billy bob thorton is the campaign manipulator james carville although the credits will of course say otherwise the is taken from the perspective of henry burton adrian lester morally correct and somewhat hesitant new advisor stanton he searches for justice and dignity in the ugliest possible situations and whether it be keeping the history of his boss pants under wraps or contemplating digging up dirt on another politician he approaches his work keen desire skillfully serve his country and his fellow workers richard jemmons billy bob thorton and daisy green maura tierney team up henry as the wouldbe presidents advisors and hire lesbian veteran libby holden kathy bates as the campaigns eccentric tougher than dirt incriminator together they face all sorts of sexual allegations the irritatingly discourteous media and other witty politicians in the election race in its satire and controversy primary colors is similar wag the dog they both are not afraid wipe their noses in the nittygritty and take bold look at something that will never has honesty as virtue but whereas wag showed us how much affect few people can have on the media primary colors is much more concerned
