fleshing out it is characters letting us understand what they want and why and making us truly appreciate the humanity and rectitude that they graciously represent seeing john travolta play bill clinton so confidently and justly is enough make the more than worth look and the rest of the cast also make superb performances adrian lester sharply portrays the intellect of henry whilst kathy bates is perfect as the robust and energetic libby holden at occasions you cannot help but feel that these terrific characters are going waste there are long slabs of time where john travolta unquestionably the most interesting watch is missed from the screen and since it is awkwardly structured as henrys story we are often forced watch scenes that perhaps are not so necessary the central plot or even the point of the having said that make no mistake primary colors is always enjoyable watch but frequently we have ask ourselves exactly what are we watching most of the first half of its duration is lightheaded look at melodramatic confrontations that seem so genuine we cannot help but laugh but the way primary colors chooses finish tackles aspects that are very contrary and almost unsuitable the rest of the but as mentioned before there is thin line between satire and controversy and for the most part primary colors delivers an entertaining indulgence of political matters combined farfromoverpowering look at winning the publics opinion although at occasions the may jump around little too freely focus is never lost on how important and vulnerable the subject matter really is thankfully it is clear make the distinction on what is entertaining movie cosmetics and what is provocative documentation of something so really it is scary

it was only matter of time before dilbertesque office comedy hit the screens however rather than coming from dilbert creator scott adams office space is instead based on the work of another animator mike judge creator of beavis and butthead and king of the hill in his liveaction directoral debut judge aptly spoofs corporate culture the story is certainly not very involved but there is plenty of truth and humor fill the gaps peter ron livingston is programmer working at the initech corporation every day in his mundane life is worse than the one before in other words every day is the worst day in his entire life he is stuck in boring job eight different supervisors all obsessed administrative trivialities he is smitten joanna jennifer aniston local waitress but has not the guts even introduce himself everything has simply made him complete nervous wreck but all of that changes when after an unintentionally overeffective visit hypnotherapist peter loses all of his inhibitions he realizes his lifelong dream do absolutely nothing he begins blatantly disregard the nonsensical instructions of his boss bill lumbergh gary cole doing whatever he feels like peters friends and coworkers samir ajay naidu and michael bolton david herman no not that michael bolton are perplexed their friends sudden change in attitude but they have larger things worry about rumors about that initech is about begin downsizing as bleak as much of this sounds let me assure you that office space is comedy and quite funny one although it shares the same absurdist office humor of the dilbert comic strip office space is actually based loosely on the series of milton cartoons aired on saturday night life each mundane detail taken itself seems completely regrettably plausible yet when combined into whole the picture results is absolutely surreal ron livingston tackles his role straightfaced and becomes much funnier because of it his character is not simply being clown lampooning around the office but rather seems possessed zenlike clarity he is operating on higher plane where everything suddenly makes sense and from this vantage point he allows the audience smirk at the absurdities of life anyone who has had deal the inefficiencies of corporate bureaucracy or who has ever been frustrated the technology of modern life will recognize many of the characters and situations in the in fact in addition being wildly humorous the may actually prove be cathartic the animated roots of office space show in the films lack of complexity most of the characters in the can be quickly summarized particular personality quirk one employee milton stephen root is practically fleshandblood cartoon however despite their simple nature the characters still manage be surprisingly funny it is not required have corporate background enjoy this though the situations may seem exceedingly farfetched if you are unfamiliar just how close reality they really are the is flimsy and absurd but also very funny

all those who were offended there is something about mary should not tread in the waters of american pie gratuitously sexual rollercoaster ride of raunch and while this uproariously funny grossout summer movie is basically an exercise in bad taste it also demonstrates surprising sweetness in the end american pie is the latest entry the offensive teenagetargeted fare this season must question the studio that releases movie like this the producers are aiming these films at the crowd but while pushing the limit of possible sex and violence in an rrated some have even been narrowly avoiding the dreaded nc rating the mpaa gives when the adult content surpasses even that of restricted movie american pie was threatened an nc but after snipping few scenes from the finished product it was given an but at least this new addition is not as careless and unforgiving as something like south park it is sick perverse and ultimately disgusting not mention extremely funny american pie is about four desperate teenagers who make pact lose their virginity prom night jim jason biggs kevin thomas ian nicholas oz chris klein and finch eddie kaye thomas are quartet of high school students in their senior year who think sex is something they must experience be successful in their lives ahead jim inquires what it feels like when you reach third base one of his friends replies like warm apple pie of course this prompts the scene unfairly exposed in the trailers in jim and freshly baked pie have very intimate moment in the kitchen corner there are many moments such as this in director paul weitz uses gameplan similar the one frequently displayed in mary cause the audience break down laughing in disgusting disbelief american pie is hardfought effort that has replenishing rewards if you manage stick it loved the young cast in this movie consider the subject matter that these actors have dealt obviously suggestiveness never rivaled in any of their previous projects and you should appreciate their performances biggs is more than enjoyable and chris klein who recently played similar jock in election is obviously young talent on the rise but in teendominated movie the best performance comes from comedian eugene levy of televisions sctv who is unexpectedly brilliant as jims uneasy father scenes in the familiar fatherson conversations are brought interesting new levels are the funniest moments be found in american pie after levy discovers jims new use for apple pie he tells him i did fare share of that sort of thing when was your age but never used baked goods it is performances such as his and bill murrays in rushmore that are often unfairly dismissed when awards are handed out there are some lessthanoriginal aspects of the bathroom incident involving finch and bottle of exlax is something we have seen before if weitz is planning take after the farrelly brothers then this is decidedly unwise move the same prank was pulled in the brothers dumb and dumber and used greater effect secondly the characters are forced into halfhearted climax that seems more artificial than amusing but at one point in we discover that american pie does have heart of it is own biggs asks his buddies why he is going through so much pressure for something that is not very important anyway and so we realize that while the is expressive about subject that is hardly appropriate it still manages be mature in it is own way

albert brooks saves the day just in the nick of time very poor summer for movies brooks is just what audiences were looking for cheer them up and does so in positive way while this may not be his finest work the muse still shakes up some delightful humor in albert brooks latest comedy he tells story of troubled screenwriter brooks who is losing his edge as his business partners say in desperation he goes see his friend jack jeff bridges who has been very successful screenwriter in the past he asks jack for some help and recieves word of real life muse that has helped him and many other directors throughout their career so brooks seeks the muse named sarah sharon stone and is suckered into buying her expensive food etc as sort of payment the real punch line however does not come until the end it really makes you wonder how screenwriters really get their ideas could it simply be from friend or bum in the street the idea itself is provoking and brooks does it in hilarious manner speaking of brooks he was absolutely hysterical as screenwriter every time he graces the screen cannot help but start laughing albert has very unique sense of humor that makes him very likeable character the real problem the lies sharon stone she was not likeable at all brooks had the right idea her occupation but she never pulled through in way she drained energy from the once funny atmosphere and left it bleak luckily brooks could clean up the mess and cover for stones mishap it was shame that the went slightly downhill after her appearance because the muse had the potential be very authentic comedy on brighter note andie macdowell was also charming as brooks wife she is always nice addition as supporting actress because she has that charisma that seems complete the atmosphere any she is in the funniest moments in the muse in my opinion were the cameos james cameron and martin scorsese mean imagine brooks seeing these big named directors in his back yard seeking sharon stone for advice like it was something out of the ordinary it was just plain hilarious it just adds the satire joke of how directors get ideas brilliant move brooks as mentioned before the is satire much like it is proceeder bowfinger came out few weeks before unlike bowfinger this is not mean spirited that is desperate for jokes it is rather witty and humorous look at bowfinger had it is moments but had quite few problems that were never worked out but the muse still managed keep the laughs despite bit of detour the end of the you are glad see good hearty comedy come out of it for once am not fully disappointed because the did not slow down it kept moving even some flaws thumbs up brooks for his brave effort think he will still manage keep his edge around well into the future

for more than decade anjelica huston has been one of americas finest actresses in her directorial debut bastard out of carolina based upon dorothy allisons largely autobiographical book on child abuse and poverty in the south huston displays impressive proficiency behind the camera as well the tells the story of ruth anne boatwright nicknamed bone one of her uncles at birth in postworld war ii south carolina through voiceover narration done laura dern we find that she nearly did not survive birth as her single mother anney played jennifer jason leigh was thrown through the windshield during an automobile accident that is just the beginning of her troubles bone is deemed illegitimate on her birth certificate social stigma her mother and her large poor family obsesses over for years come anney meets and weds lyle kind man and good stepfather whom gives bone baby sister before dying in an automobile accident anneys brother earle played michael rooker introduces her glen played ron eldard coworker at the mill glen the black sheep of wealthy family when are you gonna make your daddy proud will tell you when never he is told and filled bitterness courts anney and eventually wins her despite warnings of violent temper when anney miscarries his muchprized baby boy glen loses his capability supress his violent outbursts and begins direct them at bone beating and abusing her while the lovedependent anney tries turn blind eye and justify his behaviour things turn for the worse when glen loses his job and the family of four sink into impoverishment while set several decades ago this story remains completely relevant in todays society where abused wives return their husbands and abuse committed against children one spouse is routinely overlooked the other the real star of this domestic drama is not topbilled jennifer jason leigh but child actress jena malone who plays bone in wrenching and wholly impressive debut performance her work is of awardcalibre and in this age in preponderence of superb child performers have emerged kirsten dunst tina majorino anna paquin natalie portman christina ricci elijah wood malones performance stands up well leighs performance in bastard out of carolina is fine although she is not really given much do and ron eldard work is very solid skillfully manouvering his characters moods in and out of explosive rage one can always sense that underneath his glen is pressurecooker ticking away of the supporting cast special note must be made of the criminally underrated michael rookers performance there is bit too much generic formulaism in the screenplay for my taste from the various characters spouting off country bumpkinisms the familiar sight of driedup uptight wise old granny played grace zabriskie sitting on the porch rocking chair impassioned soliloquies better suited for stage performance still it cannot be denied that anne merediths screenplay contains wallop of emotional power hustons direction of the is surehanded and impressive giving the good pacing and eliciting good performances from her cast particularly the young malone her sequences of child abuse are shot in hardhitting emotional rather than graphic manner and are very effective hustons talent camera positioning is wonderful from visually striking shot done through fan an extended sequence in the front seat of an automobile the has the toneddown feel of television production bastard out of carolina was originally composed and cut for broadcast on the tnt cable station who ended up declining the due sentiments that scenes of abuse and rape in the were too disturbingly realistic for their audience perhaps some sequences of the may be unpleasant but as whole bastard out of carolina adds up powerful viewer experience worth seeing

razor blade smile running as part of the vancouver international festival played october nd and th official release halloween reviewed vince yim you think you know all about vampires believe me you know ck all these words we are brought into the world of sultry vampire seductress the name of lilith silver played eileen daly made into an immortal century and half ago the sinister ethan blake she continues alleviate boredom her state of being so what is an undead girl do except squeeze into the tightest fitting clothes possible get out her guns seduce few guys and kill few people for money and blood that out of the way let me say this this is bad this is really really bad yet somehow it is strangely enjoyable all the elements of direct video horror flick buxom babes gore cheesy dialogue and bad acting any casual viewer would be more inclined spend their money on renting innocent blood or going see blade still it is considered be one of the finest british vampire agreed it might be but is far from being the best vampire flick ever period razor blade smile has some rather high production values shown the nice overall tone the the is also bit of departure from popular vampire lore vampire that can go out in broad daylight without disintegrating does not sleep in coffin but leaves one next her computer and sees religion as the opium of the peoples hence immunity crosses but aside from that it does not stray too far away from horror conventions that is unless that is intentional razor blade smile literally goes for the throat then pumps the wound full of processed cheese you cannot help but laugh when female vampire gets decapitated and her severed head goes flying into puddle you will laugh even harder at the hideously contrived situations distract two female guards lilith tosses cellular phone towards them and dials the number you will laugh the hardest when murder witness recants the tale and suddenly starts sobbing uncontrollably and then there is the sudden twist ending have enough heart not give it away the refuses take itself seriously is good thing as the time lilith zips up her skintight body suit and then unzips it just show the right amount of cleavage you have most likely forgotten the main point of the story but in case you really care she is been assigned kill bunch of people who belong the socalled illuminati and she is leaving huge mess behind for the police find as much as my criticisms this movie works best as guilty pleasure or as that you watch your friends and within groups almost destined for cultstatus the films campy cheesy overtones actually work towards the while this may not necessarily be the you would want be seen watching yourself it makes for fun time at the movies

pitch black is sheep in wolfs clothing it is full of darkness danger and violence and if you buy into the marketing hype an unsettling and scary going experience do not be fooled pitch black is morality play masquerading as scarefest it starts off blistering intensity cargo spaceship crash lands on planet apparently leeched of life the scorching heat of three suns among the survivors is fry mitchell the ships pilot who spends the wrestling the fact that she tried jettison the other passengers in her effort land the craft safely there is imam david an islamic leader whose faith in his god is tested repeatedly throughout the there is law enforcement officer in the form of johns hauser who attacks every situation square jawed authoritarian zeal and there is riddick diesel menacing musclebound convicted murderer who is being brought back justice johns the group quickly sizes up the situation and each other confident in their assessment of matters plan is set in motion escape their hellish environment those plans are shredded the appearance of one of the planets wildlife predatory sometimes winged species that enjoys the taste of blood and flesh fortunately the creatures are light sensitive and are forced live in networks of catacombs under the planets surface unfortunately the group has managed land on the planet moments before an eclipse is about occur taking away their one protection from the monsters the groups savior comes in the form of johns whose decisive leadership looks deliver them from purgatory or does it pitch black deviates from the standard scifi fare avoiding some of the stock escape the boogieman conflicts the genre typically serves up just as the planet gave false facade of lifelessness first appearances given the survivors proves be just as false the excitement of the comes not from the danger posed the creatures but rather from watching the shifting allegiances and emotional growth of the characters as the planet serves as deus ex machina of sorts catalyze emotional growth recurrent theme runs throughout the movie of faith whether it be religious or in person and how that powers their motivations found it telling that an accidental death occurs early on due the misperception of self professed atheist conversely imam constantly contributes any good fortune allah one one his perceived heaven sent blessings are taken away and crushed imam is forced reassess his faith another character expresses belief in god along life long hate yet another character makes decision that echoes the sentiments of christ about selflessness and has lasting repercussions for several of group it is fascinating character study hiding under the guise of scare flick special mention should be made of vin diesel who intriguingly conveys feral menace combined truly mesmerizing presence his character could have easily slipped into parody of the baddass killing machine but twohy and diesel add surprising depth riddick they can be excused for the two or three shwarzeneggerlike catch phrases that growl their way out of diesels mouth the movie has its flaws that can be nitpicked the creatures do look derivative of the ones in alien the dialogue is not the freshest at times reminiscent of bad comic book yes the appearance of riddicks vision skills are more than little timely considering the situation these trappings are on the periphery of the story twohy is really trying tell twohy may have lured you in under the pretense of scaring you fabricated boogieman but he shows the real boogieman be the prejudices and beliefs we use direct decisions in our lives

seen february on home video borrowed from chris wessell when it comes modern gangster movies it is really difficult describe and review them without making comparisons other films of the genre andor just using the word routine have always subscribed the philosophy that any idea no matter how many times it is been used before can provide for good story and donnie brasco clinches this idea it is not unlike most of the great films of the genre yet it never apes anothers style as it has good layer of authenticity even if its core is tad stale the starts off in typical fashion defining its atmosphere of new york city in the late and the mobsters who inhibit it we meet lefty pacino an aging wiseguy who can still walk the walk and talk the talk he and his associates go through the generic motions you expect see in crime films like this somehow he comes across donnie brasco depp younger guy lot of spunk who is not afraid of lefty and his rep and even manages befriend him after lefty was ready kill him it is clear donnie is new the life and lefty recognizes this immediately telling him all the tricks of the trade have never seen this technique of actually revealing the mafioso idiosyncrasies done before and for this the deserves credit however we soon realize donnie is actually joe pistone an fbi agent working undercover character who symbolizes the viewer as he will soon be purged into the lifestyle and treated as newcomer the first act works as guided ot of rhetoric about wiseguy honor brief history of the mob definitions of their slang and where their money comes from and who it goes the screenplay is rather sketchy on the details surrounding these elements however the fact they are mentioned at all is quite original most gangster movies seem be made the notion the viewer already knows how the mob works probably from watching other gangster movies and although this attitude comes across the tries fill in all the holes where and when it can and the effort is appreciable thankfully the does not become too caught up in the tedious details of organized crime and instead opts for character development much of the story is told simply through the interaction between lefty and donnie pacino is outstanding here as the pathetic hood who speaks of his job in the same manner any blue collar worker would he is old and exhausted but seems enjoy what he does just as anyone loyal the same employer for over years might be we learn of his accomplishments are quite impressive within their context and when he complains about not being made top boss it is easy sympathize him newell constantly plays up this aspect making it major theme works well in the long run as donnie is constantly impressing and even oneupping lefty it is hard tell emotion is more powerful the fact donnie is getting closer nailing the mob or the fact lefty has once again been over shadowed most of the tells the story of donnies life in mafia creates for many subplots and individual conflicts but does not always seem come together as whole the storytelling is genuinely interesting throughout even when the motions the characters go through seem familiar the resonance donnies actual assignment varies he often reports back the feds detail of his progress but it does not always seem have much meaning back home his wife maggie heche is ready divorce him because he is never and the family is suffering since this is based on true story would not doubt this would happen although the way it is handled often borders on the melodramatic my only major complaint is the seems have no final act or at least any real sense of closure climax of sorts does occur but there is little feeling of payoff we get happy ending is good but perhaps sad ending would have been more powerful aside from few minor general flaws donnie brasco manages be solid piece of storytelling and character development it may be routine but it is good and that is respectful

sometimes the green mile seems sooooo long indeed and any filmmaker three hour movie who ends it that gem of dialogue should expect see it quoted in review on more positive note let me add that sometimes the green mile is almost good enough make us forget its length the mile in question green due its faded limecolored linoleum leads from the prison cell old sparky the electric chair where executions were carried out at louisianas cold mountain penitentiary in paul edgecomb tom hanks you have got mail is the head guard of eblock otherwise known as death row keeping his prisoners calm as they await the carrying out of their sentence is his primary responsibility it is responsibility he capably delegates the other guards on his watch insisting they talk the convicts instead of yelling at them this practice leads an unusual camaraderie between the guards and the men behind their bars into his charge comes one john coffey michael clarke duncan armageddon seven foot tall gentle giant who has been convicted of the rape and murder of two young girls immediately paul senses something different about this prisoner perhaps its the way he asked for night light because he is frightened of the dark or perhaps it is the mystical healing powers he demonstrates as he takes back pauls bladder infection thereby restoring him health based on steven kings serialized novel the green mile does offer other characters who have stories be told eduard delacroix michael jeter patch adams is frail cajun convict who befriends and trains mouse do circus tricks percy wetmore doug hutchison time kill is young and sadistic guard sitting on transfer more lucrative position because he has yet see prisoner fry up close and hal moores james cromwell babe pig in the city is the compassionate warden for whom despite all the executions he is witnessed death never loomed as large as when his own wife was diagnosed tumor while it is mr hanks everyman performance at the center of the gives it the anchor hold our interest for minutes it is the performances of his supporting cast that are most worth noting all involved do credible work in their respective roles most especially mr duncan who turns in an impressive fully realized characterization if only the story were more credible writerdirector frank darabont the shawshank redemption has crafted flawed fantasyallegory of sorts one is more spiritualistic than spiritual relying on preternatural mysticism rather than genuine and godly spiritual power mr darabont also overplays his hand considerably in the manipulation of our affection towards and association his characters was it an accidental omission that the first two inmates who walked the green mile were being punished for crimes never disclosed not knowing the reason for the condemned convicts presence on eblock the audience never gets the sense of the justice is being carried out making the death penalty appear cruel and unwarranted this is especially true during the gruesome depiction of the second execution was horribly botched much has also been made of coffeys christlike ability heal but unlike the numerous healings are recorded in the scriptures coffeys powers are shrouded in mystery taking on the feel of circus trick coupled voodoolike feel your pain transference in contrast there is no mystery associated the healing that is from god the genuine gifts of healing listed in corinthians is just one of the nine manifestations of holy spirit and can be operated any spiritually instructed man or woman in accordance the knowledge and wisdom of god true spiritual healing few exceptions requires the committed believing of both the healer as well as the one being healed such believing comes not from the shrouded secrets of mysticism but from the revealed word of god

i guess there are those who have never been kissed before rare and dying breed except if you are child in case it would be called experimenting rarer still are those who have never been kissed before they reach the twenties hardest believe still is that drew barrymore has never been kissed despite all these hard believe tit bits there are people out there who have never truly been kissed and who are still waiting for that right person give them the wet sloppy warm feeling of tongues intermingling reassuring them that their search for true love is over well this movie is about girl waiting for the right boy give her the kiss of her life and it is sweet drew barrymore who shone in ever after is wonderful as josie grossy the high school dweeb who becase professional editor before being assigned her paper return school as an undercover reporter it addresses the issues of how dweeb becomes prom queen and finds the man of her life all in one sitting hard believe but possible there may also be those who have been kissed before but in fact never truly been given the kiss so this movie can be watched those who are waiting for true love or those who are still searching for it either way it is one enjoyable sit fairytale ending

note some may consider portions of the following text be spoilers be forewarned all the worlds stage and all the men and women merely players they have their exits and their entrances and one man in his time plays many parts excerpt from as you like it act ii scene when william shakespeare penned this passage he could not have possibly envisioned world in the domestic activites in an abode would be broadcast across the continent or where women would install webcams in their apartments in order convert voyeurism into cash this is the world of today and it is the perfect climate unveil prototypical highconcept project like the truman show truman burbank jim carrey seems have the perfect life he has pretty doting wife meryl laura linney comfortable insurance sales position an immaculate suburban home in the idyllic island community of seahaven reliable childhood buddy marlon noah emmerich except for the dog that paws greeting him every morning and his hydrophobia this is paradise or so it would seem bizarre inexplicable incidents begin crop up in trumans life lighting fixture unexpectedly plummets from the sky rainstorm gives new meaning the term isolated follows him around radio broadcast appears be describing his every move for the first time in his life it is beginning dawn on truman that things are not what they appear be the truman show directed peter weir and written andrew niccol is remarkably wellconstructed paced perfectly every scene fluidly leading into the next balancing drama humour thoughtfulness abandon this is addresses an intriguing and intricate concept just the right mixture of sermonizing and whimsical fancy in many ways mr niccols screenplay mirrors the spirit of his previous gattaca both films focus on the theme of triumph of the human spirit over oppressive adversity pivotal characterdefining moments occurring at sea although the films rather conventional climax does not sustain the inspired dynamic achieved in the first twothirds and ultimately just falls short on delivering the intended emotional punch there are moments through the truman show are genuinely stirring and moving as truman attempts make sense of his unraveling world and grasp the implications behind his discoveries of deception despite the multitude of pertinent issues being broached the it remains foremost finelycrafted piece of entertainment constantly light and accessible the tone achieved is far too sunny for any sense of fearful paranoia legitimately intrude and as the carefullystacked seahaven house of cards tumbles down the eschews any psychological ramifications for man discovering that the fundamentals of his entire existence have been false the end act of the truman show essentially boils down rehash of the reliable crowdpleasing underdog vs the system formula while the is an impressive realisation of an inspired concept some elements are lacking the device of mysterious laurensylvia natascha mcelhone as contributing impetus trumans growing awareness is not exactly convincing there is not much of discernable spark between either the two characters or the actors themselves and the scenes in she indignantly confronts the megalomaniac christoff ed harris regards the moral ambiguity of his actions unnecessarily spells things out for the audience thankfully avoided elsewhere in the in fact although the smartly restricts the number of scenes depicting the real world outside trumans artificial utopia mere handful of select reaction shots from enraptured gazers it might have perhaps been even more indicting and damning immerse itself even more deeply in the insulatory seahaven world the resultant effect that the repercussions felt as the finally shifts outside the imposed bubble are all the more startling still the scathing commentary issued this is on target and its insidiously oblique manner of delivery is far more effective in conveying the message than the more forthright antivoyeuristic tirades such as that of the recent costa gavras mad city have always believed that the versatile ms linney possesses tremendous comic gift she has always seems have impish gleam in her eyes and in the truman show she runs rampant her duplicitous character mischievously flashing glazed insanely jovial grin as she perkily recites impromptu product placement slogans cheerfully going over the top it is hilarious watch her who would have ever guessed that she would have the opportunity outshine the reigning king of comedy in the laughs department of ms linney is delight in the but it is mr carrey who rules the show here he may not have been intuitively the most obvious choice portray underdog hero truman burbank the role is seriously lacking in any of the frenetic comic interludes typify his traditional parts but he brings the character tremendous energy and eminent appeal it is difficult not root for truman in commanding performance mr carrey lends our protagonist an inherent sense of decency and integrity makes him genuinely engaging presence and acquits himself impressively in this dramatic turn demonstrating admirable restraint there is an early scene where he is down on his knees gardening and given his past track record one almost instinctively anticipates mr carrey pull one of more infamous and in this case wholly inappropriate sight gags it is almost poetic how this notorious lookatme actor successfully tones it down play character who is constantly the centre of attention in addition the fine performances the bulk of the cast mr emmerich is particularly noteworthy for issuing his character sense of sturdy trustworthiness the is immeasurably aided wonderful production design dennis gassner in creating trumans antiseptic white picketfenced smalltown utopia and burkhard dallwitzs original score technical credits are firstrate all around while the truman show is clearly definitive highconcept it is not exactly dazzlingly innovative one obvious predecessors utilising common elements abound ranging from secret agent through the groundbreaking british tv series the prisoner all the same this is visionary awardcalibre entertaining provocative and intelligent the curious and possibly disturbing thing may be that although upon first glance the plausibility of the films concept seems unfathomably outrageous it is abundantly clear that our society is rapidly approaching if not actualisation at least permissiveness of such scenario perhaps the highest compliment can be paid mr weir is that his depiction of this bizarro state is so convincing that we accept it without question perhaps we recognize bit of ourselves in this world

in chocolat chocolate shop owner tells her customers look into spinning object of obscure textures patterns and lines hoping she will be able foresee the kind of chocolate they will most enjoy some scoff the idea but everyone who gazes into the complexity of the spinning object winds up seeing something different than the next revealing personality traits the person may not have known they had before this can easily stand as model for chocolat as whole on the surface it appears be light fluffy fable no depth or true worth but when one takes second deeper look chocolats true colors begin shine through making bold statement about organized religion and those who practice it lasse hallstroms chocolat is flawlessly acted and meticulously craftednot mention one of the best films of the year what gives chocolat its magic much like hallstroms winner of two academy awards the cider house rules is its willingness say what is on its mind without holding back prevent offending audiences the bold and honest message hallstrom conveys chocolat will no doubt outrage select group of viewers but those who are willing suspend their bitterness because they feel they are being intimidated or attacked should find themselves be in agreement what the says about narrowmindedness chocolat centers its story around the small french village of lansquenet where majority rules and the majority lives only one law religion the bulk of the townspeople few exceptions are preparing for the sacred time of abstinence lent but when the independent thinking seemingly nonreligious vianne rocher juliette binoche and her daughter anouk victoire thivisol make the village their home the people will be tempted beyond belief the mouthwatering confections in the chocolate shop vianne opens many are predictably opposed and deeply offended viannes opening of the chocolate shop just in time for lent especially the mayor comte de reynaud cartoonlike alfred molina who will stop at nothing put her out of business on the other hand the shop is delight others including the cranky armande voizin judi dench who sits day day in viannes shop telling the single mother about her unfortunate detached relationship her grandson aurelien parentkoening comes as result of his mother carrieann moss believing armande is bad influence as she does not hold the same strict religious beliefs that she does also fan of the chocolate is the nervous wreck josephine muscat whose husband is constantly beating her whom vianne offers home and befriends juliette binoche is charming and honest as vianne genuinely capturing her characters determination turn the narrowminded townspeople into more happy independent human beings but most of chocolats success is unquestionably result of the remarkable performances of the supporting actresses lena olin previously nominated for an oscar in deserves her second nomination for her earnest moving portrayal of lost scared woman torn between staying true her battering manipulative husband or leaving him live the life for she longs judi dench is sharp incisive and occasionally greatly touching as armande voizin carrie annmoss in what is likely be her first largely noticed and acclaimed role since the matrix shows more solid side of her acting skills not previously seen crafting character that the viewer both sympathizes and despises simultaneously victoire thivisol shows much promise as anouk young girl hoping her alwaysonthemove mother will eventually settle down trade ad for chocolat sums up best the power the actresses have on screen the tagline five extraordinary women one extraordinary movie that is not say the men do not do their share though alfred molina makes for sly and utterly repugnant antagonist hugh oconor adds quite bit of comic relief as the priest who seems not even know why he is who he is and johnny depp gives strong performance as the pirate roux who enters the late in the game and sparks the romantic interest of vianne the technical aspects of chocolat are strong across the board lasse hallstrom directs his enchanting fable great care perfectly balancing the elements of each genre be found within the cinematographer roger pratt brings an atmospheric fairy tale look the and rachel portmans masterful score is her best and most memorable since the cider house rules chocolat adapted robert nelson jacobs from the joanne harris novel is wonderful little treat of one that will most likely win over the hearts of audiences and the votes of academy members this winter and the aggressive backing of miramax films assures the latter while not as powerful as the cider house rules lasse hallstroms chocolat is works on all levelsas drama comedy fable romance and fairy tale and it even lives up its name it is delicious savor the taste of easy digest and like all excellent chocolate it is memorable for days afterward the bottom line chocolat is pure pleasure

while alex browning devon sawa waits at jfk leave for school trip paris bad omens seem surround him as soon as he buckles into the plane he has vision of the plane exploding seconds after takeoff when the vision begins come true alex bolts for the door dragging several students and teacher in his wake the plane takes off without them and explodes just as alex predicted he becomes an object of fear and suspicion among the community and the tension only increases as the survivors begin die alex and another survivor clear rivers ali larter investigate the suspicious suicide of friend and mortician tony candyman todd clues them in the truth alex interrupted deaths design saving people who should have died in the explosion and death will want claim its rightful victims in order save himself and the others alex will have figure out deaths new plan and thwart it of the countless horror films that have competed for piece of the scream audience final destination is the best so far talented young screenwriter jeffrey reddick offers fresh variation on familiar formula we have seen hundreds of movies where group of teenagers are murdered onebyone faceless slasher but reddick cuts out the hockeymasked middleman and makes the villain death itself firsttime feature director james wong made the most of that premise every scene is permeated creepiness and foreboding reminding us that death is everywhere can come at anytime everyday objects and events vibrate menace the most amusing harbinger of doom john denvers rocky mountain high is played several times in the movie before someone dies the link is that denver died in plane crash and the song includes line about fire in the sky the performances are stronger than those usually elicited teen horror devon sawa who previously starred in another horror flick idle hands gives frantic and convincing lead performance kerr smith is carter hogan an antagonist of alexs whose quick temper causes him pulled off the fatal plane smith plays carter as filled anger and confusion that constantly threatens bubble over into violence seann william scott who is also in theaters right now in road trip plays the somewhat dim billy hitchcock and provides needed counterpoint the intensity of alex and carter tony todds onescene cameo is delicious but all too brief bottom line watchable teen fright flicks are few and far between but this destination is worth visiting

assume nothing the phrase is perhaps one of the most used of the as first impressions and rumors are hardly ever what they seem be the phrase especially goes for oscar novak an architect who is the main focus of three tango delightful funny romantic comedy about assumptions and being yourself novak matthew perry shy clumsy chicago based architect along openly gay partner peter steinberg oliver platt fights for projects day in and day out one of these is the job of restoring popular building for charles newman dylan mcdermott rich wellknown businessman charles immediately takes liking oscar as he enjoys his personality and sense of humor seeing oscar as someone he could trust charles asks him watch his girlfriend an unpredictable adventurous girl named amy post neve campbell who makes living blowing glass charles wants know who she talks what she does and where she goes the point make sure she is not seeing someone else of course oscar gladly takes the job and meets amy at an art show of hers and sparks fly between the two from the get go oscar feels he has found the one meant for him and he is content the idea of being amy well another popular phrase of the is all good things must come an end and this stays true for oscar as well charles walks in on amy and oscar having drink one night as oscar and amy have become great friends but he does not seem mind why is this he thinks oscar is gay he is not afraid share this him either oscar stands in shock after the words swear if you were not gay oscar would have kill you are muttered flamboyantly from charles mouth the word spreads instantly through town will oscar come out of his supposed gayness or will he tell everyone that he is not one would immediately think he would deny the fact but numerous occurrences come oscar result in the fact that if he denies the fact he could lose his job charles matthew perry does not escape his character as chandler on the already classic v comedy friends as both oscar novak and chandler are clueless shy and sensitive nonetheless perry is hilarious here and shows that he can handle drama as obviously his character suffers quite bit here it is wonderful see neve campbell outside of horror movie she was the star of scream and and the upcoming scream as she handles comedy superbly here her voice smile and personality are more than perfect for romantic comedies stay this genre neve neve is delightful as her conflicted character who feels love for oscar but knows based on rumors that he is gay as usual campbell is likable as her likable character unlike the other two leads here dylan mcdermott is flat in his dialogue and is never convincing when his character his present mcdermott sets dull tone the scene his horrible acting stick the v drama the practice dylan the major weak spot in three tango is the direction of damon santostefano no originality or technique is used whatsoever three tango is lucky that the script is so edgy and that perry and campbell are wonderful in comedy or else the would have been disaster as it is just plain boring look at three tango is done many times before as the plot is suspiciously close the object of my affection but the plot has never been completed so well three tangos script written rodney patrick vaccaro and aline brosh mckenna is fun fast and funny delivering not only original hilarious gay jokes not your run of the mill material but certain snappiness in the dialogue between characters that always keeps you smiling unlike last summers south park bigger longer and uncut and in out three tango is comedy in the gay element is not crude or vulgar the script is wise take this route as gays cannot do not think so anyway be offended this light playful comedy prove this gay couple was in the audience who were laughing constantly three tangos climax is hilarious clever scene that is pure irony based on the outcome of most romanticmistaken identity comedies three tango is gem the bottom line three tango is light sharp snappy romantic comedy superb ending and great stars one of the better romantic comedies of

the question is not why has grease been reissued the answer that one is easy celebrate the movies th anniversary and make more bucks for paramounts coffers because john travolta is once again hot commodity no the question that ought be asked is should grease be reissued the answer is not an easy one grease is fun movie an entertaining fantasy of the embodying all the cliches of that era the music is lively and the dance numbers choreographed patricia birch are energetic and highspirited travolta was at his pinnacle as sexual icon cool but nonthreatening but grease did not break any new cinematic ground it was not milestone in movie history such as citizen kane or easy rider what grease is or has become is the highestgrossing musical in history ok let us not be spoilsport grease is fun and entertaining movie even though it stretches credulity see such performers as travolta olivia newtonjohn taxis jeff conaway and the multitalented stockard channing try act like high schoolers it is nostalgic recall how good dancer travolta was and it is sad think of what could have been had not few missteps sidetracked his career he could have become musical comedy star in the tradition of gene kelly cinematically the musical comedy has basically gone the way of the dinosaur between grease and evita you can probably count the number of movie musicals on one hand two reasons have contributed the demise of the genre the first is that movie audiences have become more sophisticated no make that cynical and jaded today if character began dance and sing no orchestra in sight he or she would probably be hooted off the screen todays audiences lack the innocence that belief in movie magic that is required for musical succeed secondly lack of talent performers the charisma the style the largerthanlife panache of fred astaire gene kelly ginger rogers and judy garland are gone most singers and dancers remain on the stage and those who do succeed in movies usually wind up in serious dramatic parts good example is gregory hines one of the greatest dancers in the world he danced bit in the cotton club tap and white nights but those were essentially dramatic vehicles so perhaps the reissue of grease can serve purpose if audiences show enough interest meaning if the rerelease earns the studio enough revenue it may spark revival in movie musicals perhaps not original musicals such as singin in the rain an american in paris or seven brides for seven brothers but for broadway properties that have been in the planning stages for adaptations for several years at one time or another according the industry rumor mill has been set create an animated version of andrew lloyd webbers cats filming of the popular phantom of the opera as well as les miserables and chicago the latter reportedly star madonna so let this grease be the forerunner of an armada of movie musicals let grease be the word that sparks this revival

let us face it since waterworld floated the summer movie season has grown very stale no new eyecandy for four weeks straight we have had sustain ourselves on the quasinutritional value of cheatin husbands traveling chocolate salesmen and computer generated serial killers sigh thank god for desperado the freewheeling sequel el mariachidirector robert rodriguezs notorious debutstars cool antonio banderas as the returning guitarist no name he is man in black revenge on his mind and an arsenal in his case the woman he loved was killed in the first so he spends the entire story shooting drug dealers sort of texmex version of the punisher if you will there is not much of an emotional core desperado rodriguez is having too much fun finding new and innovative ways pay homage john woo and sergio leone and sam peckinpah some may wince at the body countat least graphic killings is fair estimatebut it is all played for laughs big broad hispanic laughs that for me recall the physical comedy of blake edwards and his pink panther films sick slick fun

if beavis and butthead had favorite movie from dusk till dawn would probably be it scripted quentin tarantino and directed robert rodriguez desperado the movie panders the very worst in sex and violence and is incredibly fun watch it starts off as pulp fictiontype crime story criminal brothers george clooney and tarantino robbing convenience store because this is tarantino movie however it is not just case of pull the gun and take the loot it is case of hole being shot through someones hand man on fire jumping out behind the counter and the entire store blowing up as they drive away the opening scene sets the tone for the rest of the movie everything overdone and nothing as it seems clooney and tarantino bring hostage the motel and then hijack an rv family in it harvey keitel plays the backslidden expreacher and juliette lewis his daughter whom registered sexpervert tarantino eyes endlessly you know you are mentally unbalanced when you find lewis the least bit attractive although she is not nearly as obnoxious as usual in from dusk till dawn the first half of the movie has the criminals and hostages trying get and through the mexico border clooneys strategy involving hiding in the rv shower while lewis is on the toilet it does its trick the border guard takes one look at lewis relieving herself and immediately goes blind never noticing clooney or tarantino once they get mexico it is time wait at the rendezvous point topless bar called titty twister where we are once again reminded tarantino wrote the movie as he drinks champagne off the foot of stripper finally after about ten minutes of intercut boob shots and clooney forcing keitel and lewis drink him the stripper turns into vampire soon half the people in the bar are vampires and the other half fall or fight back that is right we have come all this way see vampire movie but like everything else tarantino takes this ageold genre and twists it his own ends produce overthetop entertainment so we get holy water condom balloons heads rolling quadruple impalement on an overturned table and keitel getting bitten vampire and announcing he only has few minutes left before he becomes lap dog of satan the from dusk till dawn dialogue is tarantino hovering between absurd and disgusting as when they are entering the nightclub and cheech marin announces the main attractions of the titty twister but always entertaining and is huge reason the movie is so much fun watch instead of being one more secondrate gorefest clooney keitel and especially tarantino are so overthetop their delivery that the dialogue is that much more hilarious ensuring not one second of from dusk till dawn is taken the least bit seriously stuff like this would be terrible in any other movie but tarantino and rodriguez know exactly what do entertain people even if there is absolutely no message or meaning from dusk till dawn pulp fiction had the vulgarity and violence for reason but this movie just throws it out for cheap entertainment from dusk till dawn is not the classic of modern cinema that pf is but is does prove you can do good job making really bad movie

the smallscale in limited release waking ned devine is pleasant excursion time and place allows the audience absorb the full texture of small town filled breathtaking scenery characters and delightful music the movie would be interesting even without plot the story contains several surprises are best left unmentioned in review the starts out sharp opening gives us taste of what is follow country folk an inclination for bit of larceny what gets things going is the fact that winner of the lottery is apparently one of the residents in the small town pop of tullymore who that person is and how share in the good fortune is the mission of two longtime friends jackie ian bannen and michael david kelly part detectives part scalawags they have stay alert the changing circumstances they face as the story unfolds the village consists of several amusing characters clueless pig farmer temporary priest and witch there is also the lotto man who must be satisfied that everything is on the upandup there are no touches this except for the outer space introduction pacing is right towards the end it runs bit out of steam but that is okay because for most of the minutes we have been interested in the goings on mixture of laughs and occasional sentiment all the right emotions are engaged in one brief dream sequence you will know it when you see it fantastic combination of color and music transports the characters place you really hope exists one of the key moments in the the music available on cd london follows the same arc as the movie and is well worth considering fine that is for everybody except action fans somewhat like the englishman who went up hill and came down mountain but livelier

warren beattys bulworth is caustic political comedy that does not attack any particular political group but rather the ingrained insincerity that has infected the american political system some might think this is vulgar and in many ways it is however as loud and raucous as it is bulworth speaks the truth is almost always ugly hear beatty who directed the and cowrote the script jeremy pikser the lemon sisters stars as incumbent s senator jay billington bulworth who has one of the best politician names in cinema history bulworth is democrat and in beattys view he is symbolic of everything that has gone wrong the current democratic party once an ideological liberal like beatty still is bulworth has long since succumbed the materialistic pressures of washington instead of waging the battles for the impoverished and the downtrodden was once the calling card of democrats bulworth has become another sellout money hound if he is not accepting illegal bribes from the insurance lobby or taking campaign contributions from the chinese he is making windbag speeches that start the amusingly clintonesqe statement america is standing on the doorstep of new millennium blah blah blah when the opens it is few days before the primary elections and bulworth is sitting at his desk weeping because he realizes how corrupt he has become in fit of desperation he takes out million life insurance policy from dirty insurance rep played paul sorvino part of shady lobby deal kill threatening bill in committee and then hires hit man kill him although he does not know who the assassin will be or when the hit will take place knowing that he will soon be dead bulworth unleashes his own brand of political rhetoric on the world is made up of politically incorrect truths about the state of american politics and the society in general at compton church he tells the group of africanamericans that they will have no power in the s unless they put down that malt liquor and chicken wings and get behind somebody other than running back who stabs his wife later in particularly hilarious sequence bulworth mixes the elite then insults the quality of their movies and informs them that the only reason he is there is because my guys always put the big jews on my schedule all throughout this physically and politically suicidal escapade bulworths chief of staff dennis murphy oliver platt follows behind in state of constant shock and bewilderment platt has some of the movies funniest scenes as he makes murphy into politically savvy but nonetheless clueless assistant who is forced watch his own career teeter at the brink of being flushed down the toilet his constant halftruthtelling and spindoctoring cover bulworths stampede is equaled in its perversion only selfrighteous reporter nora dunn who acts like murphys refusal explain bulworths actions something he really cannot do is somehow an act of treason when bulworth decides he wants live after all and therefore must constantly evade grimlooking assassin be who is trailing him at every turn he hides out in the ghetto complete stereotypical gangsta wardrobe he wears one of his television interviews at this point beatty abandons much of the political aspect and dives into cartoonish exploration of the black innercity experience bulworth becomes friendly young black woman named nina halle berry who he meets at the harlem church rally she has toughtalking brother who is deep in debt local gangster named d don cheadle of boogie nights who also becomes involved in bulworths campaign some of the scenes in the ghetto ring true but much of it feels like lighter version of scenes depicted in more intense innercity films like boyznhood and menace ii society bulworths chief liability is beattys insistence on having his character adopt clumsy style of rap as his new communication device instead of speaking at political rallies he breaks into kind of rhythmless rap style that is reminder of why almost all hiphop stars are black it is hard tell whether beatty is being humorous being so bad or whether he is actually that incompetent at any rate the rap sounds more run m than snoop doggy dogg makes the seem dated instead of contemporary beatty would have been better off simply adopting some of the innercity lingo and working that into his speeches instead of trying sound like l cool other than that bulworth hits all its targets wry hilarious accuracy the is like letter bomb the democratic party and even if you do not agree beattys liberal message about the unrequited duties of the federal government it is hard deny the impact the has in exploring the monetary and moral debauchery that infests modern politics unlike primary colors opened earlier this year bulworth does not try tiptoe around the truly painful issues that hit close home instead it takes them deadon

when saw the trailer for this laughed harder than had in quite some time while was therefore pretty well psyched see it was ever mindful that trailer can make even the most mediocre look good am happy say that there is something about mary is not one of those trailer letdowns in fact watching this was quite fine way spend two hours the opens up in flashback at high school in cumberland rhode island ted stroehmann ben stiller is social reject who cannot seem get date the upcoming prom until he comes the defense of the mentally retarded warren earl brown who is being harassed one of the school jocks it seems warrens sister is the campus queen mary jensen cameron diaz who is impressed teds willingness stand up for her defenseless brother despite very real chance of getting beaten up mary takes an immediate liking ted and asks him the prom ted was just flattered that she even knew his name unfortunately prom night is ruined when ted has an accident his zipper at every man in the theater will wince and is sent the hospital fast forward the present where ted has cleaned himself up now writes for magazine but has weekly therapy sessions in order deal his obsession of the past years mary whom he has not seen since that fateful day the help of his friend dom chris elliott ted hires slimy private investigator pat healy matt dillon track down his only love however when pat finds mary he falls for her too and soon the both of them are competing for her affections there is something about mary is directed bobby and peter farrelly who brought us dumb and dumber and kingpin not exactly intelligent comedies they are of the guilty pleasure variety where you might not want your friends or coworkers think you had such great time watching them their current the farrelly brothers have come up something you will not only enjoy but also will not mind talking about the next day at the water cooler the succeeds in employing pretty wide range of comedic styles from the subtle the ridiculous and while few of the gags might be offensive some seeming like residuals from the farrelly brothers last two films they almost all work have not seen many movies in the recent past that shoot for the mark and so often hit it dead on one minute you will be laughing at something ted says and the next you will be howling at the sight of dog dragging him across the floor of marys apartment one of the great things this has going for it is ben stiller he is perfectly cast in the role of ted because he is guy who just looks awkward in almost every situation teds nice fellow and tries do his best but for some reason or another things just do not always work out it is comical but also has that kind of appeal where you really feel for the him and want him come out on top actually have liked stiller since he did short aired on saturday night live back in the mideighties the was like theatrical trailer for spoof on the tom cruisepaul newman the color of money entitled the hustler of money in it stiller played wince not vince who is taken under the wing of an older man played john mahoney become bigtime bowling hustler it was parody at its finest more of showed up in the shortlived the ben stiller show on the fox network in late early like the critic aired on abc then fox still mourn that show is cancellation cameron diaz is absolutely enchanting for most of the although her character seems obsessed perfection in the men she dates and some of the qualities she looks for make mary look paperthin at times however diaz pulls the role off such panache and charm that you can still see why she is got guys just falling over each other be her heck even found her laugh be cute even though thought it was annoying during an appearance she made on the tonight show last week my girlfriend remarked that matt dillon does not change and you know it is really true he and ralph macchio must hang out or something maybe they live in dick clarks pool house anyway heres another good piece of casting as dillon slips beautifully into the role of the guy who tries worm his way into marys heart the supporting performances are also good chris elliott has bigger part than in the abyss yes check it out next time and less annoying than in cabin boy lin shae who plays marys neighbor magda and also appeared as the landlady in kingpin provides some good laughs especially in scenes her benjilike dog acts as the focal point for few of the funniest moments of the lee evans as marys friend tucker displays flexibility in acting and accents surprises and contributes an interesting plot twist the farrelly brothers and scriptwriters ed decter and john strauss keep the comedic pacing going so that there are not any noticeable times where the drags the only problem saw was their use of couple of musicians who provide segues between several key scenes they appear out of nowhere and actually sing plotrelevant information right toward the camera it is device was amusing for about three seconds when they opened the after that it got little annoying and it is unfortunate that those spots interrupt what would otherwise be smooth flow fortunately filled sight gags humorous lines and solid comedic acting there is something about mary will still have you laughing after you leave the theater

plot young recruit gets plucked out of nowhere the number one gangster in london and quickly becomes staple his side but this new guy is not like all the others he is got ambition he is got goals and he loves everything he sees about being the number one gangster violence lots of swearing and betrayals ensue critique very good seriousminded unique british gangster flick misses the great mark way of an annoying voiceover popping up throughout the and soso ending heres yet another cool crime movie that actually manages bring something new into the mix okay so it is not entirely new but it is definitely original when all put together as done here the thing liked most about this movie was its authentic portrayal of the time period in it was taking place it is and these dudes are looking good yes it is all about the suits fellas the italian shoes the cufflinks the ties and the birds that is ladies for those uninitiated hanging around you here are bunch of horrible men gangsters if you will looking sharp talking shit and busting heads all over the place but that is not the basis of this movie the basis of this comes in the relationship between the number one gangster in the group the excellent david thewlis and one of his cronies paul bettany also extremely good in this and how the power sex appeal and coolness of one affects the other you know how there are always these hangeron gangster types who latch on the godfathers the leaders the top dogs of every crime organization well most of the time these dudes are screened beforehand and are loyal only one person that is their boss so all the gangster number one needs worry about is his enemies on the other side of the fence but this brings the betrayals the messed up loyalties the honor codes among bad guys into play within the same group and presents it in quite the stylistic package of course director paul mcguigan is not trying be guy ritchie here and does not overstylize his presentation jazz it all up hip soundtrack or add any humor the mix nope he goes straight for the serious stuff and develops at least two particular scenes are still embedded in my mind as type this the first is confrontation sequence between bettany and man from he is attempting sway some information and it is downright nasty look into my eyes in fact the last time that have seen guy so scared in movie was john turturro in that forest scene from the coen brothers millers crossing scary shite but there is an ever better scene than that in this this one features bettany once again slowly torturing hacking and beating the living piss out of rival gangster from that mans pointofview but not before turning on quaint little tune in the background and removing all of his own expensive clothes one one that is right he does the guy in his underwear that scene is also in tune some of the obvious phallic and homoerotic undertones present throughout this especially in the relationship between bettany and his boss why does he get so upset when he falls in love that woman but the flicks not perfect in fact did not mind malcolm mcdowells voiceover narration at first but as the grew into major flashback most of the is presented as such he came in every now and then and rarely added anything of interest the plot all he seemed do was swear and call people the cword umpteen times and even described one scene as it was happening so opened the door then went up the lift etc it is like yeah know that already could see it on the screen overdone also did not quite buy the ending of the movie despite being original seemed little unbelievable especially when you consider that it is supposed be taking place years later and folks still seem be holding grudges still in love still living in the same apartments mean cmon it is years man do not know somehow it did not work all that well for me but one of my favorite genres has always been the crime movies and this one is decent addition the lot forget the lame title and malcolm mcdowells narration of the obvious plot points and concentrate on the films stronger attributes such as its style the exquisite atmosphere of the time period its original look at the gangster dynamic within the same group its memorable sequences and the solid performances from its two main leads bettany and thewlis incidentally unlike few of the gangster flicks that mention below this one is in no way parody or homage this genre of films it is the real deal note this is packed strong accents all around makes it hard make out some of the words from time time it is also quite violent and do not remember any that used the cword as much as this one so leave the kids at home for this one where is joblo coming from american psycho clockwork orange donnie brasco fight club get carter godfather godfather ii goodfellas lock stock two smoking barrels pulp fiction reservoir dogs

bruce lee was biggerthanlife martial artist and actor bruces unique character e selfproduced sound effects etc and seemingly perfected martial art and physique were all well portrayed the actor james lee the story is told from his wife lindas point of view where she put lot of family and practical side of bruce lees life however you cannot help but like whenever the fight scenes are on what he can does his body and that familiar bruce attitude and character also like the little bits of insight scenes about bruce lees life before he became famous scenes like bruce practicing pronunciation of english it seemed as if he was no better than anybody else scenes like bruce delivering chinese food as delivery boy ridding bike through the american college looking at the allwhite students cheerleaders and athletes it seemed he too wished for the american dreams and hopes in conclusion the movie was well made it produced realization of who bruce lee was and actor james lee was so much like bruce you have remind yourself that he is just an actor and the fighting scenes were all excellent so go see it and enjoy the movie s if you have seen the movie unforgiven clint eastwood then the feeling left after dragon was very much like the feeling you got after the unforgiven

clint eastwood in his ripe old age is cashing one talent in for another midnight in the garden of good and evil is an eastwooddirected clint is not even in and it is damn good adapted from bestselling john berendt novel based on true events this movie is set in the bizarre georgia town of savannah where people walk invisible dogs and attach horseflies their head and that is just the mayor as director and producer eastwood contributes self indulgent but very competent minutes neatly balancing drama suspense and humor like all great movies midnight in the garden has lot of funny moments that spring from the characters themselves and not from some contrived juvenile intrusion the acting from bigtime stars john cusack and kevin spacey is as good as you would expect but it is the supporting stable that gives the movie its offbeat charm cusack plays freelance reporter sent savannah write fluff story for town country magazine about one of eccentric millionaire spaceys parties lots of food beverages and gunplay yes an employee of spaceys has huge argument in front of cusack and later turns up dead it seems like simple matter of self defense the guy threatened spacey shot at him missed then spacey took him out but being movie there is much more it than that and cusack decides stay in town and write book about the murder book will eventually become movie he will star in the weird circle of entertainment this is where the stable of supporting characters comes in there is the requisite sexy woman alison nepotists daughter eastwood the strange piano player the voodoo woman and the transvestite miss chablis deserves paragraph of hisher own as the stealer of every scene she appears in what would this movie be without the castilian scene and her testimony chablis playing herself is five times funnier than reigning drag queen rupaul but never seems exploited as the movies comic relief or out of place in basically serious movie there are also fair share of courtroom scenes these days almost never seem welcome in movie but even here clint manages keep the movie fascinating certainly the characterizations of the judge and spaceys lawyer both help immensely as does having the flyguy as the jurys foreman it is here we realize the case boils down an indictment of spaceys homosexuality yes spacey had sexual relationship the dead man before he shot him of course midnight in the garden of good and evil is not classic but it is one of the better celebritydirected truestory bestseller adaptations out there likewise no one from this movie will be getting any oscar nominations but the performances are all great in fact would almost recommend that the academy add best supporting transvestite category serving america for more than th of century

meet joe black is your classic boymeetsgirl boylikesgirl boygetskilledinhorribleaccident supernaturalentitytakesoverboysbody supernaturalentityfallsinlovewithgirl story based on the death takes holiday meet joe black is well acted romantic drama explores the meanings of life and love william parrish anthony hopkins is billionaire businessman on the brink of his th birthday he has built huge media empire and raised two beautiful daughters allison marcia gay harden and susan claire forlani william has been able negotiate his way out of many tough spots but he has suddenly begun fearing his own mortality the one situation he will not be able talk his way out of and he has good reason fear for death himself is stalking him however death has deal make death has taken possession of man who has recently died brad pitt and wants william be his guide in holiday among the living in return william gets live few extra days of course he agrees death under the human name of joe black gets experience life as complete innocent he never before has experienced the simple pleasures of springy matters or peanut butter and he is not quite compared for the more complex pleasures when he and susan fall in love but is their affair doomed an early demise at nearly three hours in length meet joe black is little bit on the leisurely side though it never gets boringly lengthy instead the gets chance develop some nicely textured characters and situations you get soak in and enjoy the atmosphere rather than being hurriedly rushed through it the romantic angle works well though surprisingly the interactions between joe black and william parrish are more interesting than those his daughter this is most likely due anthony hopkins who once again displays his superb acting skills william is desperate man who has had seemingly ideal life and does not want let it go contrast claire forlani is merely the romantic interest she gets show joe the ropes of love but is hardly as interesting character as joe black brad pitt seems bit stilted granted he is supposed be outofplace but the overly formal technique used pitt begins distract from the role still he is able hold his own and over the course of the three hours his character begins grow on you the main character who seems out of place here is drew jake weber an ambitious executive in williams company who is joe blacks main rival for susans affections weber plays the character hammy relish reminiscent of snidley whiplash this cartoonish foil an aberration in filled many more dimensional characters the supernatural elements of the are handled murkily but never distractingly so we never learn what is the exact nature of death or why he is never done something like this before it actually gets bit creepy when death talks the dying in their own voicesaccents his initial conversations hopkins sound shockingly like hannibal lecter and the ultimate resolution one of the films supernatural problems seems well somewhat superficial still even the films length it was pleasant time at the movies something you would not necessarily expect from about death but one meet joe black delivers anyhow

buffalo is very rarely known movie that stars vincent gallo and christina ricci gallo plays very troubled man who was sent jail for gambling once out of jail he must visit his parents who he told he was married the truth is he is not married try impress them he kidnaps girl christina ricci from tap dancing class act as his wife the is very cheaply made and it shows it throughout lot of the movie but you do not need money make good buffalo does not always stay the realistic concept and sometimes goes through outrageous events gallos parents played angelica huston and ben gazarra are two very strange individuals the mother plays football fanatic and the father plays quiet man odd habits gallo and ricci arrive at his parents house and some extremely funny scenes take place within the house
