everyday cattle rancher whose greatest fear is growing old and no longer having purpose in life bookers talents are taxed into service annie maclean kristin scott thomas new york magazine editor whose daughter grace scarlett johansson was recently in horrible accident the accident is filmed gutwrenching horror happens when grace and her best friend are out riding horses an eighteenwheeler kills graces friend severely wounds and traumatizes graces horse pilgrim and causes grace lose part of her right leg annie believes that if pilgrim can be healed grace will be healed as well leads her booker at first she tries get booker come new york see the horse but that does not work instead she packs up grace and pilgrim leaves her husband robert sam neill behind and heads for the rolling hills of montana where booker runs ranch his brother frank chris cooper and his sisterinlaw diane dianne wiest in many ways the is like journey both literally and symbolically the move out west has always been great american tradition of renewal and it is hard not see annie and graces leaving manhattan for montana as variation on the classic theme of city vs country in the horse whisperer country is clearly the victor the city is characterized claustrophobia and unhappiness and it is not until the characters arrive in the wideopen spaces of montana that graces anger at being physically and emotionally crippled begins dissipate annies controlling nature begins relax and pilgrim once again learns trust people redford is just as in love the grand montana country in this as he was when he directed river runs through it six years ago in many ways the horse whisperer comes from the same poetic vein as river and the movie could probably be good fifteen minutes shorter if redford had decided spend less cameratime on the grass and mountains but then that would ruin the magic much of the films photography is truly elegant and it creates palpable sense of the sheer expansiveness of the land further emphasize this redford and cinematographer robert richardson natural born killers platoon cheated bit shooting the beginning of the takes place in new york mostly cold harsh bluish filters and more squarish aspect ratio when the action shifts montana richardson switches softfocus and natural lighting and the screen widens aspect ratio in terms of the story itself the horse whisperer gives us the same romanticized view of adultery found in david leans brief encounter and clint eastwoods adaptation of robert james wallers the bridges of madison county richard lagravenese coscreenwriter here also adapted bridges although the horse whisperer has strong romantic sensibility still find something oddly troubling about this kind of story it seems me that there should be some sympathy for the husband who is being left behind for this brief heartsweeping affair but there rarely is in the horse whisperer the thankless role of being the fuddyduddy husband falls sam neill he plays the character as decent hardworking man who is good husband and father his only failure is that he loves his wife more than she loves him he is at risk of losing annie booker not because he did anything drive her away but simply because he happens be normal fairly uninspiring man there is one scene that is particularly telling of how the movie feels about each character it shows booker and robert going into horse pen booker is dressed like classic cowboy hat and all while robert looks somewhat frumpy and outofplace in baseball cap as they enter the pen booker assuredly swings over the fence while robert hesitates then opens the gate and in goofy moment forgets close it behind him it is small scene but it clearly demonstrates the movies thorough love of the booker character for his romantic roughness after all booker represents everything good about the city while robert represents everything banal and unnatural about it the best scenes in the horse whisperer tend involve not the building romance between booker and annie but rather the healing process of grace and her horse although bookers horsetraining methods are mythical and unrealistic the scenes him and pilgrim are strangely mesmerizing these are paralleled the scenes between him and grace some of are humorous and all of are tender and true at some point wished the movie would drop the whole romance angle and focus on grace more nevertheless redford is obviously romantic at heart and he brings light touch the erotic moments in the there are no dramatic sex scenes but there is moving scene when he and scott thomas are slowdancing always moving ever closer together that is far more erotic than any scene of sweaty bodies grinding together although the movie is longer than it should be and is essentially melodramatic tearjerker an unsatisfying conclusion that guarantees unhappiness for just about every character there are enough moments like that make the horse whisperer worth the price of admission

in roger michells romantic comedy notting hill william thacker hugh grant leads rather dreary life maintaining his flagging travel bookshop in the quaint section of london lends it is name the films title one day american movie superstar anna scott julia roberts walks in purchase book on turkey quickly enamored of each other the two embark upon an onagain offagain love affair replete romance humor and the occasional lump in the throat the opens nonverbal cue annas stardom as the title credits appear over montage of slow motion sequences featuring the actresss appearances in films and at premieres coming out of limousines walking the red carpets and such without words this sequence gives us background her character following however is setup narration william indicating what he does and where he lives do not know why the filmmakers chose go narration tells us nothing we could not have figured out watching the first ten minutes of and never resurfaces after the movies beginning but there it is if there were ever clear case for less is more this would be it the is told nearly first person from williams point of view as he is in every scene nature of this arrangement we get very definite sense of what he is all about and his nice guy personality wins us over easily in fact much of notting hills strength lies in the great dialog written for this character richard curtis scene where william is still in shock over the fact that he is even talking silver screen goddess is made golden the way bumbles through his attempt offer her some honeysoaked apricots from his refrigerator or take an instance where anna kisses william and asks him never tell anyone for fear of the incident hurting her image william assures her he would not say word then adds well will probably tell myself now and then but would never believe it great stuff the downside spending so much time william is that we do not get see enough of anna make their relationship whole and plausible we are constantly exposed williams thoughts feelings actions and desires but do not actually get the sense of how much anna really feels for him there are couple of instances where she declares her obvious interest but they nearly come out of nowhere due the fact that we are not sure what she is been thinking all the times in between this combined the sheer iniquity of screen time between the two makes this hugh grants hands down he gets the great scenes look for one in he has portray an interviewer from horse and hound magazine in order speak anna the great lines and gives an overall wonderful performance julia roberts fans will probably be disappointed the actresss top billing and subsequent lack of involvement in the ala sandra bullock in time kill along her detached performance is only worsened her characters unpredictable behavior anna does not get lot of our compassion this romantic comedy leans little more toward the comedy than the romance much of it supplied grant himself but considerable help from the supporting cast most notable is rhys ifans as spike williams eccentric roommate who is in the for no other purpose than make us laugh hugh bonneville emma chambers james dreyfus and gina mckee bring up the guard as williams friends and family particularly shining in scene where william brings anna his sisters birthday dinner and we get see how these common folks react the presence of movie star in their midst it is scene most of us will probably think would play out in our own living rooms were we faced similar situation roger michells use of visuals does not sweep us off our feet but does give us more than your typical movie of this type for example there are couple of instances in this where large amounts of time pass whereas some films are content simply put in caption saying eight months later michell presents us more interesting cues such as williams walk though his neighborhood while the seasons change around him another memorable shot occurs in park where the camera is lifted from ground level couple of hundred feet in the air we are generally used scenes where our point of view is lifted from the earth treetop level or so but in this case the camera just keeps going up and up until we have birds eye view of the ground below music is used rather glaringly as an enhancement many of the films scenes and some of this might have been better toned down but in other areas it works full effect it is kind of mixed bag but still fares better than many of todays lighthearted movies are so influenced the mtv fare that the becomes one long music video at least this has some pretty good music that for the most part remains relevant and appropriate notting hills grant and roberts will not go down in history as one of the alltime greatest pairings but the chemistry is decent and the comedic aspects of the movie more than make up for it for couple of hours you should expect laugh more than cry and that is not so bad now is it

ingredients man amnesia who wakes up wanted for murder dark science fiction city controlled alien beings mental powers synopsis what if you woke up one day and suspected you were not on earth and instead were part of an experiment in giant space terrarium manipulated intergalactic alien zookeepers in dark city john murdoch rufus sewell has this problem dark city starts out like s noir amnesia detective mystery poor john wakes up amnesia in hotel room dead dame in one corner mysterious phone call tells him get the heck out of there and soon enough john is chased all over town murderous army of pale people in black trenchcoats as well as the police and the dogged inspector bumstead william hurt is john murderer and what can his missing memories tell him he searches through his own wallet for possible contacts and clues but when the clues do not fit it does not just confuse him it causes john go so far as question the whole nature of reality in the dark city john something is fishy and very unreal about this city how come it is always dark and nobody seems remember what they did this morning and how come nobody seems remember how leave the city or how get nearby shell beach every night around midnight john notices that the whole city enters state of suspended animation and at this time creepy alien experimenters known as the strangers come out and do nasty things like inject fake memories into peoples heads big hypodermic needles the strangers have the ability tune or warp reality using telepathic powers turns out the city is not on earth at all and the reason why john does not fall victim the nightly suspended animation is because he is human mutation that possesses the same godlike realitywarping abilities as the strangers even the help of scientist dr daniel schreber can john take back the dark city opinion director alex proyas he also directed the crow mentions this in the dark city press kit in films science fiction is always used have big spaceships blow up cities think we are little tired of that according director proyas probably the most interesting thing about dark city is its layers it is designed so that you can watch the over again and examine it from the perspective of main character other than murdoch it is philosophical piece cinematic science fiction is basically thinly disguised shootout between the good humans and the bad aliens whether they be klingons giant bugs or proponents of the dark side of the force but science fiction in books reaches beyond the shootemup level and targets the big questions questions like who are we what is the human condition what is ethical what would true human being do far from comic book style on the order of spawn batman or the mutant ninja turtles dark city not only features the showdown between good humans and powerful aliens but it also asks questions worthy of films such as brazil or blade runner dark city is what philosophers would call an existentialist screenplay little more than years ago the world was filled unhappy peasants unhappy because nearly every aspect of their lives was controlled totalitarian military conformist medieval regimes the people took refuge in religion the idea being that earthly life was time of suffering but after death heaven would be available meanwhile the state used these same ideas prop up their regimes the king was often head of the religion and therefore sanctioned heaven when science finally overturned religion the medieval dictatorships came tumbling down and were replaced democratic governments but the new fear was that the power of science and experimentation would be used create world order as darkly totalitarian as the old this is the time period when writers and philosophers such as freud kant kafka nietzsche and dostoevsky pondered what society should be and what place the individual had in it the existentialists in particular wrote about the power of the lone individual against what may be hostile indifferent or alienated universe in dark city when the last dying defeated alien asks john murdoch why the aliens scientific experiments on the human beings brains failed murdoch replies pointing his head because the human condition is not located in here

every once in while when an exceptional family comes along will attempt champion it challenging parents put their money where their mouths have been all the hubbub over the lack of films suitable for children it is remarkable how many nondisney films disappear in couple of weeks now see that in so doing have unfairly ghettoized these films so am issuing my challenge not just parents but anyone who wants support smart funny energetic filmmaking see matilda see it in theater rather than shrugging and waiting for it on video see the best have seen in not the best childrens the best period based on story roald dahl it tells of young matilda wormwood mara wilson an extraordinarily bright girl whose great misfortune it is have pair of deeply stupid parents harry danny devito crooked used car salesman and zinnia rhea perlman simpleminded bingo addict the wormwoods barely notice matilda exists and when they do it is only scold her for spending too much time reading books when they finally do send her school it is crunchem hall bleak place run cruel childhating miss agatha trunchbull pam ferris but things begin look up for matilda when she discovers sympathetic teacher miss honey embeth davidtz who nurtures her natural inquisitiveness matilda also discovers another special talent the ability move things her mind allows her help herself and miss honey overcome miss trunchbulls cruelty it was this springs james and the giant peach inspired me note that the best and most lasting tales for children tended have more than hint of darkness them and you can bet that the roald dahl responsible for the gleeful ghoulishness of james and willy wonka and the chocolate factory has more of the same in store matilda and just as james benefited from the dark sensibilities of henry selick and tim burton matilda soars on the cockeyed direction of danny devito devito made black humor key element in throw momma from the train and the war of the roses and he contributes some memorable images in one scene an unfortunate girl is made an example of miss trunchbull when she is picked up her pigtails and flung through the air like throwing hammer later an overweight boy is forced eat an entire massive cake after he is caught stealing dessert matilda is just twisted enough be perfect fairy tale it is also characteristic of the best childrens tales that they manage teach lessons in such way that children almost do not realize that they are learning them there is hilarious moment when matildas televisionaddicted father snatches away the book she is reading in wicked joke he thinks _moby dick_ is pornographic and forces her watch an inane game show hosted jon lovitz in contestants are smeared adhesive and placed in booth filled cash blowing around matilda is story promotes the value of intellectual curiosity over passive entertainment and it does so while poking holes in that most frustrating of notions for child that because am big and you are little am right and you are wrong more specifically it has as its heroine an intelligent selfconfident girl who struggles successfully against other peoples notions of how she should behave it is no coincidence that matilda was cowritten robin swicord who contributed the superb recent adaptation of little women finally matilda has that quality find rarest and most treasured in family entertainment it is family entertainment in the truest sense of the word devito knows enough make matilda fastpaced and appealing children taking deliciously nasty performance pam ferris as miss trunchbull and making it the focal point of some priceless physical comedy including great chase through her dark house the child actors are winning but never obnoxiously adorable mara wilson making matilda clever and extremely likeable character but there are also many many delights for adults including my favorite scene in matilda uses her powers frighten miss trunchbull having chalk write on chalkboard itself while matildas classmates recite in singsong fashion there is also deadpan cameo paul reubens as an fbi agent staking out matildas father cannot imagine anyone of any age leaving matilda feeling as though his or her intelligence had been insulted matilda is left me glowing good feeling will see it again and years from now will watch it my children and now will stop because somewhere near you matilda is about begin and there is seat in that theater you should be in if you have child or ever were child

usually when one is debating who the modern queen of the romantic comedy is they will bring up names like julia roberts or sandra bullock others will mention meg ryan but for me it is not even close janeane garofalo is not only the queen of the romantic comedy she is the best comic actress in right now and it is good thing she is starring in the matchmaker because without her presence the movie would be bland unfunny and dull garofalo stars as marcy tizard top aide boston senator john mcglory who is suffering in the polls in an attempt capture the irish vote he sends marcy on mission small irish town called ballinagra in search of other mcglorys that never moved america unfortunately for marcy her visit coincides the towns annual matchmaking festival things get off rocky start for marcy though she has no hotel reservations for no rational reason and the tiny confined room tired old cliche she has stay in has visitor in her bathtub his name is sean and marcy finds him repugnant at first so you can obviously tell where this is headed the movie runs into few roadblocks for instance the story is very thin none of the characters except the old local matchmaker are nearly as interesting as garofalo some of the characters like the political aide played denis leary have wandered in from completely different movie think the director realized this and decided throw in numerous shots of the beautiful irish scenery and several closeups of garofalos winning smile the strange thing is that it works garofalos charm and the irish scenery could carry the thinnest of stories and it carries this one

susan grangers review of bread and tulips first look pictures in this delightfully frothy italian romantic comedy after accidentally being left behind tour bus while on family vacation her cranky husband and two cynical teenagers rosalba licia maglietta an unhappy housewife from pescara finds herself and love in venice for the first time in years rosalbas on her own when she is abandoned at highway rest area although her philandering husband antonio catania plumbingsupply dealer orders her stay there until she is picked up she impulsively accepts ride venice bohemian paradise she is never visited rosalba finds refuge and romance fernando bruno ganz gruff icelandic waiter who offers her spare room in his modest apartment and prepares breakfast for her each morning support herself she gets job working florist antonio catania filmmaker silvio soldini gently explores the blossoming of this bored middleaged middleclass woman warmth and affection savoring special moments such as when rosalba starts playing the accordion again and abandons her maroon stretch pants silver jacket and orange sneakers for simple new redandwhite dress platformsoled espadrilles the superb actors slip into their roles seamlessly particularly luminous licia maglietta and lowkey bruno ganz along marina massironi as her nosy massagetherapist neighbor and giuseppe massironi as the inept plumberturnedprivate eye who is sent retrieve her on orders from her frantic husband who is discovered that his mistress has no interest in doing his laundry or cleaning the house on the granger movie gauge of bread and tulips is beguiling escapist as the summer ends it is magical getaway for mature audiences

know what you did last summer the first highprofile slasher thriller be released after scream and written the same screenwriter kevin williamson is stylish effective horror that became biggest hit of the fall season while scream was more knowing about the genre know what you did last summer is more reminiscent of straightforward slasher flick but it is far more intelligent than such bottomofthebarrel guilty pleasures as all nine of the friday the th films well okay jason goes hell was pure hell sit through the starts off four talented aspiring teenage friends who have just graduated from high school in their small boating town of southport c it is the th of july and they will soon be heading their separate ways kindhearted julie jennifer love hewitt and outsider ray freddie prinze jr will be headed off college while helen sarah michelle gellar who has just been honored croaker queen in the town and her ignorant jock boyfriend barry ryan phillippe are going new york become an actress and football player when the four of them travel nearby mountainside beach for the evening they are dismayed after hitting man in the road on their way home distraught and confused they decide they cannot go the police because they will be charged manslaughter so they devise plan throw the apparently dead victim off peer into the ocean in hopes no one will find him julie is apprehensive about it but is forced into it barry switch exactly year later julie still unable come terms what she did reluctantly returns home from college find that all three of her old friends are still in the town because their career plans did not work out almost immediately julie recieves an ominous letter that simply reads know what you did last summer and that is the start of their problems as they find themselves being terrorized mysterious figure dressed in fisherman gear and yielding giant hook know what you did last summer is successful horror for number of reasons the cinematography denis crossan could very well be described as hitchcockian as it put shadows fog steam and other clever devices add atmosphere the proceedings the characters particularly julie and helen are realistically written and the amazingly deals their broken relationship in few scenes is largely uncharacteristic in films of this sort and last the creates few dazzling and scary setpieces that are some of the most memorable have seen in horror movie particularly the suspenseful superbly shot sequence involving helen at her familys store the killer inside her perhaps the best character is that of missy egan anne heche lonely backwoods woman whose brother was the one julie thinks they hit heche is performance is standout as she is able create full character in only about ten minutes of screen time know what you did last summer could have been great horror movie if not for few problems prinze jr gives performance be desired here and much of his dialogue sounds wooden coming out of his mouth also the climax of the almost completely loses its frightening grip after it unveils the mystery killer who is decidedly bad actor and should not have been given any lines luckily the penultimate scene saves the disappointing finale includes an expertly crafted jumpinyourseat scare in the main roles hewitt and gellar are highly talented and hewitt especially is one of the best screamers have ever heard she honestly could give jamie lee curtis little competition for the best scream queen and gellar is touching as young woman who in the course of one year finds her dream of being an actress ultimately shattered although not up the level of either scream movies or the more recent urban legend know what you did last summer is respectable smartlyscripted slasher that firmly proved good horror movies were once again being made

labelling is sometimes everything in original mad max the opening title set the plot of the movie in near future thus making it one of the science fiction classics despite the future world being almost exactly like our own walter hill wanted the same opening title for his action classic the warriors producers were not thrilled that idea and consequently the movie lost all of its futuristic overtones on the other hand producers were right on the mark walter hill was accused of actually promoting some disturbing trends that were quite visible in contemporary america make the movie even more distant from future plot was loosely based on anabasis historical book written xenophon greek mercenary soldier who had described his adventures in ancient persia years ago instead of ancient persia movie begins in contemporary coney island where cleon dorsey wright leader of the warriors local youth gang gets invitation the great gathering of all youth gangs from the city the gathering organised gramercy park riffs most powerful gang in the city is taking place in bronx that is far away from warriors home territory but small and unarmed delegation of the warriors gets there safely thanks the general truce on the gathering cyrus roger hill charismatic leader of the riffs announces his grand plan unite all the gangs and take over the city crowd is enthusiastic but the small gang of rogues led psychopathic luther david patrick kelly uses the opportunity assassinate cyrus police simultaneously raids the gathering and in the commotion warriors get blamed the killing and their leader gets killed riffs the remaining eight led cleons lieutenant swann michael beck must now try get coney island but this time unprotected truce and instead being chased all the gangs upon its release despite the controversies and even some youth riots that were allegedly inspired it the warriors enjoyed immense popularity and very quickly received some kind of cult status however despite being one of the best movies of that year and being directed talented action director walter hill at the peak of his career the movie failed leave as strong impression the future generations as some other cinematic achievements of that same year the reason for that probably lies in fact that this movie aged very quickly if walter hills idea was warn the public about problems of urban america he failed miserably the future was much worse than his vision the youth gangs as presented in the warriors are far from shadowy armies able take over entire cities their members seem more interested in unorthodox fashion and their little petty feuds than such prosaic and for the public more annoying matters like crime in their vocabulary word arms is reserved for small knives and blunt objects and only few of them use heavy artillery like handguns they even have their own very strict and detailed laws upheld more strictly than some governments do their own many people in american cities would be more than happy see their young criminals behaving like those in the warriors some of the critics who accused hill of actually praising youth crime had lot arguments in their favour despite those objections the warriors have all the elements of very good the plot is simple and serves as good basis for numerous action scenes the fights are brilliantly choreographed and quite realistic although there is not much bloodshed or gore in the movie editing is superb events happen at quick pace the exception of middle when boring moralistic exchanges between swann and his wouldbegirlfriend mercy deborah van valkenburgh drag the plot from straight action social drama territory the soundtrack barry de vorzon is very suggestive and recognisable yet the trademark of this are the actors who showed great talent although most of them later sunk into anonymity best known of them is david patrick kelly whose superb and original performance in this later subscribed him the roles of psychopathic villains michael beck as cool almost statesmanlike leader of gang is also very good and james remar gives good contrast as his hotshot contender for top spot all in all this movie is perhaps dated yet in its hour and half can give lot more entertainment than most of the contemporary movies

for those who associate italian cinema fellini and high art the sons room is an inventive subtle alternative written directed and starring nanni moretti it takes us through the slow complicated path of bereavement slow is the best description for the at first it takes its time in establishing the habits of what appears be normal happy family father and mother both work but still find the time support their son and daughter through homework and after school activities they laugh spend free time together and reprimand the kids for innocent wrongs sigh and soft pat on the shoulder you get the feeling there is open communication and unconditional love amongst the foursome but suddenly the son is found be dead after diving accident the family dynamics begin an unpredictable descent that gives the narrative strength when you least expect it but can also be trying on the attention span though the drags and even repeats itself this can be somewhat excused as influenced the process of grieving though nanni moretti wore several hats for this production it does not come across as vanity piece one might wish he had not picked the profession of analyst for the father giovanni he stars as if only because this makes his characters reactions so predictable what saves it is well written script spare dialogue and an eclectic variety of human interaction the potency of the lies in the recreation of the tiny details of everyday life that alter due the death of close relative or that remind depressed person of loss you start take notice of the cracked dishes ignored when familial bliss was in full swing you remember bonding during the routine jogs around the block and not necessarily huge events like graduation even better are the role reversals that take place within the household while giovanni and paola laura morante do check up on their daughter irene jasmine trinca there is sense of being on autopilot not only does irene begin take care of her own needs more she will make her parents breakfast in an attempt crack their new shells life around them these scenes provide interesting portrayals of various coping mechanisms frequently crossing boundary as how much you can help yourself versus others during drastic unexpected change respectfully gender issues never enter the picture selfpropelled isolation is universal in terms of dealing so moretti intelligently uses this tool separate the family though giovanni does stop paolo from discussing andrea at party friends there is never sense that he or she is more stoic or more correct in the search restore sense of balance their lives most films that broach the topic of death utilize annoying melodrama speeches and conciliatory issues get the waterworks flowing in contrast the sons room captures more realistic depiction of the effects of death on family graciously flowing among the five stages of mourning denial depression anger bargaining acceptance through each of its main characters it is not the most engaging minutes but it is certainly easy relate

the word rest in the title should be stressed since this is movie that lacks any action scenes at all what does takes place is more based on character development the starts right in the middle of the lives of four people nick beth carol and sid what they have done earlier is for the most part only hinted at nick and beth have relationship and have decided move from enfield arizona butte montana and who thought that butte was pronounced slightly different carol is nicks exgirlfriend and beths best friend sid is jointsmoking painter that comes repaint their house before the new tenants move in obviously based on stage play the problem the movie is that there is lot of things left out it is not obvious that nick and beth are in love each other the reason why nick was fired from his job is not mentioned and why nick suddenly decide go visit his parents remain mystery when he has not seen them for many years set in small fictional town in arizona was good move since this makes the focus on the four characters and not on their surroundings the name of the city is not important this could take place anywhere four young people in house discussing life and the future particularly impressive is bridget fonda as beth who end up in bed sid when her fiance nick leaves her not an actress that have found interesting earlier or seen many pictures but will keep an eye on her in the future interesting trivia this was rated in the us but rated barntill ten in sweden wich means that anyone at any age can see it

airplane is considered among many be the epitome of satire filmmaking after all it is brought us one of the best known satire writingdirecting teams even if most people do not recognize the names behind the films they are bound recognize the titles airplane top secret the naked gun and hot shots name few but although the zuckerabrahamszucker team was first introduced the kentucky fried movie in airplane remains the true cornerstone of their work and their directorial debuts in the seventies disaster films seemed be at an all time high films like earthquake the towering inferno and the poseidon adventure were big hits there was also series about the disasters that can arise when traveling plane series that spanned the entire decade and so in we were introduced new airplane disaster this time the disaster had nothing do maniacal hijacker or crashing into the ocean it had do bad fish airplane is the story of ted striker robert hays an exfighterpilot who has never gotten over the fact that decision he had make in the midst of war led the death of six er seven comrades unable stop living in the past teds world fell apart he spent his time moving from city city without ever having stable job and eventually as we begin this is getting dumped his lover flight attendant elaine dickinson julie hagerty in desperate attempt not lose her ted buys ticket for the same flight elaine is working unfortunately she is unsympathetic and even criticizes ted for following her leaves him wallowing in selfpity in the midst of it all something happens someone gets sick then another then another soon the whole plane is full of deathlyill chicagobound people and when the pilots get sick played peter graves kareem abduljabbar and frank ashmore who will save the day gee wonder of course the main draw here is the nonstop whizbang comedy hefty dose of both visual and spoken gags although had seen this movie few times before was still laughing thru the entire thing the most fun character far is the doctor played leslie nielsen he is dry subtle sterotypically straightfaced doctor that ends up saying some of the funniest lines of the in like this you are not really expecting an elaborate production so one cannot complain about the amateurish quality what you can complain about is the absolutely annoying johnny played stephen stucker this character is pointless nauseating and very unfunny do not know why he was put in there and do not think anybody will find good excuse and when the nears an end it slows down quite bit almost getting old you gotta give it movie that only runs minutes and can feel two hours long aside from that airplane is really topnotch spoof that will likely forever be known as spoof classic it would be good choice pop in the vcr group of friends especially if they have not seen it and if they ask what the plot is just tell em it is synopsis of the basic storyline of the but that is not important right now if you have seen the you will understand

this is the movie not the perfume slow moving stylish psychological thriller in imitation of hitchcocks vertigo it is adapted from an original story brian de palma and paul schrader and is directed de palma and scripted schrader set in new orleans it shows the wealthy michael courtland cliff robertson sitting on top of the world celebrating his tenth wedding anniversary party in his mansion as his lovely wife elizabeth genevi ve bujold and young daughter amy blackman both look up him beaming joy his realestate development partner bob la salle john lithgow proposes toast him and their prosperous business while his high society friends give him their best wishes upon retiring for the night his daughter and wife are kidnapped in their bedroom and he is left ransom note deliver tomorrow or they will be killed inspector brie stanley reyes comes up plan put in phony money and transmitter in the briefcase exchange as that will lead them the kidnappers but the kidnappers burst out of the house surrounded the police taking the two victims them and in the pursuing police chase the kidnappers car explodes and goes over the bridge where none of the bodies were found grieving the loss of his wife and child the guiltridden michael builds them tomb on the expensive land they were develop sixteen years later he goes his partner bob on vacation and he revisits florence italy where he met his wife when he goes the church where they met he sees young girl who looks exactly like his wife her name is sandra portinari genevi ve bujold and she is working there restoring art that is decaying he falls instantly in love her and does not heed bobs warnings that she might be gold digger and decides take her back new orleans and marry her sandra becomes his second chance prove his love as he thinks he can finally put the past behind him the surprises come were not really all that surprising as the beauty in the storytelling is almost exclusively in the understated acting the soul stricken cliff robertson the emotionally impactful performance genevi ve bujold and the competent acting of john lithgow it plays too much like rehash of the masters work break any new ground yet it is still thrilling in its own way

the farrelly brothers third after dumb and dumber and kingpin brings together the reallife couple of cameron diaz and matt dillon some nasty humour cute dog and mix of love fate and romance plot highschool nerd ted gets lucky when the cutest girl in his class asks him the prom unfortunately for ted he accidentally gets part of his male anatomy ouch caught in his zipper and misses the big night thirteen years later ted still cannot get mary out of his mind and hires private detective dillon find her once found it turns out that mary has more than one suitor and that is when the real fun begins critique likeable comedy few extremely funny scenes some funny looking people and plot that will not ever put you sleep having said that must admit that did like the farrellys two previous films more than this one but that is saying lot since really did love those earlier pics this one is also quite funny but it did not really blow me away like the others then again maybe my expectations were too high then again maybe should shut up and write little more about the and less about my supposed subconscious reasons for likingdisliking the continuing where their other pictures left off the farrellys create cutesy world of people strange and endearing qualities and simple plot tie them all together this one also includes plenty of toilet humour but also some borderline funmaking of the disabled and mentallychallenged must admit that really was not sure whether laugh at some points or not not good place be having said that the scenes that did tear through the audience and yours truly were extremely hilarious and went on for several minutes after the punchline the laughter practically killed out the next scene for one of the best ones in the movie something do hair gel on the negative end did not like the musical interludes of jonathan richman that ran through the entire picture found them quite useless unfunny and distracting also found that lot of the funnier scenes had already been shown in the films trailer and of course never quite buy the fact that these beautiful intelligent single women still cannot seem find the right guy see kiss the girls did really like all of the actors in the especially ben stiller who appears be solidifying his mark as great comical actor this picture and one of my favourites from flirting disaster also liked matt dillon his big teeth and lee evans his superb fauxsympathy british accent funny stuff also make sure that you stay for the credits because there is an entire montage of outtakes from the that plays under lipsynched version of build me up buttercup is really cool overall cute comedy decent premise and few particularly hilarious scenes little known facts the farrellys big break came when they somehow got copy of their script dust dust into the hands of eddie murphy via murphys neighbour they only found out about murphys interest when they saw eddie mention the script on the david letterman show one night matt dillon is high school dropout in between acting gigs dillon has branched out into the restaurant business close home in his native new york he coowns both bar called the whiskey and swanky uptown eatery called the falls cameron diaz stands started working as model at the early age of and loves cats ben stillers father is jerry stiller he played george costanzas jason alexander father on tvs seinfeld peter farrelly has written novel entitled outside providence is currently being filmed starring alec baldwin rob moran who plays the cop in this also played the millionaire bowler in kingpin and the bartender in dumb and dumber he is old friends the farrelly brothers from college and is currently married entertainment tonight anchorcorrespondant julie moran harland williams who plays the nutty hitchhiker in this also played state trooper in the farrellys earlier dumb and dumber and was the star of the unfortunate rocket man

when jim henson passed away he left behind diverse legions of fans and company whose ultimate success it now seems hinged on his input jim henson productions and the creature shop are still thriving financially but as the last two muppet films or that silly computergenerated monkey from lost in space demonstrate the thrill and genius are gone am not sure the dark crystal made today would generate from an audience of kids five fifty the same awefilled response an allpowerful crystal has cracked causing the leaders of the green world split apart into two beings the big gentle mystics and the vulturelike skeksis the mystics send jen naive gelfling boy on mission find the shard that cracked away must be reinserted into the crystal before the skeksis become eternal rulers before the great conjunction of three suns along the way jen encounters and teams up the only other gelfling alive the rebecca demornaylike kira an ogrewitch named aughra who removes her eyes look at things and spasticbutfriendly tumbleweedlike animal named fizzgig much of the beauty in the dark crystal is simple tale though it does not condescend any viewer lies in its art direction and creature design the puppeteering is phenomenalobserve the scenes in jen plays his flute or the landwalker chasebut must stress that any thoughts of strings and hands and remote controls all but vanish in the opening moments of the picture delicatelynarrated john baddeley absorbing prologue the voice work in the muppet regulars and irregulars is toneperfect as well trevor jones score should not be discounted it contributes the almost as an unseen character suppose due the complexity involved in executing movie of this nature that it could not be helped but wish the was longer jen and kira have wonderful well chemistry and more scenes of them quietly conversing would have been appreciated the dark crystal has very small cult following the weaker labyrinth is probably betterknown is upsetting friend of mine related story me that henson was pressured into planting humans among labyrinths creatures due the financial failure of peopleless the dark crystal that never quite found its footing it played like an acidtrip episode of the muppet show david bowie as guesthost borrowing from tolkien and pandering tolkiens fanbase suppose just made labyrinth sound appetizing certain sector of the public the dark crystal deserved and still deserves bigger audience it is the best kind of childrens entertainment elegant fantastical and courageously unhip brian henson fortunate son keep looking back at this your fathers masterpiece

bob the happy bastards quickie review the mummy brendan frasers stuck in the past again but at least this time he has something better do than quote sitcom lines and try woo alicia silverstone fraser is the lead star of the mummy the second directorial effort from action director stephen sommers who also brought us the decent thrill ride that was deep rising it is rough adaptation of the and say rough because it focuses more on special effects than on some guy in bandages like boris karloff was engulfed in but who cares the movie has sort of swashbuckling quality it you cannot get from oh say godzilla or armageddon fraser plays soldier who gets premonition during battle soldiers in an egyptian ground basically it is little sign from the mummy buried underneath priest named ihmoetep who was buried alive for taking part of murdering the king and making out his mistress his plan wake back up and wake her up also making him invincible of course fraser returns the site years later librarian rachel weisz and her brother john hanna along former buddy of his deep risings kevin oconnor and some americans and guess what yup ihmoetep arnold vosloo awakens and wreaks havoc fire flies from the sky flesheating beetles crawl about and well ihmoeteps plan begins unfold ok so it is not really all that new story but the way sommers tells it is entertaining enough the special effects from industrial light and magic are top notch and the acting from fraser and weisz is not half bad either the action is pretty intense favorite scene the sandstorm and there are few shocking scenes just jolt you horrorloving folks as well no it is no phantom menace beater but if you are looking for solid warmup the summer movie season you will not find better under wraps than the mummy if this does not give fraser forgiveness from blast from the past and encino man then nothing will

the laserman somehow the title of writerdirectorproducer peter wangs conjures up images of superheroes like ultraman and spiderman you kind of expect an adventure flick about crime fighter who can shoot laser beams from his fingertips as it turns out the laserman _is_ about crime and about laser beams but there are not any superheroes instead wangs is populated group of refreshingly offbeat characters living in the ultimate cultural melting pot new york city the laserman is comic brew celebrates ethnicity eccentricity and electricity the tells the bizarre story of arthur weiss marc hayashi chineseamerican laser scientist whose life becomes incredibly hectic after he accidentally kills his lab assistant in an experiment he loses his job but finds work mysterious company secretly plans use laser technology commit dastardly deeds arthurs professional life is cluttered moral dilemmas his personal life on the other hand is cluttered colorful friends and quirky relatives in fact arthur is far the blandest character in the despite charismatic performance hayashi the san franciscobased actor whose films include chan is missing and the karate kid ii it is the auxiliary characters who give the laserman its unique spark arthurs notsotypical jewish mother ruth for example is convinced that chinese soul is trapped in her jewish body she has dyed her red hair black she takes herbal medicine daily and she is perpetually cooking up strange delicacies such as matzo balls in soy saucethe ultimate fusion of jewish and chinese cuisine veteran stage actress joan copeland takes the part and runs it almost stealing the movie in the process she plays ruth as driven woman determined overcome her genetic heritage immersing herself in chinese culture arthurs girlfriend janet maryann urbano is kooky freespirit who would rather meditate than copulate her ultimate goal is orgasm through zen meditation arthurs best friend joey tony leung is small time thief who hustles everything from microwave ovens machine guns joey is married arthurs jewish sister but he is also having an affair chinese immigrant who works in whore house arthurs yearold son jimmy played the amazingly adorable david chan ishorror of horrorsbad at math he finds it impossible meet his fathers lofty expectations the various people in arthurs life come together form rich tapestry of humanity like wangs earlier great wall about san francisco family visiting relatives in china the laserman revolves around cultural differences every character in the is in some way or another trying find his identitystruggling negotiate balance between his native culture and the american way the movie also offers provocative look at technology wang appears in the movie as lieutenant lu detective who is fed up machines even though he relies on them do his job the views technology wary eye acknowledging its necessity while at the same time realizing its potential dangers wang raises the timehonored question of whether scientists should be held responsible for their inventions was einstein responsible for the abomb is arthur weiss responsible for his lasers the movie pits spirituality against technology man against machine and the result is draw according the technology has its place but we must employ it great forethought and caution ironically its very nature the laserman is triumph of technologythe technology of filmmaking wangs direction is exquisite especially during the tense finale in the director frantically crosscuts between the various subplots perhaps in homage w griffith cinematographer ernest dickerson who has worked on all of spike lees films gives the laserman distinctive artistic look mason darings score includes sendup of bach is right on target the laserman is an ambitious endeavor is be applauded but it is sometimes ambitious fault wang serves up so many slices of life in the that it is hard digest them all for instance one character arthurs sister has negligible screen time and consequently we just do not care about her marital problems in weaving his web wang has included few too many strands overall however the laserman is charmingly eclectic concoction on the surface the is light and bouncy comedythriller overflowing whimsical humor and visual style the heavier issues emerge only when you take deeper look at the you can ponder the moral questions or you can just sit back and enjoy the absurdity of life in china town

imagine this you are given sword and shield and very basic minimal training man you do not know tells you that this will be the last day that you will live you are thrown into an arena thousands of spectators wanting see you die you frantically monitor several closed doors in seconds will release vicious enemies prepared destroy you you watch as the innocent friends you made in the last few days are murdered in cold blood if you are lucky enough survive this chaos thrown at you you know you are going have do it all over again tomorrow eventually know matter how strong or skilled you are you are going die this is the life of gladiator you will never have be gladiator and after seeing ridley scotts powerful gladiator you will be thankful for that his new scott has returned cinema the fascinating age of the ancient roman empire and like those preceding it spartacus and ben hur gladiator has nearly everything going for it strong lead actor wonderful supporting cast eyecatching special effects and great script since the two aforementioned films came out before the prime target viewers of gladiator teenagers thirtyyearold males were around whole new genre may just be reborn and revisited from weak beginning the starts off extremely gloomy and inauspicious romes best general maximus russell crowe who has helped the empire conquer nearly everywhere they have attempted is currently in the year d that is waging war against germania scott shoots the gory battle in an awkward style similar that of saving private ryan but much less effective it is blurry in slow motion and the sound is muted as soon as this artistic method began it was hard tell what was what and who was who it is good thing scott stops this after the first twenty minutes or else gladiator would have been torture watch instead the general swears he will get out after this battle he wants go back his family and his crops he wants quiet life but unexpectedly he gets anything but that the dying emperor of rome marcus aurelius richard harris decides have maximus appointed new emperor of rome once he dies he asks maximus restore the republic giving more power the senators all of this does not go well for aurelius son commodus joaquin phoenix who was expecting his father name him the new emperor jealous and upset commodus kills his own father names himself emperor kills maximus wife and son and attempts kill maximus but maximus is able escape his own death and vows kill commodus and fulfill marcus aurelius wishes now slave the only way he can win his own freedom and complete his goal is become winning gladiator who eventually are released for their success story of betrayal and promises gladiator is more than just mindless action flick you actually care about the characters sometimes even the evil villain commodus who is just young man as determined make rome one way as maximus is determined make it the other way phoenix plays his character brilliantly think of commodus as the percy wetmore of pantwetter the green mile of the roman empire whiny sleazy respectmebecausemyfatherwasagoodman brat who hates when he is not the center of attention every scene we see commodus he is either crying or he looks like he has just been crying phoenix has definitely matured as an actor since die for and gladiator shows he is more than just rivers little brother crowe is also excellent as the films grislyfaced hero maximus is one of the few characters in recent cinema who actually has emotions this guy actually acts like anyone in his situation would act he is no invincible superhero who only blurts out oneliners he believe it or not acts like human being the rest of the cast including richard harris djimon hounsou walter hill derek jacobi and connie nielsen are also first rate ridley scott using outstanding special effects has brilliantly recreated the roman coliseum the loudness of the roman mob and the city of rome in general the visuals are breathtaking and voluminous like cleopatra of the year the costuming is also wonderful from the detailed shields and armor the exquisite dress of the upperclass politicians gladiator is another movie you have see on the big screen get the most out of the experience along action fans should have plenty see in theaters this week and should expect much more excitement come this summer of

so here is the second of remakes of classic horror movies the first was the dumb pathetic but ok remake of the classic the haunting now comes the highly awaited remake of house on haunted hill the classic starred vincent price as man who pays group of people stay in his house if they survive the night they get the money if not well you get the jurisdiction having not yet seen the dvd on its way was not sure if would really like the remake but sure enough it comes through and has great storyline fall back on geoffrey rush in fantastic role an incredible performance is steven price the owner of an amusement park destined scare the wits out of people his wife evelyn price is throwing party her friends steven dismays at the idea and makes his own list somehow someone or something changes that list and five other people are invited the party eddie taye diggs an exbaseball player sarah ali carter an exassistant who can rewire anything melissa brigette wilson talkshow host in sorts dr blackburn peter ghallager and watson chris kattan smartmouthed humorist in ways what he is gonna do is pay these five people dollars if they can survive through the night if they can they get the money if not well they do not the house on haunted hill used be an insane asylum years before mental patients broke out and killed the dr there forcing him lock the place up because if he died so did they everyone who was in there burned death now it is steven prices home and he is throwing this party for these five people what starts out as seemingly normal night turns into horrifying blood splattering night the deep dark secrets of what really happened in that asylum and why those guests are actually there are revealed onebyone the people start disappear conspiracies start turn up and steven price finds out that his house may be alive after all the people find rooms once held mental patients rooms once had people dying rooms may still contain these people now these five people must try and survive the night and try and survive the house and they must survive each other terrorfying results since officially have not seen the original cannot say is better can say however liked this movie geoffrey rush gives one in million performance as the rich steven price and does great job doing vincent price role famke jansen as his wife was great and even kind of eerie at times ali carter and taye diggs sort of become the main characters and ali carter who debuted in varsity blues gives fantastic performance here as does taye diggs chris kattan gives us great comic relief and the movie contains lot of comical lines peter ghallager and brigette wilson were great as well and gave commanding performances as potential victims the plot was well conceived and was very absorbing the movie has atmosphere the whole way through that is disturbing and creepy and even sometimes downright scary found even the opening credits me little ominous one thing knew not expect was haunting type movie special effects galore even though it had fantastic gore and special effects the movie has only million dollar budget doesns show all the way through but you can tell the movie was written well and it is only major flaw is the underdeveloped characters and plot holes that we are left the ending is quite clever and some may not even get it must say house on haunted hill was surprise was expecting another haunting special effects no scares and dumb ending instead found good halloween movie gore scares and great acting house on haunted hill is one of those movies you really cannot take seriously though it is wellmade movie good storyline it still has some flaws but besides that the movie is fun smart and scary and makes us wonder why remakes like this cannot be made all the time

apollo is simply one of the most dramatic this summer apart from swashbuckling braveheart director and former actor ron howard splash backdraft far away most noted for his dramatic making displays again his brilliance in creating drama and suspense in apollo being the second largest box office hit in the us this summer more than us million in the states alone this is his most successful effort yet perhaps one of the most appealing feature of this is the pool of talented actors such as tom hanks gump himself kevin bacon footloose tremors few good men etc gary sinise forrest gump bill paxton aliens true lies boxing helena and ed harris the abyss just cause all of whom gave good performances in their respective roles apollo was the second worst accident ever occur in the history of us spaceflight the worst being the challenger accident jim lovell hanks the mission commander together his crew fred haise paxton and last minute replacement tom swigert bacon are put the ultimate test when part of their command module explodes on the third day of the mission more than three quarters way the moon suspense and drama ensue as the three men are left in space their spaceship out of control and the problem of surviving the journey home if they ever reach it ed harris and gary sinise who play respectively the man in charge of the entire mission control and the astronaut who was supposed fly but was diagnosed measles both delve into their roles superbly audiences are shown the chaotic and worrisome state of the entire ground control crew as they frantically attempt come up ideas on how save the astronauts from hurtling into space also there are quite number of real news footages were broadcast during the accident took the entire us nation into days of drama in the special effects digital domain are up standard and the music suits the suspense and drama very well thanks filmmusic maestro james horner watch out for the launching sequence it is simply one of the most breathtaking scenes of the bad point though apollo features much technical jargon and many physics concepts in its script those who consider themselves scientifically illiterate might have slight problem understanding what caused this and what caused that during the course of the show this is however just minor point just forget all those technical bullshit and immerse yourselves into the drama and suspense throughout the you should enjoy it

in _daylight_ sylvester stallone breaks no new ground cinematically speaking but he covers familiar territory quite well yesterday as was going about my business in the university bookstore noticed this stand these _daylight_ movie posters on it had never heard of the movie so stopped check it out it turned out that they were giving away free passes the movie for people who had or applied for the credit card they were offering so shrugged thought hey they probably will not give me the card anyway and could always use free movie so signed up all in all do not think got that bad of deal either rob cohen who has previously brought us such films as _dragon the bruce lee story_ and more recently _dragonheart_ gee wonder if he likes dragons for some reason you think now brings us very nicely executed disaster picture fx industrial light and magic about the aftereffects of an explosion that collapses busy tunnel between new york and new jersey sylvester stallone plays kit latura who is essentially carbon copy of the character he played in _cliffhanger_ paramedic on the outs because he made mistake that got people killed when the crisis hits he is in the right place at the right time and takes it upon himself go in and get everybody out there are other similarities _cliffhanger_ too perhaps the only real difference is that _cliffhanger_ had villain where _daylight_s bad guy is mother nature in fact had the two movies been made in hong kong this might have been titled _cliffhanger ii_it bears the same relationship that that most hk sequels do their predecessors the first halfhour of _daylight_ is setup subplots are woven and the mechanism of the disaster is assembled we meet all the important people toxic waste disposal truck drivers young frustrated jilted rejected playwright family struggling stay together an older couple and their dog truckload of prisoners an ad agency executive tunnel police officer stallone and others we watch the trucks trundle toward their destination we watch stallone and so many others driving toward the tunnel for their various reasons and then thirty minutes into the _boom_ and it is big one from there on in it is sly stallone the rescue and rescue he does enduring batterings beatings falls repeated immersion in degree water explosions mud rats and constant setbacks before going on save the day slystyle again there is nothing new here and yet there does not need be the fun of _daylight_ is not in the story but in the execution the specialeffects are firstrate thanks industrial light and magic and the ensemble cast works well together once the hits its stride it carries the viewer right along the finish very few jars along the way this review is copyright christopher meadows permission granted for distribution
