perhaps the most dramatic changes in the motion picture industry in this decade have do special effects there is no question that actionadventure and sciencefictionaction movies are now judged the character of their light and noise whereas classic adventure pics of the last twenty years such as raiders of the lost ark were made in grand traditional fashion contemporary films like jurassic park are multimilliondollar creations of computer technology the latest in this visually awesome series of movies the wachowski brothers the matrix is testament the skilled use of special effects and its ability enhance movies story unlike many scifi movies promote themselves as effectsheavy blockbusters but fail deliver on that promise the matrix is carefully constructed special effects event it runs minutes in length and employs countless number of computerized tricks range from gimmick grandiose and the quality of the effects remains constant throughout the films length contrary popular trend the matrix commits itself being spectacle of light and sound in this regard the movie is something like card sharp its flashy mass stripped away the matrix would be quite shallow and untalented the script is characteristically weak and the dialogue suffers in lieu of far more innovative visual approach but like the card sharp the matrix wows its audience such high degree that actual content is irrelevent the viewers do not care about what the matrix has say as long as the next special effects sequence is right around the corner and right around the corner they usually are for the script tells fastpaced albeit frequently revisited story as the movie explains the world as we know it is nothing but an elaborate computer program constructed an artificial intelligence for the purpose of placating mankind billions of human beings lie in this dormant state while the intelligence the matrix farms our life energy only select group of individuals knows of the real world and particularly ingenious squad of these rebels is led ultracool morpheus laurence fishburne morpheus and his crew recruit computer expert named neo keanu reeves believing he is prophesied individual who will help them overthrow the matrix and return peace earth the cast plays out this story in stylish fashion the set design is very dynamic running the gambit between cramped and dreary bright and airy the costumes as well as the actors who wear them add the roles for instance the manifested antagonists in the movie group of agents created the matrix in its computer program all dress in matching secret servicewear the rebel fighters on the other hand dress in rich hues of leather the casting cannot be criticized for the typically stoic reeves is not required say much and laurence fishburne gets plenty of time be so damn cool supports in carrieanne moss joe pantoliano and hugo weaving are all effectual one of the best comparisons thw matrix is last years science fiction masterpiece dark city particularly if one ponders how this same premise would have worked from different approach the alex proyas was far more dark and introspective requiring bit of thought before themes became clear here the wachowski brothers have managed construct thrillride motion picture little abandon and much noise the better picture between the two depends on the viewer but the key the success of the matrix is that the noise did not get in the way of the fun

let me open this one confession love cop movies adore them such an unwavering near foolish passion that was actually one of the first in line see one tough cop starring the smirkiest of the baldwin brothers steven was it any good well just about as good as baldwins steven seagal impression for those have confused the answer is resounding no now let me clarify do not love just any cop movie am not too keen on the smug buddy cop flicks that were so in vogue in the and now slowly gulp returning thanks jackie chan and chris tucker am partial those gritty earthy cop dramas like serpico donnie brasco and the french connection problem is these films come along just about as often as george bush makes cogent point so whenever true cop movie does hit multiplexes come running towards it like an eager puppy and inevitably leave head bowed tripping over my squiggly tail so what is it about cop movies that transform me into moron willing shell out for movie called one tough cop actually sounds lot like wiseguy spinoff no truth is am sucker for those barren streets that gritty graffiti strewn modernist jungle where dangerous criminals lurk and cops like modern day knights must shield us from their iniquitous clutches yes it is all very corny and awfully boys clubish am guessing is precisely where these feelings come from as little tots us boys are brought up create our own wars gi joes enact cops and robbers or cowboy and indian fantasies etc the best gritty cop films tap into those gleeful adolescent fantasies and heighten them turning it all into an existential nightmare of thin moral lines and psychological chaos as an adult my tastes have not changed all that drastically sure can get cerebral high from the emotional complexities of krzysztof kieslowski but still delight at the promise guy could potentially bring now what if it is the cops whore the corrupt ones ooh that one really gets me going these protectors using all that at their service taking advantage of others for their own gain throw courtroom drama yech into the pot and you have the tremendously absorbing sidney lumet prince of the city how absorbing is prince of the city you ask so damn absorbing that when the shifts from gritty undercover cop drama courtroom drama subgenre loath the way kristy swanson must loath sarah michelle gellar remained completely and utterly involved the stars treat williams who gives the kind of performance that should have skyrocketed his career up the level that brad pitt currently resides at since was hatched mere two years prior the release of prince of the city cannot provide an answer as why it did not though judging from his recent roles in tripe like deep rising and dead heat would guess that it probably has something do quite few bad career moves like mickey rourke and eric roberts both of whom are currently doing time in direct video purgatory williams is talented leading man who did not make it where he should have if there was any justice in this dog gone world keanu reeves would be the one banished direct video hell here the actor is given role not all that dissimilar from al pacinos in serpico also directed lumet williams plays danny ciello member of an elite squad of police officers who take down drug dealers on the gritty prejuliani streets of new york they work without uniforms or hours much like paid vigilantes and that analogy is more than apt seeing as how the bunch are kinda sorta forced into using corrupt means get the job done the squad relies entirely on informants low level junkies gain access the big wigs and in order obtain the info they seek they sometimes have provide the junkies the junk of their choice danny has done this and though he is fairly honorable guy who took the job in order do good his intentions have gotten bit skewed along the way he seeks redemption and concludes that the best way go about getting it is talking internal affairs who then convince him go undercover as double agent he does so one condition he will not rat on his partners right away we know that that is exactly what he will have do and watching the movie build that is thrilling in the way that any great character driven story can be undercover cop films are almost innately exciting even the kind that pull out all the cliches like in too deep how can one not be moved the issues of betrayal ambiguity and the danger in putting oneself in such risky position prince of the city takes all this and charges it perceptive hard boiled script and taut unintrusive direction old pro sidney lumet as well as handful of intense performances most notably treat lumets greatest contribution the movie is how he lays back and lets the camera soak up the action his scenes transition rapidly from one the next building layers of tension and he rarely holds for reaction shots instead he clicks away at precisely the moment character stops yakking lumets worst tendency is one that many makers especially oliver stone tend overuse he relies little too heavily on actors shouting their lines at each other presumably in order ratchet up the tension this is not as much problem here as it was in night falls on manhattan lumets most recent cop lawyer endeavor movie that nearly gave me an ulcer from just watching though of late lumet has made several really awful career choices maybe he and treat should get together for drink or something the most recent completely unnecessary remake of gloria here he was on sustaining tension in that runs for minutes not one dull spot some of the formula pictures like the best are the most simplistic often forgets how easy it is make these kinds of pictures even tolerable of course cop movies are not popular anymore yes buddy cop flicks are popular but those are more like extended sitcoms gunfire amid the punch lines but just look at the average action movies flicks so bloated and full of unnecessary fat like the boring love interest that serves no purpose other than stall the action and demonstrate that our hero is not gay the lame comic relief character who is never funny and on and on for all its moral ambiguities prince of the city is back the basics cop courtroom drama that leaves out all the crap and really thrills it focuses completely on its story and its characters all of whom are completely believable from the cops the lawyers the junkies there is great scene early on where an irate williams shouts at an ia officer and looks as if he is about go into one of those corny braveheart inspirational speeches but instead he breaks down in front of the cop and begins sobbing this is scene that would never make it into michael bay even though bruce willis sacrifices his life at the end of armageddon not one damn tear it would be cut out because the director would say oh that makes him too human excuse me weak in the very next scene danny speaks in hushed raspiness straining get the words out he is lost his voice does that little itty bitty detail matter maybe not most but it sure made my night and in sprawling epic of corruption greed betrayal and violence it is nice see that someone is paying attention the little things

carla gugino graduates from high school and instead of staying in her small farming town she goes college in california there she meets the residential advisor pauly shore who is city boy when gugino goes back home for thanksgiving she brings shore her and her parents lane smith and cindy pickett are less than thrilled dan gauthier guginos boyfriend from high school proposes gugino gugino is not ready for anything like this so she makes up the story that she is engaged shore she and shore have make it look like they are engaged while her parents try make it end forget jurassic park cliffhanger the firm and last action hero soninlaw is the see this summer soninlaw is great romantic comedy that should please the viewers especially fans of the wiez when soninlaw is long gone and forgotten the blockbuster summer films will still be playing and you will have chance see them then this could also make great video fare for those that are leery of spending seven dollars on it nothing will be lost watching it on television screen although the basic story line has been done many many times before the is still fun watch the laughs are plentiful especially when the wiez is around the way some of the jokes are done are new even though some of the jokes are old there are also several new jokes that at least have not seen before still when presented right even old material can be funny still this is just basically light comedy that is great see if you are in the right mood that does not contain much violence or any nudity that is definitely worth full ticket price the cast for this does an excellent job pauly shore encino man is the star attraction of this he is great and knows how entertain the audience pauly shore just seems take over the entire screen when he is on expressions and comments that are hilarious this would definitely not have been as good anyone else in this role carla gugino does very good job as the farm girl gone city girl she makes her character believable on some levels yet interesting at the same time the person who played the grandfather mason adams believe also does great job the way he delivered his lines kept me laughing throughout the time that he was on the screen patrick renna who played guginos little brother was little annoying but no where as near as macaulay culkin and for only part of the time so can forgive him tiffaniamber thiessen killer among friends saved the bell does reasonably good job for the time that she is on screen she shows that she may have potential in movies if she can get out of the corny young adults programming on television she was not given overly much do in the but what she had she does good job

the soldiers of three kings have taken their cue from movies about vietnam fitting since the mediasaturated gulf war became pop entertainment while driving through long flat iraqi desert in humvee bart simpson hood ornament one of the men under special forces sgt maj archie gates who is steering command requests beach boys tune these men want their apocalypse now moment only instead of surfing they bop the music and skeet shoot out the back of the vehicle armed automatic rifles our three kings okay four are good fighters but they do not necessarily take operation desert storm seriouslyit is reprieve from their hellish day jobs they are gates new father sgt troy barlow wahlberg sgt chief elgin cube and pvt conrad vig music video director jonze at storys start president bush has declared ceasefire and american troops are tying up loose ends barlow elgin and vig discover during round up of iraqi captives an assmap that points bunker filled gold bullion gates leaves his jurisdiction commandeer the situation he proposesdemandsthat barlow elgin and vig join him on treasure hunt ditching his escort relentless reporter named adriana cruz nora dunn is easy so is finding the treasure until the four men realize the magnitude of discord still breathing in iraq saddams men are threatening the dictators detractors citizens of his own country violence when gates and company arrive at the bunker stolen truck ready loot the unarmed rebels want help bush encouraged them rise up against the government but provided no military support for such cause gates convinces the vaults guards that this is postwar mission and even accepts their assistance in loading the truck the situation could go off without hitch the former enemies bear no grudges but the money hungry gates has conscience and when one female bystander is shot sadistic grunt before these americans have left the scene he orders barlow elgin and vig open fire on the surrounding arab forces the result barlow is kidnapped and the filmmakers imply that these wouldbe kings are seeing more action than they ever did during wartime barlow is eventually locked in dank room and wired up shocking device his interrogator lost his family the bombs and he wants barlow imagine the demise of his own wife and child he does in chilling lasting images liked these scenes best because the political became personal it is one thing champion the plight of thousands it is another see ceiling cave in atop baby in crib russell has shocked us before his first spanking the monkey is about young mans affair his bedridden mother it is great his second flirting disaster features character who has an armpit fetish one could argue that it is easier make an audience react such sexual deviance than explosions though russell disturbs us in three kings being nononsense about the violence when barlow conjures the detonation of his suburban home russell mutes the soundwe are paying attention the debris instead of thx bombast three kings is russells first visually arresting picture stylistically it stands apart from other war dramas newton thomas sigels cinematography of the exteriors is overexposed and extremely grainy is of course entirely appropriate one practically breaks out in sweat staring at the screen friend enthusiastically added it is like having sand in your eyes this also helps blur the fact that the actual locations are far removed from the persian gulf facade three kings was shot in arizona california and mexico russell throws plenty at sigels camera for it observeas was the case russells previous efforts the most absurd moments are also the films most realistic even the most poignant we watch bullet puncture an organ from the inside if anything three kings settles down and stops surprising us its climax is pure no doubt the answer why major studio felt comfortable getting into bed the indieminded russell subsequently the characters become more cartoonishbarlows posttorture revelry felt phony and chief strong presence in the first third fails escape the godfearingultraseriousantiracistblackmanofpower clich so much for cube avoiding token status the arab players on the other hand duck stereotype clooney too transforms into blandly heroic protestormarching the rebels waited for him shout let my people go hayseed vig notwithstanding the protagonists are very intelligent and selfserving too had glimmer of hope based on russells filmography that our antiheroes would revert their greedy selves at some juncture it is not spoiling much write that then again what historical importance would such nastiness serve there is already enough cynicism in the films mentioning of kuwait is oilinfested waters russell offers the masses primer on the oftdismissed gulf conflict and pulled off neat trick war tale full of battles that takes place after truce has been declared if he set out make something sociallyculturallypoliticallyglobally significant he succeeded flair

bill condons gods and monsters is fascinating look into the last days in the life of gay director james whale ian mckellan who made the horror classics frankenstein and bride of frankenstein since was unfamiliar of whale prior viewing the there is no way know how accurate the is but suspect that much of it only came from whales inner fantasies and hallucinations whale who fought in wwi and then went on become known for his work on horror pictures decided fifteen years before his death at age quit filmmaking once homosexual scandal broke out involving him as the tells it during the end of his life whale at his large home in a became infatuated the tall handsome and much younger man clayton boone brendan fraser who was working as the gardener at his home james whale we learn quickly was what many people refer him as in the dirty old man in one of the opening scenes young enthusiast visits whales home interview him and whale agrees on one condition for every question he answers the young man must take off an article of clothing because of this episode we know exactly what it is whale wants when he asks clayton pose for him for painting later making the excuse that his bright white shirt is disracting only so he will take it off clayon agrees and does not really think much of this much the warnings of his friends becoming more and more intrigued in the stories whale tells him about his past certainly the relationship between whale and boone is headed for downfall since whale starts grow deep love for this young man even though boone is not gay and whale himself realizes he is nearing the conclusion his life as he begins seldom suffer mild strokes and moments of true catharsis gods and monsters is an intimate and seemingly respectful portrait of director who was forced become somewhat of an outcast due his sexual preference and never got the recognition he would have liked since he longed be referred as motion picture director rather than horror director and in one heartbreaking scene he attends party boone being his guest held director george cuckor and finds that many of the other attendees do not recognize him anymore it is evident that whales first love in his life was making movies and when his career ultimately fell apart so did his passion in life as played brilliantly ian mckellen james whale comes off as sad but dignified man and person who was not afraid stand out from others just as long as he knew he was being true himself he never hid the fact that he was gay however even if it meant threatening his filmmaking profession and it was this unblinking honesty that made him great person through the complicated relationship that develops between whale and boone boone of course only things of whale as possible friend or someone he can talk while it means so much more whale who sees boone as sort of his salvation in life although boone is only in deadend job as gardener of peoples homes whale views him as the ideal man not only one that is goodlooking even though it is this attraction that first begins his feelings but one that will actually listen him since whale lives only his loyal but disapproving maid touchingly portrayed lynn redgrave it is boone that whale can talk in his ultimate reclusion from the world and the only reason whale finally decides attend the gathering of george cuckor although an extremely fine and mature picture few small elements hold the back from ultimate greatness it is appreciated that the does not pull for any obvious or overly dramatic story developments but it is little thin and the structuring of the onagainoffagain friendship at the films center is fairly predictable we know early on where these two characters are headed and we can guess that there will be final confrontation between the two as the tension slowly builds in lesser hands this setup might have felt too calculated but it is not in the surprisingly deft treatment and writing that helps the be much more than this also subplot is briefly brought up between clayton and waitress working at bar effectively played lolita davidovich but abruptly dropped and never brought up again if the was not going follow up on this side story then it perhaps should have been taken out altogether gods and monsters is heartfelt and intelligent motion picture impressively directed bill condon who sense relates or fully understands the meaning behind the curious relationship between whale and boone the also plays as tribute fine man who met an untimely end walking away from gods and monsters it was ian mckellens marvelous and astounding performance that left the most impression on me and doubt there could have been anyone who could have stepped into the role more fully and believably it is sad testament when persons true talent and love is unfairly taken away from them based on the scrutinization and judgement of their personal life ironically enough is no one elses business in the first place

i must admit that was tad skeptical of good will hunting based both on the previews and the first fifteen minutes of the in the main character will hunting matt damon an mit janitor in his early twenties is discovered be an einsteinlevel closet genius when he solves two extraordinarily difficult math problems overnight the only problem is that will is tough street kid who is had his share of runins the law and before long he is being hauled in for assault after parking lot fight professor lambeau stellan skarsgard who had brought up the math problems in his lectures tracks him down and strikes deal the police will is be released provided he works lambeau on his math research regularly and attends therapy sessions this sounds like the formula for mildly charming fluff but good will hunting rises above its fairly mundane premise deliver poignant and clever drama conflict gradually emerges between lambeau and wills therapist sean mcguire robin williams lambeau wants get will use his brain while sean wants him listen his heart both of he has been largely neglecting will finds that the former is much easier than the latter so much so in fact that he gets bored it and grows increasingly resistant lambeaus attempts recruit him into the academic lifestyle he also has his share of problems his girlfriend skylar minnie driver an mit student who is moving california at the end of the school year and would like reluctant will come her what makes good will hunting work so well aside from the strong performances especially from damon and williams is the depth of characterization and the representation of the conflicts in wills life the scripts sympathies seem lie more sean mcguire than lambeau but neither of them is presented as completely right or wrong lambeau while he may seem little cold at times is still written well enough that we like him as character even when we are not sure if we like what he has say and sean for all his warmheartedness has as lambeau and later will point out not lived up his full intellectual potential either the therapy sessions turn out be just as revelatory for sean as they do for will wills reaction this situation and the way in he slowly becomes more receptive skylar and sean is presented in believable fashion and in way that forces the audience consider all the characters opinions rather than setting up an obvious right and wrong side and beating them over the head it for such an extraordinary character good will hunting presents itself as remarkably ordinary it achieves the difficult task of making the next albert einstein into an everyman character whom the audience can easily relate and who must make choices similar those that almost everyone faces at one time or another this gives us real drama when it so easily could have given us merely melodrama having the government kidnap will use him in covert spy missions or introducing some other equally farfetched situation good will hunting also has its share of fun humor such as when will in an early therapy session pretends be hypnotized and smoothly parodies the alien abduction scenarios that have become so well known in popular culture and in the one scene in government agents do in fact appear will blows them off hilariously scathing accusation of human rights violations in africa wills relationship his friends most notably chucky ben affleck is usually rather amusing if somewhat crude the has uses of the word was most likely the reason for its rrating and lends itself well the development of wills character add all this the fact that good will hunting even manages pull off an uplifting happy ending without getting excessively sentimental and you might be wondering why have not given this four stars well for one thing no matter how well damon and affleck who wrote the screenplay and director gus van sant pull it off the story is still rather contrived and not particularly original there are also few scenes that did feel bit formulaic including one that was supposed be emotional but really just seemed like the obligatory crying scene for any movie involving therapy sessions still good will hunting takes its premise lot farther than thought it would and is definitely one of the better personal dramas have seen in the last few years and as of right now it stands as one of the top five on my list of films

a cinematic version of one of john irvings novels is always cause for celebration even if as in the case of simon birch the treatment is merely suggested rather than strictly based on the book suggested means that irving author of the acclaimed the world according garp sold the rights his novel prayer for owen meany the disney machine for million but would not grant them permission use either the title or any of the character names that is an odd decisionirving claims it is protect both himself and the novelbut it is one that does not unduly harm the finished product irvings books are rich and complex works full of intriguing colorful characters prayer for owen meany is no exception it tells the story of an unusual boycalled simon birch in the versionwho is uncommonly small in stature and possesses highpitched falsetto voice like strangled mice simon believes himself be gods instrument placed on this earth somehow effect gods plan simon is played ian michael smith who suffers from rare enzyme disorder known as morquio syndrome among other things prevents bones ligaments and joints from developing normally smiths debilitating disease makes him an obvious physical choice for simon birch however the producers unwisely favored form over functionsmiths acting abilities are limited at best another drawback is that in the book simons condition is described the way irving describes any of his charactersin careful loving detail watching simon birch however creates different feeling altogether the audience is forced into voyeuristic relationship the character surely something irving would not have intended simon himself tends be too cute and irritating combination of smiths rookie status as an actor and the precocious oneliners he is forced deliver courtesy mark steven johnson the films director and screenwriter fortunately simon birch is not the real star of the that bears his name simon is more of catalyst allowing his costars shape the story and the actors who fill those roles turn in outstanding supporting performances saving the from an obsequious manipulative destiny first and foremost is joseph mazzello jurassic park who is nothing less than remarkable as simons best friend joe mazzello turns in wonderfully layered performance for year old ripe laughter pain and tears he is certainly an emerging talent ashley judd positively beams in her role as rebecca joes single mother and oliver platt is warm and tender as her boyfriend ben david strathairn and jan hooks play the towns reverend and sunday school teacher respectively and their contributions uphold the high standards set the others there is even surprising yet effective uncredited cameo performance from well that would be telling perhaps suggested the novel is the appropriate way go after all since simon birch only focuses on one chapter one year of simons extraordinary life the also changes the books ending one that is more melodramatic yet necessary given simons lot the flavor of irvings original novel remains howeverthe passions friendships and insecurities that come change of seasons the little community of gravestown maine and the engaging oddballs both big and small who reside there

the only historical figure that has been written about more than william shakespeare is jesus christ explains why the bards materials are such popular source for remakes revisions rewrites inspiration subtlety credit and dispute indeed in recent years american contemporary cinema has been swamped wash of shakespearean products including this years upcoming midsummer nights dream shakespeares material has been the cause for twentysix big screen productions since but for change of pace mrs brown director john madden gives us story of the bard himself in the wonderfully vibrant shakespeare in love marc norman and tom stoppards story is largely fantasy although as the viewer soon learns shakespeare in love is not movie that takes itself seriously will shakespeare of the would have been married anne hathaway and he would have had teenage daughter and two young sons here he is bachelor played joseph fiennes will is writer struggling come up great play and his current comedy in the works romeo and ethel the pirates daughter just does not quite seem right the help of the great writer christopher marlowe rupert everett and the inspiration of true love noblewoman viola de lesseps gwyneth paltrow he changes things around and writes one of his greatest tragedies romeo and juliet the love story between will and viola loosely parallels the story of romeo and juliet great effect fiennes and paltrow develop sexy chemistry as the two lovers gives the movie much momentum this momentum smoothes out the bumps in the unfinished and largely unsuccessful comedy the supporting roles are well filled out from geoffrey rush as wills worrisome agent philip tom wilkinson as the producer hugh fennyman even ben affleck leading the troupe of actors manages make favorable impression and judi dench lends some brief moments of screen time as queen elizabeth gwyneth paltrow is far however the standout of the lot creating large percentage of the forementioned vibrance the story is wellcrafted if nothing else although it has dangerous moments where it flirts the let us make movie genre the dialogue is breezy and lighthearted and certainly accessible the audiences lowest common denominator there is something for everyone in this romantic comedy making it prime date flick material although certainly not inspiring in any regard it revels in wholesome wellrounded atmosphere that has been absent in many of pictures the truelove story is one of the best around certainly recommendable when the traditional slew of indifferent yearsopen releases is just around the corner
